article: LIMA  Nov 24 Two major magnitude 7.6 earthquakes struck the Peruvian-Brazilian border in the Amazon basin within minutes of each other on Tuesday  the U.S. Geological Survey said  but there were no immediate reports of damage.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-German watchdog probes Apple and Amazon audiobooks agreement
article: FRANKFURT  Nov 16 Germany's Federal Cartel Office has begun an investigation into Apple Inc's  arrangement with Amazon for purchasing audiobooks  the competition watchdog said in a statement on Monday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon takes on UK supermarkets with 'Pantry' offer
article: LONDON Online retailer Amazon has stepped up the pressure on Britain's traditional supermarkets with the nationwide launch on Friday of a packaged groceries offer for Amazon Prime members.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon may export delivery lessons from India to cut costs abroad
article: BENGALURU  India E-commerce giant Amazon.com  is taking lessons learnt from its daily battles with India's choked roads and cramped cities to some of its largest developed markets  exporting a model of cheaper deliveries and reduced warehousing costs.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon expands restaurant delivery service to Los Angeles
article: Nov 10 Amazon.com Inc said on Tuesday it will expand its restaurant delivery service to Los Angeles after having recently launched that business in Portland and Seattle.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon to open its first-ever physical book store in Seattle
article: Amazon.com Inc is set to open its first physical book store in Seattle on Tuesday  the company said.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon to stop offering daily deals
article: Online retailer Amazon.com Inc said it would stop selling daily deals on its Amazon Local website and app  starting Dec. 18.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon Prime Now drivers sue for unpaid overtime
article: SAN FRANCISCO Four drivers for Amazon.com's  Prime Now service filed a proposed class action lawsuit against the company on Tuesday  claiming the online retailer wrongly classified them as independent contractors and owes unpaid overtime.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Futures rise after Alphabet  Microsoft  Amazon impress
article: Oct 23 U.S. stock index futures were higher on Friday after strong quarterly results from Alphabet  Microsoft and Amazon fueled a broad rally across the technology sector.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon posts second straight profit powered by Web Services
article: E-commerce company Amazon.com Inc  on Thursday recorded a surprise profit for the second quarter in a row  propelled by higher sales in North America and its cloud computing business  and its shares rose 11 percent.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Ebay quarterly revenue falls 2.4 pct
article: Oct 21 EBay Inc  facing intensifying competition from Amazon.com Inc as well as from traditional retailers  reported a 2.4 percent fall in revenue in its first quarterly results since the spinoff of its PayPal payments business.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon says creating more than 100 000 jobs for holiday season
article: Amazon.com Inc said it is creating 100 000 seasonal jobs across its network of fulfillment and sortation centers in the United States to meet increased customer demand during the holiday season.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon poised to win big as India launches annual festive shopping spree
article: MUMBAI Amazon.com Inc  could emerge as the biggest winner from one of India's most important festive - and shopping - seasons  after the e-tailer offered steep discounts  swift delivery and even gold bars to grab market share.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon launches platform to build apps for 'Internet of Things'
article: Amazon.com Inc's cloud business  Amazon Web Services  has launched a service to help customers build applications to connect devices through the cloud  the so-called "Internet of Things".

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Etsy doubles down on manufacturing as it faces off with Amazon
article: SAN FRANCISCO Etsy Inc  the online store that made its name selling handmade crafts  is trying to stop merchants from defecting as giant rival Amazon.com Inc prepares to attack it on its own ground with a new site for artisanal items called Handmade.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon signs content licensing deal with CBS for three new shows
article: Oct 1 Amazon.com Inc signed a content licensing deal with CBS Corp for three new shows  the latest move in the e-commerce giant's attempt to cater to the rising popularity of on-demand content.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: MEDIA-Amazon UK services denies breaking UK air transport rules -FT
article: -- Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: African nations and donors agree plan to protect Congo forests
article: OSLO Six African nations have agreed with donors on a plan to protect the tropical forests of the Congo basin  the second biggest in the world after the Amazon's  to help ease poverty and combat climate change.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon announces TV pilot lineup for fall season
article: Amazon.com Inc will launch six TV show pilots for its video streaming service in the United States  the UK  Germany and Austria for the 2015 fall pilot season.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Sears names ex-Amazon exec to new fulfillment post
article: Sears Holdings Corp named a former logistics executive at Amazon.com to a new senior role as the retailer seeks to revive itself by focusing on a loyalty program that hinges on integrating its online and store operations.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon announces low-cost tablet  new Fire TV
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc on Thursday introduced a $50 tablet  a price tag analysts said was low enough to set it apart in a crowded market and draw more customers to its online services.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Target challenges Amazon  enters grocery delivery with Instacart
article: CHICAGO Target Corp said on Tuesday it has partnered with Instacart Inc to deliver groceries for as little as $3.99 per order  as it overhauls its food business and competes with Amazon.com Inc's grocery delivery service.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: In North Korea  deals on the bus make markets go round
article: SEOUL It's not Amazon or FedEx  but in North Korea's fledgling market economy a fleet of repurposed old passenger buses is the next best thing for moving trade goods  from rice to textiles and livestock  between far-flung corners of the country.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon jumps into restaurant delivery in Seattle
article: SAN FRANCISCO Online retailer Amazon.com Inc said on Tuesday it will begin offering its own restaurant delivery service to Prime members in Seattle  marking its first push into an increasingly crowded market for meal delivery known for razor-thin margins.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon plans to sell $50 tablet: WSJ
article: Online retailer Amazon.com Inc plans to release a $50 tablet in time for the holiday season  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon's 'Dash' button now effectively free
article: Amazon.com Inc said its 'Dash' button  which allows customers to place orders instantly  will now be effectively free.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon to launch video streaming service in Japan
article: Amazon.com said on Wednesday it plans to launch its video streaming service in Japan for members of its Prime paid service as it gears up for Netflix Inc's planned entry into the country in September.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon to launch video streaming service in Japan - Nikkei
article: Aug 26 Amazon.com plans to launch its video streaming service in Japan for members of its Prime paid service as it gears up for Netflix Inc's planned entry into the country in September  the Nikkei reported.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon expands Prime Now  offers U.S. alcohol for first time
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday it will begin delivering wine  beer and spirits to U.S. customers for the first time as part of its speedy delivery service  Prime Now.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Vale halts Amazon nickel mine output after court order
article: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 14 Vale SA stopped operations at its Onça Puma nickel mine in Brazil's Amazon after a Brazilian federal court on Friday ordered the halt because of disputed payments to indigenous communities.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon quietly shutters product ads that drove traffic to outside sites
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc quietly shuttered a pay-per-click advertising programme that allowed businesses to divert traffic from the retailer's platform to their own websites on Tuesday  saying it would permanently discontinue the programme in October.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Growth of ecommerce pushes funds into small-fry shipping firms
article: NEW YORK Forget Amazon and its out-of-this-world share price.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: New York settles lawsuits on online sales of real-looking toy guns
article: NEW YORK A handful of large U.S. online retailers including Wal-Mart Stores Inc and Amazon.com Inc have agreed to pay more than $300 000 in fines for selling realistic-looking toy guys to New York residents  the state's attorney general said on Monday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Clarkson and 'Top Gear' presenters sign with Amazon for new car show
article: LONDON Britain's former BBC "Top Gear" host Jeremy Clarkson has signed an exclusive deal with Amazon to present a new motoring show for the online retailer's subscription service alongside co-presenters Richard Hammond and James May.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Alibaba cloud unit sets sights on Amazon in $1 billion global push
article: BEIJING China's Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  said on Wednesday it would invest $1 billion into its Aliyun cloud computing arm to challenge Amazon.com Inc's  lucrative Web Services division  opening a global front in the battle between the two e-commerce giants.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon partners with startups to sell crowdfunded products
article: SAN FRANCISCO  July 28 Amazon.com Inc  launched a new platform on Tuesday that will help startups advertise and distribute their products directly to millions of Amazon customers  filling an important gap for entrepreneurs trying to reach a wider market of consumers.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon posts anomalous profit  Wall Street swoons
article: SAN FRANCISCO Investor enthusiasm for Amazon.com Inc  is pretty consistent: the stock tends to rise  even though the company isn't consistent about making profits.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Cloud services seen growth driver for Amazon
article: Amazon.com Inc's shares surged more than 20 percent in early trading on Friday  adding more than $46 billion to the company's market value  after strong growth in the e-commerce giant's cloud business drove a surprise quarterly profit. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon.com CEO Bezos up $8 billion  down $4 billion on stock swing
article: NEW YORK Amazon.com founder and Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos got a lot richer while he slept on Thursday night  after the company reported its quarterly earnings and its shares rose 20.1 percent.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: UPDATE 3-Amazon shares soar on surprise profit  market value above Wal Mart's
article: July 23 Amazon.com Inc shares surged more than 17 percent on Thursday as the online retailer posted an unexpected quarterly profit  pushing its market value above that of Wal-Mart Stores Inc  the world's largest retailer.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Macy's to expand same-day delivery to new U.S. markets  challenging Amazon
article: CHICAGO/SAN FRANCISCO Macy's Inc  is expanding same-day delivery to several new U.S. markets this summer  one of the most aggressive pushes by a brick-and-mortar retailer in an area dominated by e-commerce giant Amazon   according to a Macy's official. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon says Prime Day orders beat last year's Black Friday
article: Amazon.com Inc said customers ordered 34.4 million items worldwide during its highly publicized Prime Day sale  breaking the record set by last year's Black Friday sale.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon's Prime Day draws big virtual crowd  frustrates some shoppers
article: Merchants participating in Amazon.com's much-advertised "Prime Day" sale saw an 80 percent rise in U.S. sales from a year earlier  according to preliminary data from e-commerce researcher ChannelAdvisor  although the event also drew ire from some shoppers.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St higher as healthcare  energy stocks rally
article: * JPMorgan profit beats estimates; Wells Fargo revenue misses

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Wal-Mart takes on Amazon's 'Prime Day' with online sale
article: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  will launch a three-month online sale on Wednesday to take on Amazon.com Inc's  "Prime Day"  a highly publicized shopping event for members of Amazon Prime shipping and digital content service the same day.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon must face trademark lawsuit over search results
article: Amazon.com Inc must face a trademark lawsuit brought by a watchmaker which says the online retailer's search results can cause confusion for potential customers  a federal appeals court ruled.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon launches one-hour delivery service in London
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc launched its one-hour delivery service  Prime Now  for select areas of London on Tuesday and said it would expand the program to additional cities in the United Kingdom by the end of the year.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Exclusive: Amazon to offer loans to sellers in China  7 other countries
article: CHICAGO Amazon.com Inc will launch its business loan program for small sellers later this year in eight more countries including China  where credit is becoming a key factor in competing for new vendors and grabbing market share.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Consumer Discretionary hedging activity up ahead of earnings
article: NEW YORK Investors who have the most to win if Amazon  Disney and other consumer discretionary companies continue to push the sector higher are getting increasingly nervous  judging by their options activity.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: As Amazon  eBay remove Confederate flags  Nazi items on sale
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 24 Amazon.com Inc  and eBay Inc sharply cut the number of Confederate flag products on their sites a day after vowing to remove them  but in a sign of the difficulty of removing controversial content  Nazi-era memorabilia are listed on both sites.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon  Google join retailers in banning Confederate flag
article: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc joined Amazon.com Inc and eBay Inc on Tuesday in pulling Confederate flag merchandise from their shopping site  following brick and mortar retailers in reacting to last week's racially motivated mass shooting at a historic black South Carolina church. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Oracle extends cloud offerings  looks to compete with Amazon.com
article: Oracle Corp founder and Executive Chairman Larry Ellison said his database company is expanding its cloud-computing offerings  bringing Oracle into more direct competition with Amazon.com Inc.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon insists federal rules apply to U.S. deliveries by drone
article: WASHINGTON Amazon.com  seeking to bolster its efforts to deliver products via drone  said on Tuesday that states and local communities should not be allowed to regulate unmanned aerial systems (UAS) authorized by federal aviation regulators.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon considering paying people to deliver packages: WSJ
article: Amazon Inc is developing a mobile application that would pay ordinary people  rather than courier companies  to deliver packages en route to other destinations  the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: EU anti-trust chief warns Amazon  wary about telecom mergers
article: PARIS  June 15 Europe's anti-trust chief warned Amazon on Monday against using its dominance to thwart rivals  a week after launching an investigation into the U.S. online retailer's ebook deals with publishers.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Google launches a YouTube built for gamers
article: Google Inc  said on Friday that it is launching a live streaming gaming service called "YouTube Gaming"  creating a rival to Amazon.com Inc's  Twitch service.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Appeals court approves of early Amazon.com win in patent suit
article: The nation's top patent court has once again given the nod to a lower court's decision to rule early on in a case that an invention was not eligible to be patented and should not have received a patent in the first place.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon  Google race to get your DNA into the cloud
article: NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc is in a race against Google Inc to store data on human DNA  seeking both bragging rights in helping scientists make new medical discoveries and market share in a business that may be worth $1 billion a year by 2018. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Madrona taps Amazon  Microsoft alumni for new $300 million venture fund
article: SAN FRANCISCO Seattle-based Madrona Venture Group said it has raised $300 million for a new fund  its sixth  drawing on the growing start-up community in the backyard it shares with Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Nokia launches localised datacenter service for telecoms firms
article: HELSINKI Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia launched a new localised datacenter service for mobile network operators on Monday  enabling the operators to better compete with the likes of Amazon and Google in providing internet services.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon offers limited free shipping on same-day delivery orders
article: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it will offer limited free same-day delivery under its Prime shipping service as retailers try to outdo each other on delivery deals  and expanded the service to San Diego and the Tampa Bay Area.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon's Europe changes to boost tax bill  add secrecy
article: LONDON Amazon’s decision to change its tax-efficient European business structure could raise its tax bill by as much as $100 million a year but authorities will have to fight for additional money and any payments will be hidden from public view.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon changes tax practices in Europe as investigations continue: WSJ
article: NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc has started booking revenue from retail sales in individual European countries  instead of channeling all sales through low-tax Luxembourg  the Wall Street Journal reported Sunday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Searching for the next Alibaba in India
article: MUMBAI Indian e-commerce firms are offering funding help and tech support to woo small retailers  emulating a strategy used by Chinese online retail giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd to expand into the towns and villages home to the majority of consumers.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: RPT-Wal-Mart eyes Amazon in potentially costly e-commerce battle
article: May 19 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said that it would take a different approach to online growth than Amazon.com Inc by using its large network of stores as distribution points.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Fund managers make big bet on high-end malls via Simon
article: NEW YORK Even as the rise of online retailers such as Amazon.com Inc leads analysts to predict the eventual death of the American shopping mall  real estate fund managers are betting some will prosper – if they can lure the right kind of consumer.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Wal-Mart challenges Amazon with unlimited shipping service for $50 per year
article: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc is planning to test a new unlimited online shipping service this summer for $50 per year  a move that may hurt Amazon's annual $99 Prime shipping service.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: U.S. private payrolls growth eases; productivity falls
article: WASHINGTON U.S. private employers in April hired the fewest number of workers in more than a year  further diminishing hopes of a strong rebound in economic growth after the first-quarter slump.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Groupon's full-year revenue forecast below views  hit by dollar
article: Groupon Inc  forecast full-year revenue well below analyst expectations on Tuesday  hurt by a stronger dollar and weaker-than-expected billings  a key metric reflecting the gross amount collected from customers.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Jeff Bezos' rocket company test-flies suborbital spaceship
article: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. Blue Origin  a startup space company owned by Amazon.com chief Jeff Bezos  launched an experimental suborbital spaceship from Texas  the first in a series of test flights to develop commercial unmanned and passenger spaceflight services  the company said on Thursday. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon.com launches new marketplace for U.S businesses
article: CHICAGO  April 28 Amazon.com Inc is launching a marketplace on Tuesday that will connect individual businesses with suppliers  giving it access to a fast-growing market worth more than $8.2 trillion in the United States.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon revenue beats  cloud computing more profitable than expected
article: Amazon.com Inc's first-quarter revenue grew more than expected as rising sales in North America and its burgeoning cloud-computing services unit offset new business investments  boosting its shares nearly 7 percent.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon  HarperCollins reach multi-year publishing deal: WSJ
article: E-commerce company Amazon.com Inc and publisher HarperCollins have reached a new multi-year publishing deal that covers both print and digital titles  The Wall Street Journal reported  citing HarperCollins.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: China's Tencent hits $200 billion market cap for first time
article: BEIJING China's Tencent Holdings Ltd for the first time hit a market cap of more than $200 billion on Monday  making it more valuable than U.S. tech firms like Amazon.com Inc  IBM Corp and Oracle Corp.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: MEDIA-Amazon acquired data migration startup Amiato last year - Bloomberg
article: -- Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon sues to block alleged fake reviews on its website
article: April 9 Amazon.com Inc has sued four websites to stop them from selling fake  positive product reviews.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon sued in California over docked wages for warehouse workers
article: A proposed class action filed against Amazon.com claims the company is committing wage theft by docking hourly employees at its California warehouses for 30 minutes of wages or paid time off each time they miss a three-minute grace-period for clocking in.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Jeff Bezos' rocket company to begin suborbital test flights this year
article: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. A space company owned by Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos has finished work on a rocket engine for a suborbital spaceship and expects to begin flight tests this year  Blue Origin officials said on Tuesday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Alibaba-backed ShopRunner gains momentum  eyes China
article: SAN MATEO  Calif. ShopRunner Inc  the e-commerce startup backed by Alibaba Group Holding Ltd that styles itself in some ways as the anti-Amazon  more than doubled its users over the past year and hopes to do so again in 2015  Shoprunner's chief executive said in an interview.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon.com expands into professional services with home marketplace
article: CHICAGO  March 30 Amazon.com Inc is launching a home services marketplace that will connect customers with electricians  plumbers and painters in a move to have its services tied to every product sold on its website.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon in talks to buy online luxury retailer Net-a-Porter: Forbes
article: Amazon.com  is in talks to buy online luxury retailer Net-a-porter in what could be the biggest acquisition yet for the e-commerce giant  but the negotiations are in early stages and could fall apart  Forbes reported  citing a person familiar with the matter.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon blasts U.S. agency for slowness on drone regulation
article: WASHINGTON E-commerce power Amazon.com blasted federal regulators on Tuesday for being slow to approve commercial drone testing  saying the United States is falling behind other countries in the potentially lucrative area of unmanned aviation technology.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: U.S. regulators give Amazon go-ahead for drone tests
article: SEATTLE Amazon.com Inc has won approval from U.S. federal regulators to test a delivery drone outdoors  as the e-commerce company pursues its goal of sending packages to customers by air  even as it faces public concern about safety and privacy.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Boeing eyes satellite deal with tech giant this year
article: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  on Monday said it could clinch a deal this year to build a high-throughput communications satellite for top technology companies such as Google Inc   Amazon.com Inc   Facebook Inc  or Apple Inc .

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: German retailer REWE steels for Amazon move into food
article: COLOGNE  Germany Germany's second-biggest supermarket group REWE is investing heavily in grocery ecommerce even though it does not expect to turn a profit soon  as it braces for Amazon to expand its food delivery service.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon opens store on Alibaba's online marketplace Tmall
article: March 5 Amazon.com Inc has opened an online store on Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's  fast-growing online marketplace  Tmall.com as it seeks to expand in China  an Alibaba spokesman said.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Venture capitalist Doerr testifies in Kleiner sexism case
article: SAN FRANCISCO Venture capitalist John Doerr on Tuesday sought to fend off allegations of sexism at his firm  Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers  in testimony in a gender discrimination lawsuit targeting the firm.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Former HP chairman admits 'mistake' in venture firm sexism trial
article: SAN FRANCISCO Onetime highflying tech executive Ray Lane testified on Monday during a sex discrimination trial involving his former employer  Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers  that he made a mistake in judgment involving the harassment of a female venture capitalist at the firm.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon hires former Obama press secretary Carney: Politico
article: WASHINGTON Amazon.com Inc has hired President Barack Obama's former spokesman Jay Carney as senior vice president for worldwide corporate affairs  Politico reported on Thursday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Chinese rivals snap at Alibaba's heels in cross-border e-commerce race
article: SHANGHAI A Chinese government push to promote e-commerce has created a host of online retail rivals for Alibaba Group Holding Ltd and Amazon.com Inc catering to shoppers' fears about the quality and safety of local everyday goods.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Kleiner firm was not level playing field for women  jury told
article: SAN FRANCISCO Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers  the investment firm that has backed tech companies from Google to Amazon  fired a woman junior partner after she complained of gender discrimination  her lawyer said at trial on Tuesday. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Target halves order size for free shipping to $25
article: Feb 23 Target Corp halved the size of online orders eligible for free shipping to $25  undercutting Amazon.com Inc and traditional rival Wal-Mart Stores Inc as it focuses on its online business.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Exclusive - Survey: Trouble for Amazon Prime's two-day deliveries?
article: SAN FRANCISCO/CHICAGO Amazon.com Inc packages ordered by its Prime members regularly arrived late during the holidays  a Reuters/Ipsos survey shows  reflecting the strain on the logistics network that transformed the company into an e-commerce powerhouse.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Exclusive-Survey: Trouble for Amazon Prime's two-day deliveries?
article: SAN FRANCISCO/CHICAGO Amazon.com Inc packages ordered by its Prime members regularly arrived late over the holidays  a Reuters/Ipsos survey shows  reflecting the strain on the logistics network that transformed the company into an e-commerce powerhouse.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Market Chatter-Corporate finance press digest
article: Feb 3 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media:

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Wall St. closes down for January  Shake Shack rallies in debut
article: NEW YORK U.S. stocks closed down on Friday after a volatile session as investors worried at the end of a rough month for the market about weak U.S. growth data and whether instability in Europe could hurt corporate earnings in the United States. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon sales rise in holiday quarter  shares jump
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc reported stronger than expected earnings on Thursday as North American sales surged during the crucial holiday quarter  sending its shares up 9 percent.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon pulls private diaper brand to change design
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Jan 21 Amazon.com Inc  pulled its private-label diapers to fix design flaws less than two months after launching the products  the company said on Wednesday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon doubles down on entertainment with 'indie' movie bet
article: Amazon.com Inc is making a high-stakes foray into the challenging realm of independent movies  the latest step in its attempt to move beyond simply distributing digital entertainment content to creating it.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: EU says part of Amazon's Luxembourg tax deal 'cosmetic'
article: BRUSSELS Luxembourg took just two weeks to sign off a partly cosmetic deal that allowed Amazon  to shift a large part of its European profits to an untaxed entity  according to EU antitrust regulators.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: EU to publish details of probe into Amazon's Luxembourg tax deal
article: BRUSSELS European Union antitrust regulators will publish details on Friday of their investigation into online retailer Amazon's tax-minimising arrangements with Luxembourg.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: After awards coup  Amazon lands Woody Allen for TV series
article: LOS ANGELES/SAN FRANCISCO Woody Allen will make his first foray onto the small screen  writing and directing an online series for Amazon.com  the latest coup by deep-pocketed cable and streaming companies in luring the biggest names in film to television.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon's Golden Globes give it new credibility in Hollywood
article: SAN FRANCISCO/LOS ANGELES Amazon.com Inc's success at Sunday's Golden Globe Awards may help it win over two key audiences: Hollywood’s A-list talent and the shopping customers the retailer wants to join its Prime membership program.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon's path to TV success takes cues from old school Hollywood
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon prides itself on being a company that breaks the rules  but its recent success in Hollywood also reflects an embrace of a more traditional  old-fashioned script.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Fire extinguished at Amazon data center under construction
article: A fire on Friday at an Amazon.com Inc data center under construction in Virginia was quickly extinguished and all workers at the site left safely  the company and county officials said.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon draws 10 million new Prime members over holidays
article: Amazon.com Inc said on Friday it drew more than 10 million new members to its Prime shipping and digital content service over the holidays and intends to offer one-hour shipping to more cities in 2015.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: RPT-U.S. retailers likely to just meet holiday sales forecasts -experts
article: CHICAGO  Dec 24 U.S. consumers have not turned out in force for the final shopping days before Christmas  suggesting that traditional retailers will just meet industry sales forecasts in a season marked by deep discounts and growing encroachment from online rivals led by Amazon.com Inc.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: U.S. retailers likely to just meet holiday sales forecasts: experts
article: CHICAGO U.S. consumers have not turned out in force for the final shopping days before Christmas  suggesting that traditional retailers will just meet industry sales forecasts in a season marked by deep discounts and growing encroachment from online rivals led by Amazon.com Inc .

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Flipkart raises $700 million in fresh funding
article: MUMBAI Flipkart  India's largest online retailer  on Saturday said it had raised funding worth $700 million  as it tries to compete with Amazon  which is rapidly scaling up operations in the country.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon staff in Germany extend strike to Christmas Eve
article: FRANKFURT Amazon staff at three German warehouses will extend their strike until Christmas Eve to increase pressure on the online retailer in a long-running dispute over pay and conditions  labor union Verdi said on Friday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Stores fight back as Christmas delivery delays hit e-tailers
article: BERLIN/PARIS  Dec 18 The Christmas rush is exposing the limitations of internet-only retailers as surging orders cause delivery delays  allowing Europe's shops to fight back with "click and collect" services and more in-store theatre.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Amazon workers in Germany extend strike
article: BERLIN Amazon staff at German warehouses extended a strike on Wednesday in a long-running dispute over better pay and conditions  but the online retailer promised it would be able to deliver Christmas orders on time.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Seattle police find no explosives after Amazon HQ threat
article: SEATTLE Seattle police searched for explosives at Amazon.com's headquarters after a threatening letter was found at a company building just north of the city's downtown district  but found nothing  authorities said on Monday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: UPDATE 3-Seattle police find no explosives after Amazon HQ threat

But the tactic could raise costs - and create problems managing inventory  retail analysts and consultants said.

article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc's cloud computing unit may be its next billion-dollar business and analysts will be watching for clues on how fast this secretive unit is growing when the Internet retailer reports results next week.

headline: Borders liquidation approved by bankruptcy judge
article: NEW YORK Borders Group Inc   won bankruptcy court approval on Thursday to liquidate its 40-year-old business  effectively spelling the end for the second-largest U.S. book retailer.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Exclusive: Google offers credit card to advertisers
article: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc is introducing a credit card for its advertising customers  offering its clients a credit line to try and drum up business as competition in the online ad market heats up.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Borders demise seen a small help to Barnes & Noble
article: NEW YORK Bookstore chain Barnes & Noble Inc  will eventually feel a modest boost from the liquidation of its largest rival  Borders Group Inc  but still faces stiff competition and an industrywide decline in book sales  Wall Street analysts said.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Borders  unable to find white knight  to liquidate
article: NEW YORK Borders Group Inc  the second-largest U.S. bookstore chain  said it has canceled an upcoming bankruptcy auction and will close its doors for good.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Astronauts pack up for last shuttle ride home
article: HOUSTON The shuttle Atlantis astronauts finished packing more than 2 tonnes of old equipment and trash from the International Space Station into a cargo hauler on Sunday for the last shuttle ride back to Earth. | Video

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Apple stock looks cheap ahead of results
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc  should deliver yet another bumper quarter  but some investors are holding out for a monstrous second half when the new iPhone hits and a new online content service takes wing.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: S.Korea-Market Factors to watch July 15
article: July 15 Following is a list of events in South Korea as well as news stories and press reports which may influence financial markets. (Reuters News welcomes your feedback and for any queries  please contact the Seoul newsroom at +822 3704 5640 or via email at kr.rtrs@gmail.com)   	 Bank of Korea's revised H2 forecasts	 BOK revisits its second-half economic forecasts in three months  after the finance ministry lifted its 2011 inflation forecast to 4.0 percent from about 3.0 percent a

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Netflix raises DVD  streaming plan price by 60 percent
article: LOS ANGELES Netflix Inc hiked monthly prices for customers who use both its mail and online services  a move that could steer users toward its growing Internet streaming service.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: EBay sales strong in June: report
article: SAN FRANCISCO Retailers generated strong sales growth through eBay Inc  Inc in June  e-commerce software company ChannelAdvisor said on Monday.

name: Amazoncom Inc
headline: Judge rejects Apple bid for injunction against Amazon
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge denied Apple Inc's attempt to quickly stop online retailer Amazon.com Inc from using the "App Store" name  according to a court document.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen antibody shows promise in myeloma trial  gets FDA fast track
article: SAN DIEGO Amgen Inc  updating the first trial of its bispecific antibody for multiple myeloma  said on Monday seven out of 10 patients given the second-highest dose of AMG420 responded to the drug  including four with no detectable cancer.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Coherus prices biosimilar to Amgen's Neulasta at 33 percent discount
article: Coherus BioSciences Inc said on Thursday it would price its biosimilar to Amgen Inc's infection-fighting treatment  Neulasta  at a 33 percent discount.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen posts higher quarterly EPS  Repatha sales fall short
article: Amgen Inc  on Tuesday said stock buybacks lifted its third-quarter earnings per share  but operating income fell as expenses rose and sales of some key products declined.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Amgen cuts U.S. price of cholesterol drug Repatha by 60 percent
article: Oct 24 Amgen Inc  looking to boost use of its potent cholesterol drug Repatha  has cut the medication's U.S. list price by 60 percent to $5 850  the biotechnology company said on Wednesday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen  Novartis kick off fight for AbbVie blockbuster drug in EU
article: LONDON Rival versions of the world’s top-selling drug  AbbVie's Humira  went on sale in Europe on Tuesday  years ahead of similar cut-price copies being available in the United States.

name: Amgen Inc

name: Amgen Inc

article: Amgen Inc  on Thursday reported a better-than-expected second quarter profit and raised its full-year earnings forecast  and its chief executive pledged not to raise drug prices again this year.

The ratings apply to $34.5 billion of debt outstanding at Mar. 31  2016. A full  list of Amgen's ratings can be found at the end of this release. article: Amgen Inc on Wednesday said it filed with U.S. health regulators seeking approval to sell its first biosimilar drug  which would be a less expensive alternative to AbbVie's Humira  the world's top-selling prescription medicine.

article: Amgen Inc  on Wednesday reported much higher-than-expected third-quarter profit  helped by a 30-percent spike in revenue from the rheumatoid arthritis drug Enbrel due to price increases and inventory stocking.

article: A panel to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration unanimously backed the approval of Novartis AG's copy of Amgen Inc's blockbuster cancer drug Neupogen  setting the stage for the regulator's first approval of a biosimilar.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: FDA staff recommends Novartis copy of Amgen's Neupogen
article: Staff reviewers at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration recommended approval of Novartis AG's copy of Amgen Inc's blockbuster cancer drug Neupogen  finding no "clinically meaningful differences" between the two.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Exclusive: Amgen's new leukemia drug to carry $178 000 price tag
article: Amgen Inc on Wednesday said its new type of treatment for a deadly form of leukemia would cost about $178 000 when it becomes available on Thursday  which would make it one of the world's most expensive cancer drugs.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Addition of Amgen drug boosts benefits in relapsed myeloma: study
article: Significantly more patients with relapsed multiple myeloma responded to a three-drug regimen including Amgen Inc's Kyprolis than those who got the standard two-drug treatment  according to results from a late-stage trial.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Sandoz loses bid to shield psoriasis drug
article: The top U.S. patent appeals court has upheld the dismissal of a lawsuit brought by Sandoz Inc that sought to shield its planned version of Amgen Inc's psoriasis and arthritis drug Enbrel from patent lawsuits.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: U.S. FDA approves Amgen leukemia drug ahead of schedule
article: U.S. health regulators on Wednesday approved an Amgen Inc drug that helps the immune system fight a rare type of leukemia  more than five months ahead of the expected decision date.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen scraps trials of drug for advanced stomach cancer
article: Amgen Inc on Monday said it will scrap all trials of its experimental treatment rilotumumab in patients with advanced stomach cancer  after a safety monitoring board associated it with a higher incidence of deaths.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen psoriasis drug tops J&J's Stelara in Phase III study
article: Amgen Inc said on Tuesday that its experimental psoriasis drug  brodalumab  met all the goals of a late-stage study  clearing the rough skin patches associated with the disease more thoroughly than Johnson & Johnson's Stelara and a placebo.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen ovarian cancer drug fails to improve overall survival
article: Amgen Inc said its experimental ovarian cancer drug did not show statistically significant improvement in overall survival rate in a late-stage trial.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St jumps 1 pct  S&P ends above key level
article: * Indexes up: Dow 1.1 pct  S&P 1.2 pct  Nasdaq 1.8 pct   (Updates to close  adds Facebook results after the close)

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen profit tops Wall Street expectations; raises 2014 outlook
article: Amgen Inc  on Monday reported higher-than-expected third quarter earnings and revenue  even as net profit fell due to a hefty restructuring charge  and the company raised its full-year forecast and the number of job cuts it expects to make.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Despite Third Point  low expectations for Amgen breakup
article: Amgen Inc   one of the world's largest biotechnology companies  will unveil next week its first strategy update since early 2013  but few expect a major shift like the split-up recently proposed by Daniel Loeb's Third Point hedge fund.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Third Point's Loeb urges breakup of biotech company Amgen
article: BOSTON Hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb told investors on Tuesday he  urged U.S. biotechnology company Amgen Inc to split into two separate businesses  a move he said could boost its share price by more than 80 percent.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen's Humira copy succeeds in skin disease trial
article: Amgen Inc said its copycat version of AbbVie Inc's blockbuster biotech drug Humira showed comparable safety and ability to generate immune response in patients with a type of skin disease.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: BRIEF-UCB and Amgen announce results from several exploratory analyses of Phase 2 study of romosozumab
article: * UCB and Amgen announce results from several exploratory analyses of Phase 2 study of romosozumab

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Study raises concerns over Servier  Amgen heart drug
article: BARCELONA A major clinical study has raised concerns about a drug from private French company Servier that helps lower the heart rate and which was licensed to U.S. group Amgen last year.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen seeks U.S. approval of new cholesterol-fighting drug
article: Amgen Inc said on Thursday it applied to U.S. health regulators to sell its cholesterol fighter  evolocumab  becoming the first company to seek approval of a medicine from a closely watched new class of potent heart drugs.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Lilly psoriasis drug impresses; battle nears with Amgen  Novartis
article: An experimental new psoriasis treatment from Eli Lilly and Co proved superior to Amgen Inc's blockbuster Enbrel  drawing it closer to a potential marketing battle with new products being developed by Amgen and Novartis AG.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen parathyroid drug succeeds in late-stage trial
article: (This story corrects headline and first paragraph in Aug. 18 story to replace "thyroid" with "parathyroid"))

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen thyroid drug succeeds in late-stage trial
article: Aug 18 Drugmaker Amgen Inc said its experimental drug to reduce thyroid levels in patients with chronic kidney disease met the main goal in a late-stage trial.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Futures point to flat open after recent rally
article: * Dow down 2 pts  S&P down 0.5 pt  Nasdaq up 1.25 pt   (Updates prices  adds economic data and Putin comments)

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen drug fails to improve survival in multiple myeloma trial
article: Amgen Inc's Kyprolis drug failed to extend survival compared to standard care in a trial involving patients with advanced multiple myeloma  a type of blood cancer that develops in the bone marrow.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen blood cancer drug succeeds in late-stage study
article: Amgen Inc said a late-stage study found that its blood cancer drug helped patients live significantly longer without the disease worsening  compared with standard treatment.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen to cut up to 2 900 jobs  prepares to introduce new drugs
article: Amgen Inc  on Tuesday said it would cut up to 15 percent of its work force and close plants in a series of moves aimed at reallocating resources as it prepares to introduce new medicines it hopes will drive future growth.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen growth in Brazil picks up  eyes doubling portfolio by 2020
article: SAO PAULO Amgen Inc  the world's biggest biotechnology company  has had a surge in sales in Brazil this year and it plans to double its drug portfolio in the country by the end of the decade  the company's top local executive says.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Bind Therapeutics ends cancer drug partnership with Amgen
article: Drug developer Bind Therapeutics said it ended a partnership with Amgen Inc to develop targeted cancer therapy due to unsatisfactory results.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen psoriatic arthritis drug maintains efficacy after 1 yr -study
article: June 11 A drug being developed by Amgen Inc  for psoriatic arthritis demonstrated sustained effectiveness after a year of treatment with no new safety concerns  according to data from a midstage trial.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen names former 3M CFO Meline as finance chief
article: June 9 Amgen Inc  the world's largest biotechnology company  on Monday named manufacturing and auto industry veteran David Meline as chief financial officer.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Qiagen wins U.S. approval for test to accompany Amgen cancer drug
article: FRANKFURT U.S. health regulators on Friday approved Qiagen NV's gene-testing kit to identify those colorectal cancer patients most likely to benefit from Amgen Inc's drug  Vectibix  Qiagen said.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Fitch Rates Amgen's Unsecured Debt Issuance 'BBB'
article: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  May 19 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB' rating to Amgen  Inc.'s (Amgen) proposed $4.5 billion unsecured notes offering. Fitch expects  Amgen to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes  including funding  the repayment of preferred shares under its Master Repurchase Agreement or  outstanding term loan borrowings  and pre-funding a portion of its outstanding  1.875% unsecured notes and 4.85% unsecured notes

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Pfizer may have to pay more cash and top $105 bln to win AstraZeneca
article: * Pfizer may give more cash but limited by UK domicile move

name: Amgen Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St snaps six-day run; Apple to split stock
article: * Dow off 0.1 pct; S&P 500 down 0.2 pct; Nasdaq off 0.8 pct   (Adds Apple results  split)

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen profit falls on inventory draw downs; sales disappoint
article: Amgen Inc  on Tuesday reported lower-than-expected first quarter profit as sales of several key products fell short of Wall Street estimates  with its big-selling rheumatoid arthritis drug Enbrel particularly hard hit by inventory stocking by wholesalers late last year.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen melanoma drug fails to improve overall survival rates
article: Amgen Inc said its experimental drug to treat a deadly form of skin cancer did not significantly improve overall survival rates in patients enrolled in a late-stage study.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen ends marketing agreement with GSK for osteoporosis drug
article: Amgen Inc said it would end an agreement with GlaxoSmithKline Plc for the marketing of its osteoporosis drug in some regions outside the United States.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen drug lowers cholesterol up to 66 percent in pivotal studies
article: WASHINGTON Amgen Inc's drug from a high profile new class of experimental medicines lowered "bad" LDL cholesterol by 55 percent to 66 percent compared with a placebo in a trio of late-stage clinical trials  according to data presented on Saturday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen drug meets goal for those with high genetic cholesterol
article: Amgen Inc said its experimental new type of cholesterol-fighting drug met the primary goal of a late-stage trial by slashing "bad" LDL cholesterol levels in patients with a genetic tendency towards high levels of the artery-clogging fat.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen vaccine triggers immune response in advanced melanoma -study
article: An experimental Amgen Inc cancer vaccine used to treat advanced melanoma  the deadliest form of skin cancer  proved effective in a late-stage study in shrinking tumors in a way that suggests the drug triggered the intended systemic immune response  according to data presented on Friday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Update-Moody's: AbbVie  Amgen and Roche most exposed to biosimilar drugs market
article: Biosimilar drugs market

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen's cholesterol fighter succeeds in fifth late-stage study
article: Amgen Inc said its experimental drug from a promising new class of injectable medicines succeeded in treating patients with genetically high cholesterol levels  marking the fifth successful clinical study of the drug.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen profit tops Street expectations; focus on new drugs
article: Amgen Inc  on Tuesday reported a quarterly profit that beat Wall Street forecasts  as it gained full control of its blockbuster rheumatoid arthritis drug Enbrel and saw solid growth in sales of newer products.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen cholesterol drug meets goal of 3rd late stage trial
article: A cholesterol fighter developed by Amgen Inc from a highly promising new class of medicines significantly lowered levels of "bad" LDL cholesterol in a late stage trial in patients unable to tolerate statin drugs  the company said on Thursday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Two people hurt in explosion at lab near San Francisco
article: SAN FRANCISCO Two people were hurt on Wednesday in an explosion at an Amgen laboratory in the San Francisco Bay Area  the biotechnology company and a South San Francisco Fire Department official said.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen cholesterol drug succeeds in late-stage trial
article: Amgen Inc said its closely watched experimental cholesterol drug succeeded in reducing the level of bad cholesterol in the blood  compared to a placebo  in a late-stage trial.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: U.S. judge throws out SEC lawsuit over 'suspicious' Onyx trading
article: NEW YORK  Nov 22 Two traders have won the dismissal of a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission lawsuit accusing them of insider trading in Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc as the company considered a takeover bid from rival Amgen Inc .

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen shares slip after analyst cites Kyprolis risks
article: Shares of biotechnology company Amgen Inc  fell as much as 4 percent on Thursday amid concerns that data at an upcoming medical meeting will not help the competitive profile of its recently acquired blood cancer drug Kyprolis.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: BRIEF-Amgen presents interim overall survival data from late-stage study of talimogene laherparepvec in patients with metastatic melanoma
article: Nov 18 Amgen Inc :  * Presents interim overall survival data from late-stage study of talimogene

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Stada widens biotech drug offering with filgrastim licence
article: FRANKFURT  Oct 28 Germany's Stada  will sell a version of U.S. drugmaker Amgen's  blockbuster cancer treatment filgrastim in Europe  keeping faith with the difficult market for copies of medicines developed using biotechnology.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: U.S. drug giant Amgen raises full-year revenue outlook
article: Amgen Inc   which this month closed a nearly $10 billion acquisition of cancer drug maker Onyx Pharmaceuticals  reported higher-than-expected  third-quarter profit as results were helped by a large U.S. government order for one of its white blood cell boosters.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen  Cytokinetics heart failure drug misses goal in study
article: AMSTERDAM An experimental heart failure drug from Amgen and Cytokinetics missed its goal of improving shortness of breath in a mid-stage clinical trial  leaving its future uncertain.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Bradway's patient dealmaking brings Onyx to Amgen
article: New YORK Investment banker turned biotech chief executive  Robert Bradway  staked a claim as a savvy dealmaker with Amgen Inc's  successful acquisition of Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  for more than $10 billion.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen seeks to bolster drug pipeline with $10.4 billion Onyx buy
article: Amgen Inc  struck a deal to buy cancer drug maker Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  for about $10.4 billion on Sunday  as it moves to restock its product pipeline in response to declining sales of its flagship anemia drugs.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen close to buying Onyx for $125 per share: sources
article: Amgen Inc  is close to buying Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  for $125 per share  or more than $10 billion  in a deal that is expected to be announced as soon as Monday  two people familiar with the matter said on Saturday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Exclusive: Onyx provides drug trial data to potential bidders - sources
article: Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc has given potential buyers  including Amgen Inc  access to trial data on its new cancer drug  removing a key hurdle that was holding up deal talks  according to three people familiar with the matter.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Market Chatter-Corporate finance press digest
article: Aug 16 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Friday:

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen seeks drug trial data before finalizing Onyx deal: sources
article: NEW YORK Amgen Inc  the drugmaker in advanced discussions to buy Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  has asked Onyx for some of the data from an ongoing trial on the company's new blood cancer drug  two people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Onyx 2nd quarter loss narrows on cancer drug sales
article: Aug 8 Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  which is seeking a buyer after rejecting a takeover bid by Amgen Inc  as too low  on Thursday reported a narrower second-quarter loss on revenue from its new blood cancer drug Kyprolis.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Array says Amgen ends agreement  to cut 20 pct jobs
article: Aug 7 Array Biopharma said it would cut 20 percent of its workforce as Amgen Inc plans to end an agreement to develop and market Array's drug to treat Type 2 diabetes.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen seen raising bid to acquire Onyx Pharmaceuticals -report
article: Aug 6 Amgen Inc is expected to sweeten its offer to acquire Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc to $130 per share after its previous bid was rejected as too low  Bloomberg reported on Tuesday  citing a person familiar with the matter.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen profit tops Wall Street view; rebounds from first quarter
article: Amgen Inc   which is attempting to buy Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  to add to its cancer drug offerings  on Tuesday reported higher-than-expected second- quarter profit as sales of many of its medicines rebounded from a disappointing first quarter.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Exclusive: Amgen lines up BofA  JPM  Barclays to finance Onyx deal -sources
article: NEW YORK Amgen Inc  the world's largest biotechnology company  has lined up Bank of America Corp  JPMorgan Chase & Co and Barclays Plc to finance a potential deal for Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  according to three people familiar with the matter.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: DEALTALK-Biotech takeover interest more fad than fashion
article: July 19 Investors betting on a wave of big biotechnology deals following Amgen Inc's $10 billion bid for Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc may well be disappointed.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Exclusive: Pfizer not moving forward with Onyx bid: sources
article: NEW YORK Pfizer Inc decided not to pursue a bid for Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc this week  according to two people familiar with the matter  leaving Amgen Inc in the front position to buy the cancer drugmaker.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Initial takeover bids for Onyx seen as soon as this week: sources
article: NEW YORK Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  is expected to receive initial takeover bids as soon as this week after attracting interest from a few drugmakers  including Amgen Inc   according to several people familiar with the matter.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Novartis psoriasis drug superior to Enbrel in study
article: ZURICH Novartis psoriasis drug secukinumab was superior to Amgen's Enbrel in a late-stage study  the Swiss company said on Monday  putting it in line to become the first of a clutch of new treatments to gain market approval.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-SEC alleges insider trading in Onyx ahead of Amgen offer
article: July 3 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has filed a lawsuit accusing unnamed defendants of insider trading in Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc call options before the drugmaker publicly rejected a takeover bid by larger rival Amgen Inc and put itself up for sale.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Pfizer  Novartis may join Amgen in bidding for Onyx: sources
article: NEW YORK Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc   whose cancer drugs promise a strong revenue stream  is attracting preliminary buyout interest from several large pharmaceutical companies such as Pfizer Inc  and Novartis AG   two people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Onyx explores possible sale  rejects Amgen offer
article: NEW YORK Onyx Pharmaceuticals Inc  said on Sunday it rejected a roughly $10 billion takeover offer from larger rival Amgen Inc  as too low but is still considering a sale of the company.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: U.S. biotech Amgen offered to buy Onyx for $120 per share: report
article: Amgen Inc   the world's largest biotech company  has offered to buy biotech Onyx Pharmaceuticals  for $120 per share in cash  Canadian newspaper Financial Post reported on Friday  sending Onyx shares up about 30 percent in after-hours trading.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Novartis tests copy of Amgen's Enbrel in late-stage trial
article: LONDON Sandoz  the generics unit of Novartis  has launched a late-stage trial with its biosimilar version of Amgen's Enbrel  consolidating its leading position in developing cheaper copies of complex biotech drugs.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen share buybacks  drugs may fuel more stock gains - Barron's
article: Amgen Inc   the world's largest biotechnology company  has plenty of room to grow despite a 43 percent jump in its share price over the past year  thanks to cost cuts  newer drugs and hefty share buybacks  Barron's said.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen says drug slowed ovarian cancer in trial
article: Amgen Inc's trebananib drug for ovarian cancer extended the length of time that patients lived without the disease getting worse by about two months  meeting the main goal of a late-stage clinical trial  the company said on Wednesday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen melanoma drug improved survival by 21 pct in interim look
article: CHICAGO  June 1 Data from a pivotal trial of Amgen Inc's experimental melanoma therapy shows that it improved survival by 21 percent for patients with advanced forms of the deadly skin cancer compared with a standard white blood cell-boosting drug.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Drugs from Amgen  others assessed by FDA as radiation treatments
article: Drugs from Amgen Inc  Teva Pharmaceutical Industries and Sanofi that boost white blood cells are being evaluated by U.S. regulators as treatments for radiation exposure caused by a nuclear attack or accident.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen first quarter sales disappoint  shares fall
article: Amgen Inc  on Tuesday reported first-quarter sales that fell short of Wall Street expectations for most of its biggest-selling medicines  and its shares fell more than 6 percent.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Fitch Affirms Amgen's IDR at 'BBB'; Ratings Outlook Stable
article: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  April 19 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Amgen Inc.'s (Amgen)  ratings  including the Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'BBB'. The Rating Outlook  is Stable. A full list of ratings affirmed is listed below.  The ratings apply to approximately $26.6 billion of debt at Dec. 31  2012. KEY RATING DRIVERS Amgen's gross debt leverage is currently high relative to its 'BBB' IDR. There  is limited flexibility in the rating for any incr

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Diabetes  bone  pain drugs may face German price cuts
article: FRANKFURT  April 18 Drugs from Novo Nordisk   Amgen  Bayer and other companies could face price cuts in Germany as the country's medical cost-benefit agency widens a review into the value offered by medicines.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen to pay $25 million to settle kickback allegations
article: Amgen Inc has agreed to pay $24.9 million to settle allegations that it provided kickbacks to long-term care pharmacy providers to entice them to use its Aranesp anemia drug instead of a rival medicine  the Department of Justice announced on Tuesday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen's melanoma drug shows promise in key trial
article: March 19 Amgen Inc said its experimental and novel treatment for advanced melanoma met the main goal of a late-stage clinical trial by demonstrating a durable response in significantly more patients than a comparison treatment.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Merck veteran named R&D chief  after drug setbacks
article: Merck & Co will bring back one of its veterans to head research and development  replacing retiring Peter Kim  who leaves behind a mixed record over the past decade at the drugmaker's highly respected laboratories.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen loses as top U.S. court backs class actions
article: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK The U.S. Supreme Court made it easier on Wednesday for shareholders to bring class-action lawsuits  breaking a recent line of decisions that had made it harder to sue corporate defendants collectively and perhaps obtain greater recoveries.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: FDA halts trials of Amgen drug in children  cites death
article: The Food and Drug Administration said on Tuesday it has stopped all pediatric clinical trials of Amgen Inc's Sensipar after the death of a 14-year-old patient taking part in a study of the drug.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Dow  S&P slip after uncertain Italian election
article: * Divided government in Rome could hinder euro-zone reform

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen biosimilar push takes aim at blockbusters
article: NEW YORK Amgen Inc said it expects generic versions of biotech drugs  known as biosimilars  to be a multibillion-dollar opportunity for the company and has targeted some of the industry's biggest sellers  including the main rivals for its own blockbuster rheumatoid arthritis drug Enbrel.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen 2013 revenue forecast tops Street estimates
article: Amgen Inc  on Wednesday projected revenue for 2013 that exceeds Wall Street estimates and said it was on track to deliver on its 2015 forecasts well ahead of schedule.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: BRIEF-Amgen down in extended trading after comments
article: NEW YORK  Jan 16 Amgen Inc :  * Shares down 2.7 percent in extended trading after comments

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen trims 2012 EPS estimate  citing R&D tax credit delay
article: * Company expects to return to net cash position this year

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Court approves Amgen's $762 million payment in drug case
article: NEW YORK A federal judge on Wednesday approved a $762 million payment from Amgen Inc  the final step to resolve nearly a dozen criminal and civil cases stemming from the sale of its once-blockbuster anemia drug Aranesp and several others.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen to pay $762 million  pleads guilty in marketing case
article: NEW YORK Amgen Inc pleaded guilty in a New York federal court on Tuesday for improper marketing practices involving its once top-selling Aranesp anemia drug  and prosecutors said the company has agreed to pay $762 million in a civil settlement and criminal fines.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen to plead guilty in criminal case Tuesday: prosecutors
article: NEW YORK Biotech company Amgen Inc is scheduled to plead guilty on Tuesday in a criminal case in federal court in Brooklyn  New York  prosecutors said.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen buys Icelandic gene hunter Decode for $415 million
article: LONDON U.S. biotechnology group Amgen Inc has agreed to buy unlisted Decode Genetics  a pioneer in hunting down genes linked to disease  for $415 million in cash to boost its drive to develop better targeted drugs.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen drug cut cholesterol up to 66 percent in statin patients
article: LOS ANGELES Amgen Inc's experimental cholesterol-lowering drug  AMG145  reduced levels of "bad" cholesterol up to 66 percent in patients already taking statin drugs  according to results from a mid-stage trial that were presented on Tuesday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: WRAPUP-New class of cholesterol drugs shows promise in trials
article: LOS ANGELES  Nov 5 A new class of experimental cholesterol-lowering drugs demonstrated a promising new technique for reducing levels of the artery-clogging fatty deposits in mid-stage studies.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Armstrong war of words escalates between UCI  USADA
article: A day after Lance Armstrong was stripped of his seven Tour de France titles and banned for life  the war of words between the International Cycling Union (UCI) and the United States Anti-Doping Agency (USADA) escalated. | Video

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen profit tops Street view  raises 2012 forecast
article: Amgen Inc  on Tuesday reported higher-than-expected third-quarter profit in its first full quarter under Chief Executive Robert Bradway and it raised its full-year earnings and revenue forecasts.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Omerta has to be broken  says Hamilton
article: PARIS Professional cycling has long been crippled by doping and the sport will only begin to heal when its omerta  or 'Code of Silence'  has been broken by those still in denial  according to Tyler Hamilton.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Armstrong paid motorcyclist to deliver EPO
article: LONDON Lance Armstrong paid for a motorcyclist to deliver the banned bloodbooster EPO to him during the 1999 Tour de France  former team mate Tyler Hamilton said in a BBC radio documentary broadcast on Monday.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: FDA approves Teva version of Amgen's Neupogen
article: WASHINGTON Drug regulators gave the nod to a Teva Pharmaceutical Industries drug that boosts the production of infection-fighting white blood cells in certain cancer patients receiving chemotherapy.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Cycling: Hamilton to lose 2004 gold on Friday - IOC source
article: LONDON American cyclist Tyler Hamilton will officially be stripped of his Athens 2004 Olympic gold medal on Friday as the International Olympic Committee (IOC) moves to close the case before the end of an eight-year statute of limitation  an IOC source told Reuters.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen pancreatic cancer drug lacks efficacy  trial ends
article: Amgen Inc halted a late-stage trial of an experimental drug for pancreatic cancer after independent reviewers concluded that it was unlikely to significantly help patients.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen profit beats estimates; raises 2012 forecast
article: Amgen Inc  on Thursday reported far higher-than-expected second-quarter profit and revenue on strong demand for many of its drugs  and the world's largest biotechnology company raised its full-year earnings and revenue forecasts.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: UK watchdog revises Amgen bone drug guidance
article: LONDON Britain's healthcare cost watchdog has had second thoughts about using Amgen's new bone drug Xgeva  or denosumab  and now says it does not believe it should be offered on the state health service to prostate cancer patients.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen drug Sensipar fails to meet trial goal
article: Amgen Inc said on Friday a late-stage trial of its drug Sensipar failed to reduce the risk of death and cardiovascular problems in patients with a complication of kidney disease.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Factbox: Drugmakers on the cusp of new immunotherapy era
article: Global drugmakers and tiny biotechs are developing promising cancer vaccines and other treatments that use the immune system to attack tumors.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: FDA rejects Amgen's application for Xgeva
article: U.S. health regulators rejected the application by Amgen Inc  the world's biggest biotechnology company  to expand the use of the drug Xgeva to delay the spread of tumors to the bone in patients suffering from advanced prostate cancer.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen to buy Turkish drugmaker for $700 million
article: LONDON U.S. biotech company Amgen is to buy Turkey's Mustafa Nevzat Pharmaceuticals  a maker of injectable generic drugs  for around $700 million in a deal underscoring Western drugmakers' thirst for emerging markets sales.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Drug sales  share buybacks help Amgen's first-quarter
article: Amgen Inc  posted a better-than-expected first-quarter profit as sales of arthritis drug Enbrel grew and the biotechnology company bought back more of its shares.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Amgen  Astra to collaborate on several drugs
article: Amgen Inc and British drugmaker AstraZeneca Plc announced on Monday a major collaboration deal to jointly develop and sell five biotech drugs currently in Amgen's developmental pipeline.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: In cancer science  many "discoveries" don't hold up
article: NEW YORK A former researcher at Amgen Inc has found that many basic studies on cancer -- a high proportion of them from university labs -- are unreliable  with grim consequences for producing new medicines in the future.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Regeneron cholesterol drug faces sudden challenge
article: CHICAGO A new type of drug being developed by Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc slashed levels of cholesterol almost in half when given every four weeks  but fell short of reductions reported a day earlier with once-monthly injections of Amgen Inc's rival product.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: Monthly shots of Amgen drug slash cholesterol up to 66 percent
article: CHICAGO Monthly injections of an experimental drug from Amgen Inc slashed levels of cholesterol by up to an additional 66 percent in patients already taking statins  researchers said on Sunday  making it a potential strong rival to a similar drug being developed by Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc.

name: Amgen Inc
headline: FDA panel votes against wider use of Amgen drug
article: WASHINGTON An advisory panel on Wednesday recommended that U.S. health regulators reject the use of Amgen Inc's drug Xgeva to delay the spread of prostate cancer to the bone  dimming the chance of a wider use for one of the company's key growth drivers.

name: Amgen Inc

article: BENGALURU  Nov 3 Apple's iPhone sales are set to dip by around a quarter in India's holiday season fourth quarter  putting them on course for the first full-year fall in four years  industry research firm Counterpoint said on Saturday.

Now Tim Cook is applying the same formula to the company’s Macs  iPads and accessories. But a growth warning suggests even Apple fans may have sticker shock.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Apple is bumping up against iPhone limits
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Apple is bumping up against its iPhone limits. The smartphone market is mature  and soft demand for the $1 000-plus X model suggests the company led by Tim Cook has maxed out on pricing. The company’s just-ended quarter - revenue rose 16 percent to $61.1 billion - shows Apple can still sell a lot of phones and more accessories and services. And a robust balance sheet means it plans to repurchase another $100 billion in shares and increase the dividend. But the

name: Apple Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Apple may double capital returned to investors
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Memories of Apple nearly going bankrupt in the mid-1990s scared Steve Jobs and his colleagues. Now worth some $840 billion  it has kept an absurdly conservative balance sheet for two decades. Apple returned about $50 billion to shareholders last fiscal year through share buybacks and dividends. Yet the company  whose free cash flow more than replenishes that every year  still had over $160 billion of net cash last quarter. Doubling the payout for three years wo

name: Apple Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Apple acquires goodwill of flag-waving publishers
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Apple is acquiring the goodwill of flag-waving magazine publishers for less than pocket change. The $925 billion iPhone maker is buying Texture  a digital subscription service for titles like Rolling Stone. The pixelated newsstand was intended as an antidote to Apple’s onerous terms. With the print industry suffering  though  buying it makes the tech giant look like a white knight.

name: Apple Inc

article: Apple Inc's streaming music service now has 38 million paid subscribers  up from 36 million in February  the company said on Monday.

name: Apple Inc

article: Apple Inc  said on Wednesday it had found a higher number of serious violations of its labor and environmental policies for suppliers  such as falsifying work hours data  as it expanded the scope of its annual audit of conditions of workers making its iPhones and other products.

A dispute over iPhone royalties left the U.S. chipmaker vulnerable to an opportunistic offer from its acquisitive rival. Settling could preserve Qualcomm’s independence – but it all depends on whether Apple thinks a bigger Broadcom would be slavishly devoted to the handset maker  or just surlier.
