headline: US STOCKS-Wall St set to open slightly lower  indexes near record
article: * U.S. trade deficit narrows in March  exports bounce back

name: Apple Inc
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St ends up as ISM data upbeat; Apple above $600
article: * Services sector grows in April  fastest pace in 8 months

name: Apple Inc
headline: U.S. jury orders Samsung to pay Apple $120 million
article: SAN JOSE  California A U.S. jury on Friday ordered Samsung Electronics Co Ltd to pay $119.6 million to Apple Inc  far less than Apple had sought and marking a big loss for the iPhone maker in the latest round of their globe-spanning mobile patent litigation. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Jury reaches verdict in Apple-Samsung patents trial
article: SAN JOSE  California The jury has reached a verdict on Friday in a patent trial between Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  which will be read in a San Jose  California federal courtroom shortly  according to a court official.

name: Apple Inc
headline: David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital up 4.3 percent in April: sources
article: David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital Inc. posted returns of 4.3 percent in April  owing to his short bets against high-flying momentum stocks and its holdings of Apple Inc. and Micron Technology  according to sources familiar with the hedge fund on Thursday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 5-Orders pour in for Apple's $12bn bond offering
article: NEW YORK  April 29 (IFR) - Investors rushed on Tuesday to get a piece of Apple's new US$12bn seven-part bond deal  just the company's second foray into the US bond market.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Samsung make final pitches to U.S. jury in patent trial
article: SAN JOSE  California Apple has vastly exaggerated the importance of its patented iPhone features  a Samsung attorney said on Tuesday as the two companies delivered closing arguments to jurors after a month-long trial over mobile technology.

name: Apple Inc
headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500  Dow end up after late rebound; Apple  Pfizer lift
article: (Updates close with jump in Agenus; adds Gogo's shares down after the bell)

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple offers to fix rare fault in older iPhones
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has offered to replace faulty on-off buttons on the iPhone 5  a rare glitch that it said on Friday affected "a small percentage" of the previous-generation smartphones.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Chipmaker Synaptics rides popularity of fingerprint ID phones
article: The growing popularity of using fingerprints to unlock mobile phones and other devices is expected to drive growth at Synaptics Inc   which makes the chips enabling the technology popularized by Apple Inc's  iPhone 5S.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple expands buybacks by $30 billion  OKs seven-for-one stock split
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has approved another $30 billion in share buybacks till the end of 2015 and authorized a rarely seen seven-for-one stock split  addressing calls to share more of its cash hoard while broadening the stock's appeal to individual investors.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Google vie to offer exclusive game apps: WSJ
article: Apple Inc and Google Inc are wooing game developers to ensure that top game titles arrive first on devices powered by their respective operating system  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Tech workers seek to use Steve Jobs evidence in upcoming trial on no-hire accords
article: SAN FRANCISCO Four large technology companies should not be allowed to limit evidence about Apple Inc co-founder Steve Jobs at an upcoming trial over no-hire agreements in Silicon Valley  according to a court document filed late on Thursday by employees suing the firms.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Samsung licenses 3D chip manufacturing tech to GlobalFoundries to win more orders
article: SEOUL  April 18 Samsung Electronics Co  said on Friday it would license its latest chip manufacturing technology to U.S. firm GlobalFoundries  a move that would help it expand production as it vies with bigger rival TSMC for orders from customers like Apple Inc .

name: Apple Inc
headline: Keep Steve Jobs' personality out of trial: tech companies
article: SAN FRANCISCO Witnesses at an upcoming trial over no-hire agreements in Silicon Valley should not be allowed to offer evidence that Apple co-founder Steve Jobs was "a bully " four major tech companies argued in a court filing.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple antitrust compliance off to a promising start: monitor
article: NEW YORK Apple Inc has made a "promising start" to enhancing its antitrust compliance program after being found liable last year for conspiring to raise e-book prices  but more work is required  a court-appointed monitor said Monday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Amazon to unveil smartphone in time for winter holidays: WSJ
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc is preparing to launch its long-rumored smartphone in the second half of the year  the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday  citing people briefed on the company's plans.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Technology group Kudelski says Apple infringed patents
article: ZURICH  April 10 Technology group Kudelski  said its OpenTV and Nagravision subsidiaries have filed a lawsuit against Apple Inc in a court in northern California alleging the iPhone maker has infringed five U.S. patents.

name: Apple Inc
headline: In smartphone mass-market  Samsung  Apple have margins on their minds
article: SEOUL As the smartphone action shifts to the mass market  leaders Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and Apple Inc are under pressure to make their high-end phones more affordable to revive sales. And that may spell trouble for already-softening margins.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Intertrust settle year-old patent suit
article: April 4 Apple Inc has agreed to settle a year-old patent infringement lawsuit with Intertrust Technologies Corp  a software firm owned by a group that includes Sony Corp and Philips  according to court filings.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Pfizer  others form 'go slow' U.S. patent lobby group
article: WASHINGTON Major U.S. companies including Ford  Apple and Pfizer have formed a lobbying group aimed at pushing back at some changes to the patent system members of Congress have proposed  saying these measures would hinder protection of valuable inventions.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple again seeks decisive U.S. court ruling against Samsung
article: SAN JOSE  California An Apple Inc attorney told jurors the company deserves about $2 billion from Samsung for copying the iPhone  but a Samsung lawyer said Apple was merely seeking to make up for losing its lead in the smartphone market. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Parents get do-over for in-app purchases by kids
article: Although Seana Mulcahy considers herself tech savvy  she was thrown a bit when her 8-year-old son Logan not once  but twice  ran up charges using apps downloaded from Apple Inc's online iTunes store.

name: Apple Inc
headline: U.S. judge OKs class action in e-book suit against Apple
article: NEW YORK A federal judge in New York granted class certification on Friday to a group of consumers who sued Apple Inc for conspiring with five major publishers to fix e-book prices in violation of antitrust law.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Google lose bid to avoid trial on tech worker lawsuit
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Friday rejected a request from Apple  Google and two other tech companies to win judgment before trial in a class action lawsuit alleging a scheme to drive down wages among tech workers.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-BlackBerry's enterprise offering wins U.S. security clearance
article: TORONTO  March 26 BlackBerry Ltd   has received a coveted security clearance that paves the way for U.S. government agencies to use its systems to manage and secure Android- and iOS-powered devices operating on their internal networks  the smartphone maker said on Wednesday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple shares to be fueled by new iPhone: Barron's
article: Apple Inc shares could rise by 20 percent over the next year  fueled by sales of a new version of its iPhone smartphone that is expected to have a bigger screen  according to an article in the March 24 edition of Barron's.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple replaces iPad 2 with iPad 4  launches cheaper iPhone 5C
article: Apple Inc said it would offer an iPad 4 tablet in place of the mid-range iPad 2 at the same price and the company launched a cheaper  lower capacity version of its plastic-backed iPhone 5C in Australia  China and some European countries.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-HTC  Huawei  ZTE did not violate FlashPoint patents-U.S. panel
article: WASHINGTON  March 14 HTC Corp and others did not violate digital camera patents owned by Apple Inc  spinoff FlashPoint Technology to make their smartphones  the U.S. International Trade Commission said on Friday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: SINGAPORE PRESS-Creative Technologies unit sues Apple  Samsung - Business Times
article: Creative Technology's wholly owned subsidiary  ZiiLabs  has sued tech giants Samsung Electronics Co  and Apple Inc for alleged patent infringement.

name: Apple Inc
headline: REFILE-Hon Hai looks to add 15 000 new hires in 2014
article: TAIPEI  March 10 Taiwan's Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd  the main assembler of products for Apple Inc  plans to add 15 000 new employees to its staff of over 1 million this year in one of the biggest yearly recruitment campaigns in its history.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple loses bid for U.S. ban on Samsung smartphone sales
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Thursday rejected Apple's request for a permanent sales ban in the United States against some older Samsung smartphones  a key setback for the iPhone maker in its global patent battle.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Russia's Megafon to buy 750 000 iPhones in 3 years
article: MOSCOW Russia's second-biggest mobile phone operator  Megafon  said it would buy at least 750 000 iPhones from Apple Inc over the next three years for resale through its retail network.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple's new finance steward Maestri takes over $160 billion cash haul
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc's Chief Financial Officer Peter Oppenheimer will retire and hand the reins to Luca Maestri in September  entrusting to the Italian-born executive a cash pile the size of Vietnam's economy and the difficult task of guiding Wall Street's expectations.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Goldman Sachs names Apple's Oppenheimer to board
article: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  named Peter Oppenheimer  the chief financial officer of Apple Inc   as an independent director.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple CEO promises new products  says Apple TV no longer a 'hobby'
article: CUPERTINO  California Apple Inc sold more than $1 billion of Apple TV set-top boxes in 2013 and is investing heavily in the next generation of products  Chief Executive Tim Cook said at the company's annual meeting on Friday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Europe invites Apple  Google to discuss 'in-app' purchases
article: BRUSSELS The European Commission announced plans on Thursday to tackle one of the scourges of the modern age - games on tablets and mobile phones that allow adults and children to rack up vast credit card bills by making "in-app" purchases.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple urges U.S. appeals court to void 'radical' e-books ruling
article: NEW YORK Apple Inc urged a U.S. appeals court to throw out a judge's "radical" finding that it violated antitrust law by manipulating electronic book prices  and blamed publishers for running a conspiracy it claimed to know nothing about.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Chipmaker Avago says it lost revenue from smartphone maker
article: Chipmaker Avago Technologies Limited  said it expects current-quarter sales to decline 3-6 percent from the first quarter as it lost revenue from a smartphone maker  which analysts said could be Apple Inc .

name: Apple Inc
headline: RF Micro to buy TriQuint to boost mobile chips business
article: Chipmaker RF Micro Devices Inc will buy peer TriQuint Semiconductor Inc for about $1.6 billion to capture a larger share of the market for chips supplied to Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd.

name: Apple Inc
headline: RPT-G20 agrees on push to close tax loopholes  make multinationals pay
article: SYDNEY  Feb 23 The world's top economies agreed on Sunday to develop stricter rules on cross-border taxation to close loopholes that have allowed multinationals such as Starbucks Corp  Google Inc  Apple Inc  and Amazon.com Inc to avoid paying taxes.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple promises fix 'very soon' for Macs with failed encryption
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc said on Saturday it would issue a software update "very soon" to cut off the ability of spies and hackers to grab email  financial information and other sensitive data from Mac computers.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Taiwan stocks rise; suppliers of Tesla Motors  Apple up
article: TAIPEI  Feb 21 Taiwan stocks rose 0.8 percent on Friday as market sentiment was buoyed by rallies on Wall Street and regional bourses  with suppliers of Tesla Motors  rising after the U.S. electric car maker posed better-than-expected quarterly results      Cub Elecparts and BizLink Holding  which make components for Tesla  were both up more than 2 percent. Tesla shares ended up 8.4 percent after hitting an intraday record on Thursday on the Nasdaq.     Largan Precision  a camera pho

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Tesla CEO confirms Apple talks  says deal 'unlikely' - Bloomberg TV
article: DETROIT  Feb 20 Tesla Motors Inc has had "conversations" with Apple Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk confirmed to Bloomberg TV on Thursday  responding to speculation that the iPhone and iPad maker had shown interest in the electric car company.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Top U.S. hedge funds cling to eBay  Apple in fourth quarter
article: NEW YORK E-commerce auction house eBay Inc became a darling among top U.S. hedge funds in the fourth quarter just before billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn urged the company to spin off its PayPal payments business  regulatory filings showed on Friday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple supplier review uncovers fewer child labor cases
article: Apple Inc uncovered fewer cases of child labor than a year ago in its annual survey of the international supply chain that makes parts for its iPhones and iPads.

name: Apple Inc
headline: DoubleLine's Gundlach says firm sold some Apple shares: CNBC
article: NEW YORK Jeffrey Gundlach  chief executive and chief investment officer of DoubleLine Capital  said on Wednesday that his firm had sold some Apple Inc. shares and that the U.S. Federal Reserve may not end its bond buying this year.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Sony in talks to supply more camera sensors to Apple: Nikkei
article: Sony Corp is in talks with Apple Inc to double its supply of camera components for a new iPhone slated to roll out as early as next year  the Nikkei reported.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Icahn gives up Apple buyback plan after ISS urges 'no' vote
article: Billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn has backed off from his campaign urging Apple Inc to increase its stock buybacks  citing the company's recent repurchases as well as an influential proxy adviser's call against his proposal. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: ISS recommends 'no' vote on Icahn's plan for Apple
article: Proxy advisory firm ISS said it recommends shareholders vote against activist investor Carl Icahn's share buyback proposal for Apple Inc  according to a report obtained by Reuters on Sunday.

article: * January payrolls disappoint  December revised up slightly

name: Apple Inc
headline: Taiwan's 'China plays' rise above tech shares
article: * Future of Taiwan tech firms worrisome in 'post-Apple' era

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple and the grim history of buybacks
article: Based on its own history  and the broader experience with other companies  Apple's plan to buy back $60 billon of its own shares will probably end as a bit of a disappointment.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  U.S. clash in court over e-books antitrust monitor
article: NEW YORK Apple Inc urged a federal appeals court on Tuesday to put a court-appointed antitrust monitor on hold  arguing that his efforts were harming the company's business.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Samsung spar over potential U.S. ban on smartphone sales
article: SAN JOSE  California Samsung sought to defeat Apple's bid for a permanent sales ban against some Samsung smartphones  arguing in court on Thursday that Apple's request was an attempt to instill fear among telecom carriers and retailers that carry Samsung's products.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Lenovo to buy Google's Motorola in China's largest tech deal
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Lenovo Group said on Wednesday it agreed to buy Google Inc's Motorola handset division for $2.91 billion  in what is China's largest-ever tech deal as Lenovo buys its way into a heavily competitive U.S. handset market dominated by Apple Inc.

article: * Stock futures rally after Turkey's central bank raises rates

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple set to report record holiday  but China doubts stay
article: Apple Inc may notch its most successful holiday shopping season yet when it reports quarterly results on Monday  setting records for sales of its gift-friendly iPhones and iPads.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Samsung Electronics fourth-quarter profit sags as smartphone growth concern deepens
article: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd posted its first decline in quarterly profit in two years  hit by a one-off special bonus as well as slowing smartphone sales as it braces for a year of tougher competition with rival Apple Inc.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Icahn blasts Apple again  boosts position to $3 billion
article: SAN FRANCISCO Activist investor Carl Icahn lashed out against Apple Inc again on Wednesday  and tweeted that he had bought $500 million more shares in the company in just the past two weeks  bringing his investment in the iPhone maker to over $3 billion.

name: Apple Inc

article: NEW YORK A U.S. appeals court gave Apple Inc a reprieve from an external monitor appointed to oversee its compliance with antitrust laws after the company had been found liable last July for conspiring to raise e-book prices.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Taiwan stocks rise; TPK jumps on order diversification reports
article: TAIPEI  Jan 20 Taiwan stocks firmed on Monday  with electronics shares gaining 0.4 percent  led by touch panel maker TPK Holding after reports that it is diversifying from Apple Inc by receiving more orders from Japanese and Korean companies.     The main TAIEX index rose 0.3 percent  or 22.82 points to 8 618.82 at 0234 GMT  after opening flat.     TPK jumped 6 percent and was the biggest turnover stock by mid-session.     Struggling computer company Acer Inc shed 3.7 percent to T$18

name: Apple Inc
headline: Nextel to offer latest iPhones in Brazil
article: Nextel mobile phone service  owned by NII Holdings Inc  will offer Apple Inc's iPhone 5S and iPhone 5C to its customers in Brazil.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple China Mobile launch could spark costly subsidy war
article: BEIJING Apple Inc is finally launching its iPhone on China Mobile Ltd's vast network on Friday  opening the door to the world's largest carrier's 763 million subscribers and giving its China sales a short-term jolt.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple to refund at least $32.5 million in disputed kids' app purchases

Gains in Panasonic Corp and mobile operator SoftBank Corp offered some respite  however. "Apple-polishing" has become the headline du jour. Picturing the soignée Ahrendts surrounded by geeks in jeans and hoodies  we might be forgiven for wondering why Apple feels in need of a fashionista buff-up. After all  there is hardly a product line more shiny-bright than Apple's - or one with less affinity to

name: Apple Inc

article: NEW YORK Verizon Communications Chief Financial Officer Fran Shammo said Apple Inc's iPhone 5C "undersold expectations" in the third quarter  while its pricier iPhone 5S was in short supply.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Google's Schmidt says relationship with Apple has improved
article: SUN VALLEY  Idaho The relationship between Google Inc and Apple Inc has improved over the past year with the rival technology companies and sometimes partners conducting "lots and lots" of meetings  Google Executive Chairman Eric Schmidt said.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 3-Nokia pins recovery hopes on advanced camera smartphone
article: * Critics mostly positive  financial health still a worry

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple colluded on e-book prices  judge finds
article: NEW YORK In a sweeping rejection of Apple Inc's strategy for selling electronic books on the Internet  a federal judge ruled that the company conspired with five major publishers to raise e-book prices. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Amazon end 'app store' lawsuit
article: Apple Inc and Amazon.com Inc have ended their lawsuit over who has the right to use the "app store" name  clearing the way for both companies to use it.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Barnes & Noble CEO resigns after Nook sales slump
article: NEW YORK  July 8 Barnes & Noble Inc  Chief Executive William Lynch resigned on Monday after he led a failed attempt by the U.S. bookstore chain to compete against the likes of Amazon.com Inc  Apple Inc and Google Inc in the e-reader and tablet markets.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Governments to target tech giants' tax avoidance: draft
article: BERLIN/LONDON Western governments are set to target a range of tax loopholes used by technology giants including Apple  Amazon as part of an international drive to tackle corporate tax avoidance  a draft action plan seen by Reuters said.

name: Apple Inc
headline: China hands Asian memory makers massive bargaining chip
article: * China diversifies chipmakers' client base from Apple  Samsung

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple hires former Yves Saint Laurent CEO for 'special projects'
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has hired the former chief executive of French luxury group Yves Saint Laurent for "special projects" reporting to Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple applies to register 'iWatch' trademark in Japan
article: TOKYO Apple Inc has applied for a trademark for "iWatch" in Japan  a patent official said on Monday  signaling the iPhone maker may be moving ahead with plans for a watch-like device as gadget makers turn their attention to wearable computers.

name: Apple Inc

article: * Sharp  CEC to invest $2.9 billion into LCD joint venture

name: Apple Inc

article: TAIPEI  June 26 Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd  looking to reduce its reliance on making products for Apple Inc  said on Wednesday it would focus on developing new technologies  intellectual property rights and e-commerce.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Barnes & Noble retreats from tablet wars as Nook sales plummet
article: Barnes & Noble Inc will stop manufacturing its own Nook tablets  marking the end of its expensive attempt to compete alone with deep-pocketed rivals Amazon.com Inc  Apple Inc and Google Inc in the tablet wars. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Microsoft to bring Xbox and PC games to Apple  Android phones: report
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp will offer its console and computer games for Apple Inc's iPhone and other smartphone platforms this fiscal year  through a tie-up with Japanese smartphone game maker Klab Inc  the Nikkei said on Monday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple CEO's stock grant now subject to share performance
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc> Chief Executive Tim Cook's one-time stock award worth over $413 million as of Friday is now partly subject to the performance of the shares  a move that followed discussions with the company's largest shareholders.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple warns of "chilling effect" as antitrust trial ends
article: * U.S. government lawyer says conspiracy caused e-book prices to rise 9 percent

name: Apple Inc
headline: Nvidia's stock jumps on license plan; Wall Street eyes Apple

name: Apple Inc
headline: Nvidia to license graphics technology: CEO
article: SAN FRANCISCO Nvidia Chief Executive Jen-Hsun Huang said he will license graphics technology to other companies  a new model for the chipmaker that could lead to new business with Apple  Samsung and other mobile device makers.

name: Apple Inc
headline: 'Ringleader' says Apple did not raise e-books prices
article: NEW YORK An Apple Inc executive at the center of an antitrust lawsuit by the U.S. government said on Thursday the company "didn't care" what price publishers set for e-books.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple unveils music streaming service  revamps iOS
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc unveiled a music streaming service called iTunes Radio and new mobile software on Monday  in the biggest re-design of its operating system since the original iPhone was introduced in 2007. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Samsung Elec loses $12 bln market value on smartphone worries

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple to begin iPhone trade-ins this month - report
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc will start a program this month to allow users to trade their older iPhones for the newest model  Bloomberg cited people familiar with the plan as saying  a first for the company as it prepares to introduce a new version of the smartphone.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Penguin CEO takes stand in Apple e-books antitrust case
article: NEW YORK  June 4 The chief executive of U.S. publisher Penguin testified Tuesday that a provision in its e-books contract with Apple Inc played a role in a decision to change its contracts with other retailers  such as Amazon.com Inc.

name: Apple Inc

article: June 3 (IFR) - EMC Corp turned to the bond markets to raise money for the first time on Monday  selling US$5.5 billion in debt to help fund an expanded share buyback program.

name: Apple Inc
headline: U.S. takes Apple to trial over e-books price-fixing
article: NEW YORK  June 2 Apple Inc goes to trial Monday over allegations by federal and state authorities that it conspired with publishers to raise the price of e-books.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Trade panel delays decision in Apple-Samsung fight
article: WASHINGTON The U.S. International Trade Commission  which hears many patent fights  on Friday extended its deadline for ruling on whether Apple Inc infringes patents owned by Samsung Electronics Co Ltd in making the iPod Touch  iPhone and iPad.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Avago forecasts strong third quarter revenue on smartphone demand
article: Chipmaker Avago Technologies Ltd   which counts Apple Inc  among its customers  forecast current-quarter revenue largely above expectations  citing revival of demand from a large smartphone customer.

name: Apple Inc

article: BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators are seeking information whether Apple's iPhone distribution deals with mobile telecoms operators may be aimed at shutting out rival smartphones makers  in a move which could lead to a formal investigation into Apple.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Judge says leaning toward U.S. in Apple e-books case
article: NEW YORK  May 23 In an unusual move before a trial  a federal judge expressed a tentative view that the U.S. Justice Department will be able to show evidence that Apple Inc  engaged in a conspiracy with publishers to increase e-book prices.

name: Apple Inc

name: Apple Inc
headline: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - May 22
article: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook defended the technology company's tax practices  saying Apple did not depend on "tax gimmicks" as U.S. senators grilled him over charges that the company avoided billions of dollars in taxes on international profits.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple  Congress spar over taxes ahead of Tuesday hearing
article: WASHINGTON/SAN FRANCISCO Using an unusual global tax structure  Apple Inc  has kept billions of dollars in profits in Irish subsidiaries to pay little or no taxes to any government  a Senate report on the company's offshore tax structure said on Monday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Foxconn says needs more time to further cut workers' overtime

name: Apple Inc

name: Apple Inc
headline: Hedge funds shop at Supervalu  sour on Apple
article: NEW YORK Barry Rosenstein's JANA Partners liked grocery chain Supervalu Inc in a big way in the first quarter  while Philippe Laffont's Coatue Management lost its stomach for the company's shares.

name: Apple Inc

name: Apple Inc

article: NEW YORK David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital has added to its investment position in Apple Inc  and is waiting for the company's "next blockbuster product " Einhorn said on Tuesday.

article: * Indexes: Dow up 0.04 pct  S&P up 0.3 pct  Nasdaq up 0.4 pct

article: Zagg Inc   which makes scratch guards for mobile and tablet devices  slashed its full-year sales forecast  citing delays in product launches by Apple Inc .

The S&P 500 index hit a record intraday high just before the

name: Apple Inc
headline: Google Now comes to iPhone  challenging Apple's Siri
article: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc is bringing its Google Now technology to the iPhone  where it will compete head-on with Apple Inc's Siri to serve as the primary service that smartphone users rely on to get everything from weather updates to traffic forecasts. | Video

headline: Column: Apple's new pitch to investors

article: * Apple to return $100 bln to investors     * To raise debt for the first time     * Quarterly revenue rises but profit declines     * CEO says growth has tempered     * Shares flat after rising 6 percent      By Poornima Gupta     SAN FRANCISCO  April 23 Apple Inc on Tuesday bowed to investors' demands to share more of its $145 billion cash pile  while posting its first quarterly profit decline in more than a decade.     The new expanded capital plan includes issuing debt for the fi

name: Apple Inc
headline: US trade panel says Apple did not violate Google patent
article: WASHINGTON Apple Inc scored a win on Monday when the U.S. International Trade Commission ruled that it did not violate a Google patent to make the popular iPhones.

article: NEW YORK Apple may have lost nearly half of its value since its peak in September  but it's still the talk of the town. Only this time  it's all about how low can it go? | Video

headline: ADR REPORT-Apple component suppliers lead foreign shares lower
article: NEW YORK  April 18 U.S.-listed shares of Asian companies fell on Thursday  pressured by Apple component suppliers  on concerns of slowing sales of the iPhone maker's products  while global growth worries dampened the appeal of exporters.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Nikkei set to fall on weak global markets; Apple-linked shares may falter
article: TOKYO  April 18 Japan's Nikkei share average is expected to open lower on Thursday as buyers are likely to be sidelined by weak global equity markets and worries about global growth.      Market players said the Nikkei was likely to trade between 13 200 to 13 350 after rising 1.2 percent to 13 382.89 on Wednesday. Nikkei futures in Chicago closed at 13 270  down 1.0 percent from the close in Osaka of 13 400.     Overnight  European shares fell to their lowest levels so far this year

name: Apple Inc
headline: HP aims to revolutionize computers with motion-control technology

name: Apple Inc
headline: Trader admits fraud in $1 billion Apple stock scheme
article: April 16 A former Rochdale Securities trader whose unauthorized purchase of about $1 billion of Apple Inc  stock caused the demise of the financial services company pleaded guilty on Monday to wire fraud and conspiracy.

name: Apple Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO  April 12 Amazon.com Inc  increased stock compensation for key executives in 2012 as the world's largest Internet retailer stepped up competition with Apple Inc  according to a regulatory filing on Friday.

name: Apple Inc

article: PARIS  April 11 France plans to ask the European Commission for tighter regulation of Internet companies following Apple's decision to remove a French-designed app from its App Store.

name: Apple Inc

article: TAIPEI Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd  the main manufacturer of Apple Inc products  posted a 19 percent decline in sales in the first quarter compared with a year earlier  hurt by disappointing demand for the iPhone.

name: Apple Inc

name: Apple Inc

article: * Handset shipments seen up 10 pct at record 70 mln - analysts

name: Apple Inc
headline: Sorry Apple gets respect in China after tabloid trial

name: Apple Inc
headline: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - April 2
article: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook has apologised to Chinese consumers over the company's after-sales service following intense pressure from Chinese state media.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Chinese regulator calls for tighter supervision of Apple
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has come under criticism from a Chinese marketplace regulator  which called for stronger supervision of the iPhone-maker's consumer policies within the country  according to state-run media.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Popularity helps buffer Apple from Chinese state-media attacks
article: SHANGHAI Chinese Internet users are crying foul over the perceived unfair treatment doled out to Apple Inc by state-run media which has actively criticized the smartphone maker for the past two weeks over its warranty policy.

name: Apple Inc
headline: U.S. court questions public interest scope in Apple secrecy hearing
article: WASHINGTON A federal appeals court aggressively questioned the scope of the public interest and trade secrets at a hearing on Tuesday over document secrecy in Apple Inc's patent litigation against Samsung Electronics Co Ltd. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Hon Hai posts record Q4 net  but margins face new challenge in 2013
article: TAIPEI  March 25 Taiwan's Hon Hai Precision Industry posted a record net profit and lifted margins in the last quarter as it braced for a weaker performance from its biggest client  iPad maker Apple Inc.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple buys Silicon Valley startup WiFiSlam
article: NEW YORK Apple has acquired a Silicon Valley startup  WiFiSlam  which makes mapping applications for smart phones.

name: Apple Inc

article: BRUSSELS The European Union is looking into potential antitrust violations involving the distribution of Apple Inc's iPhones and iPads  after receiving what sources said were informal complaints from telecoms operators. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple investors pay more for downside bets
article: The steady slide in longtime market darling Apple Inc has brought in options investors willing to pay more for bearish bets than at any time in the last four years.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Software co. Intertrust accuses Apple of infringing patents
article: Intertrust Technologies Corp  a software firm owned by a group that includes Sony Corp and Royal Philips Electronics  said on Wednesday it has sued Apple Inc for infringing 15 patents relating to security.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Adobe chief technology officer to join Apple
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has snagged Adobe System's chief technology officer  Kevin Lynch  who oversees the software maker's technology research and experience design teams with a focus on cloud and social computing.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Samsung Galaxy S4 blitz may prompt Apple rethink
article: SAN FRANCISCO Samsung's newest  feature-packed Galaxy S4 may put pressure on Apple Inc to accelerate its pace of smartphone design and venture into cheaper devices - both departures from usual practice.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Radio frequency chip makers tune in to smartphone race
article: Radio frequency chip makers are set to gain as Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and Apple Inc unveil ever more sophisticated smartphones and tablets to battle for the No. 1 spot in the global mobile devices market.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Samsung Galaxy S4 emerges to do battle on Apple's home turf
article: NEW YORK Samsung Electronics Co on Thursday premiered its latest flagship phone  the Galaxy S4  which sports a bigger display and unconventional features such as gesture controls and will spearhead its effort to challenge Apple Inc on its home turf.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple's Schiller blasts Android  Samsung on Galaxy's eve
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc marketing chief Phil Schiller attacked Google Inc's "fragmented" Android software and its biggest adopter  Samsung Electronics  a day before the Korean firm takes the wraps off its latest flagship smartphone in the United States. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple's iPad to fall behind Android as tablet war grows
article: SAN FRANCISCO Shipments of tablets running Google Inc's Android will overtake the iPad this year for the first time  research house IDC predicted on Tuesday  as Apple Inc cedes more mobile market share to hard-charging rivals around the globe.

name: Apple Inc
headline: CEO Tim Cook may have to testify in Apple e-books case
article: Apple Inc CEO Tim Cook could be deposed in the government's lawsuit against the company over alleged price-setting in the e-book market.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 3-Samsung gets a foot in at key Apple supplier Sharp with $110 mln investment
article: TOKYO/SEOUL  March 6 Samsung Electronics Co   with a $110 million investment in cash-strapped Sharp Corp  will broaden its supplier base  gain access to low-power thin screen technology and get a foot in the door at one of Apple Inc's key Asian display suppliers.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Sony looking to beat Chinese rivals to be No.3 in smartphones
article: TOKYO Sony Corp said it aims to win third place in smartphone markets around the world behind Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co  pitting it against Chinese companies Huawei Technology and and ZTE that are looking to become the third big player in mobile devices.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Judge cuts Apple award versus Samsung  sets new damages trial
article: Apple Inc had a major setback in its mobile patents battle with Samsung Electronics on Friday  as a federal judge slashed a $1.05 billion jury award by more than 40 percent and set a new trial to determine damages.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Judge cuts Apple award vs Samsung  sets new damages trial
article: Apple Inc had a major setback in its ongoing mobile patents battle with Samsung Electronics on Friday  as a federal judge slashed a $1.05 billion jury award by more than 40 percent and set a new trial to determine damages.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Leap shares fall on concerns about slow iPhone sales
article: NEW YORK Shares of Leap Wireless International Inc fell 3 percent on Thursday after the company said it may be able to sell only half the iPhones it has committed to buying from Apple Inc  potentially setting it back by $450 million over three years.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple CEO says he feels shareholders' pain  urges long view
article: CUPERTINO  California Apple Inc CEO Tim Cook on Wednesday acknowledged widespread disappointment in the company's sagging share price but shared few details about its secretive product pipeline and touched only briefly on a raging debate about how best to reward shareholders. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Avago Technologies sees weak second-quarter revenue
article: Chipmaker Avago Technologies Ltd  forecast lower-than-expected revenue for the current quarter  becoming the latest supplier for Apple products to warn of weak revenue this quarter.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple signals emerging-market rethink with India push
article: NEW DELHI/BANGALORE As BlackBerry launches the first smartphone from its make-or-break BB10 line in India  one of its most loyal markets  the company faces new competition from a formidable rival that has long had a minimal presence in the country.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Einhorn scores legal victory versus Apple in cash scuffle
article: NEW YORK A U.S. judge handed outspoken hedge fund manager David Einhorn a victory in his battle with Apple Inc on Friday  blocking the iPhone maker from moving forward with a shareholder vote on a controversial proposal to limit the company's ability to issue preferred stock.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Einhorn says Apple "iPref" stock would unlock value
article: Star hedge fund manager David Einhorn has a new product that he wants Apple Inc.  to offer: the iPref.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple supplier Foxconn freezes hiring at largest plant
article: TAIPEI/NEW YORK Apple Inc's manufacturing partner Foxconn Technology Group has frozen hiring at a Shenzhen plant that makes gadgets including the iPhone 5 and put the brakes on recruiting for other factories across China  but said the move was not linked to any single client.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Einhorn hedge fund may succeed in Apple case  judge says
article: NEW YORK  Feb 19 David Einhorn's hedge fund has shown a "likelihood of success" if his legal attack against Apple Inc goes forward  a U.S. judge said  though he made no immediate ruling on fund's request to block a shareholder vote on a proxy proposal next week.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Ahead of hearing  Einhorn reiterates case against Apple
article: NEW YORK  Feb 15 David Einhorn reiterated his arguments Friday that a judge should block a shareholder vote on Apple Inc's proposal to eliminate its ability to issue preferred shares without investor approval  days before a court hearing.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Big hedge funds fueled fourth-quarter dive in Apple shares
article: BOSTON Some of the biggest hedge funds that helped make Apple Inc a stock market darling lost faith and dumped their stakes in the fourth quarter  fueling the massive drop in the iPhone maker's share price. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple fires back at Einhorn  reveals high-level meeting details
article: NEW YORK  Feb 13 David Einhorn tried to dissuade Apple Inc last week from eliminating its ability to issue preferred shares at will  saying the need to first obtain shareholder approval would be an unnecessary roadblock to any such future plans  the iPhone maker said in a court filing on Wednesday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple CEO calls Einhorn lawsuit a "silly sideshow"
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook said the board is carefully considering David Einhorn's proposal for the company to issue preferred stock and return more cash to investors  but he called a lawsuit brought by the star hedge fund manager against Apple a "silly sideshow." | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Judge speeds up schedule in Apple versus Einhorn case
article: SAN FRANCISCO A judge approved Apple Inc's request to speed up the schedule in a lawsuit filed by star hedge fund manager David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital  part of an effort to get the company to share its huge cash reserves with investors.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple experiments with devices similar to watches: NYT
article: NEW YORK Apple Inc. is experimenting with the design of a device similar to a wristwatch that would operate on the same platform as the iPhone and would be made with curved glass  the New York Times reported on Sunday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Einhorn case against Apple rests on unusual legal tactic
article: NEW YORK Hedge fund star David Einhorn wants to force Apple Inc to share some of its huge cash reserves with investors  but his lawsuit rests on a U.S. securities rule that has little legal precedent.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Einhorn case against Apple rests on rarely used legal tactic
article: NEW YORK Hedge fund star David Einhorn wants to force Apple Inc to share some of its huge cash pile with investors  but his lawsuit rests on a U.S. securities rule that has little court precedent surrounding it.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Einhorn sues Apple  marks biggest investor challenge in years
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc on Thursday confronted its first major challenge from an activist shareholder in years as hedge fund manager David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital filed suit against the company and demanded that it dole out a bigger piece of its $137 billion cash pile to investors. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: iTunes sells 25 billion songs; prize won for ''Monkey Drums'' download
article: Apple's iTunes music store hit its 25 billionth download - equal to selling more than three songs for every person on Earth - and on Wednesday gave the German student who bought the track a gift card worth 10 000 euro ($13 500).

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple to lose iPhone trademark in Brazil-source
article: RIO DE JANEIRO  Feb 5 Brazil's copyright regulator will strip Apple Inc of the right to use its iPhone trademark in Latin America's biggest market and granted the trademark to a local company that registered it first  a source familiar with the decision said on Tuesday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: California court finds for Apple in credit card suit
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc and other online retailers did not break California law by requiring consumers to provide their address and phone numbers as a condition of accepting credit card payments  the state's high court ruled on Monday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple edges out Samsung for mobile phone sales lead in fourth quarter
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc became the top mobile phone seller for the first time in the lucrative U.S. market during the fourth quarter of 2012  outshining arch rival Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  a report by Strategy Analytics showed.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Audience Inc shares surge on strong first-quarter forecast
article: Jan 31 Audience Inc forecast first-quarter results well above analysts' estimates as the audio chip maker diversified its customer base away from Apple Inc's iPhone  sending its shares up more than 25 percent in extended trade.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Apple supplier Skyworks forecasts strong 2nd-qtr  shares jump
article: Jan 30 Skyworks Solutions Inc  a supplier to Apple Inc  forecast better-than-expected revenue for the traditionally slow second quarter  pushing its shares up almost 15 percent in extended trade.

name: Apple Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-SK Hynix Q4 misses forecast  weak PC chip prices weigh
article: SEOUL  Jan 30 South Korean chipmaker SK Hynix Inc returned to a quarterly profit on Wednesday on demand from mobile device makers such as Apple Inc  but it fell far short of forecasts on weak sales of computer chips and a strong won.

name: Apple Inc
headline: S&P 500 eases  ends longest winning run in eight years
article: NEW YORK The S&P 500 eased slightly on Monday after an eight-day run of gains  while the Nasdaq edged higher as Apple shares rebounded. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: In Asia's trend-setting cities  iPhone fatigue sets in
article: SINGAPORE Apple Inc's iconic iPhone is losing some of its luster among Asia's well-heeled consumers in Singapore and Hong Kong  a victim of changing mobile habits and its own runaway success.

name: Apple Inc
headline: First Steve Jobs movie gets red carpet premiere
article: PARK CITY  Utah The first movie about Apple's legendary co-founder got a warm reception at its world premiere on Friday  just 15 months after Steve Jobs' death.

name: Apple Inc
headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500 vaults 1 500 as Wall St extends rally
article: NEW YORK  Jan 25 The Standard & Poor's 500 index closed above 1 500 for the first time in more than five years on Friday as strong U.S. earnings reports  including Procter & Gamble's  helped the benchmark extend its rally to eight days.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Samsung posts record profit; keeps 2013 capex at 2012 level
article: SEOUL  Jan 25 Samsung Electronics Co  reported a record quarterly profit of $8.3 billion and kept its 2013 investment plans at the previous year's level  defying expectations that it may reduce spending amid weaker demand for computer chips.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple revenue  iPhone sales disappoint; shares dive
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc missed Wall Street's revenue forecast for the third straight quarter as iPhone sales came in below expectations  fueling investors' worries that its dominance of the mobile industry was slipping. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Analysis: Apple earnings need to overcome technical malaise
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO To those who study technical stock charts  Apple Inc looks broken. | Video

name: Apple Inc

article: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp has scrapped plans to sell a high-speed version of Research In Motion Ltd's PlayBook tablet because of slack demand  delivering another blow to BlackBerry phone maker.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Nvidia's outlook beats Street  shares soar
article: SAN FRANCISCO Nvidia Corp forecast a larger-than-expected jump in quarterly revenue and its CEO said the chipmaker's mobile business was accelerating  sending its shares skyrocketing.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Viacom  Cablevision settle iPad streaming dispute
article: NEW YORK Viacom Inc and Cablevision Systems Corp have resolved a dispute over the latter's alleged unauthorized streaming of Viacom programing on devices such as Apple Inc's iPad.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Micron says NAND chip demand buoyed by tablets
article: SANTA CLARA  California Orders for Micron Technology Inc's  NAND memory chips are holding up despite growing economic uncertainty  thanks to strong demand from manufacturers making tablets and solid-state drives  a senior executive at the chipmaker said.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Trade agency to eye Apple complaint against HTC
article: A U.S. trade agency will review Apple Inc's patent-infringement complaint against Taiwanese phone maker HTC Corp.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Oracle  other companies "punk'd" in hacking contest
article: LAS VEGAS A weekend contest at the world's largest hacking convention in Las Vegas showed one reason why big corporations seem to be such easy prey for cyber criminals: their workers are poorly trained in security.

name: Apple Inc
headline: HP offers TouchPad on discount month after launch
article: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard Co is offering a hefty discount on its TouchPad tablet a month after it launched the WebOS-based mobile device in a booming market dominated by Apple Inc's iPad.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Investors flee bad telecom smartphone bets
article: NEW YORK Smartphones may have good looks and a lot of whiz-bang features  but this week they just have a bad reputation.

name: Apple Inc
headline: British smartphone use soaring  led by teens: survey
article: LONDON Teenage Britons are spending more and more time using smartphones to make calls  send texts and use social networking sites  and more than half of those that own the devices claim to be addicted to them  regulator Ofcom said on Thursday.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Samsung Q2 profit sags as flat screen posts losses
article: SEOUL  July 29 Samsung Electronics Co    the world's top memory chipmaker  reported a  2  5 percent fall in quarterly profit as its flat screen business posted a second consecutive quarterly loss   overshadowing strong profit growth from handset sales.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Accused AT&T-iPad hacker Andrew Auernheimer in plea talks
article: NEW YORK Andrew Auernheimer  accused of hacking into AT&T Inc servers and stealing the personal data of 120 000 Apple Inc iPad users  is in talks to plead guilty after his co-defendant did the same last month.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Timberlake to Gaga: Hollywood courts social media
article: LOS ANGELES When you think of Bono or Lady Gaga  the term "Silicon Valley entrepreneur" hardly springs to mind.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Verizon iPhone sales dash hopes; shares fall
article: NEW YORK Verizon Communications may have the iPhone  but the blockbuster smartphone has yet to pay off in its battle against AT&T Inc. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Apple smashes Street views  shares soar
article: SAN FRANCISCO Blockbuster sales of the iPhone and strong Asian business again helped Apple Inc crush Wall Street's expectations  driving its shares up more than 7 percent to record highs. | Video

name: Apple Inc
headline: Analysis: Google antitrust watchers: Place your bets  please
article: SAN FRANCISCO The antitrust probe into Google Inc  could hem in its growth ambitions for years  even if regulators do not unleash their most formidable weapons: Seeking a breakup of the Internet giant or exerting control over its cherished search algorithm.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Amazon tablet seen aiming to widen e-commerce lead
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc will launch a tablet computer this year to extend its position as the world's largest Internet retailer  expand in mobile commerce and sell more digital goods  according to analysts and investors.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Electronic Arts buying PopCap Games for up to $1.3 billion
article: NEW YORK Electronic Arts Inc   the video game publisher  is buying PopCap Games in a deal worth up to $1.3 billion as it tries to ramp up its social and casual games portfolio and better compete with Zynga Inc.

name: Apple Inc
headline: RIM annual meeting likely to exacerbate investor ire
article: TORONTO Research In Motion investors desperate for news about how the BlackBerry maker will reverse its sagging fortunes will likely leave Tuesday's annual meeting with their frustrations even more inflamed.

name: Apple Inc
headline: Analysis: Young startups demand steeper prices from VCs
article: SAN FRANCISCO A year ago  Mike Maples's investment firm  Floodgate  was investing in young companies at a pace of two or three every quarter. Now  he's backed just one startup all year and puts a big chunk of the blame on spiraling price tags.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

headline: Cisco to invest $100 mln in India's digital push
article: NEW DELHI Cisco Systems Inc will invest over $100 million in India to support the country's ambitious plan to connect thousands of its villages to the internet and create jobs  Executive Chairman John Chambers said on Friday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco buying Israel's Leaba Semiconductor for $320 million
article: TEL AVIV Cisco Systems  said on Wednesday it plans to acquire Israel's Leaba Semiconductor  a designer of networking chips  for $320 million in cash plus additional incentives to retain employees.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Ericsson and Cisco win order from Vodafone Portugal
article: * Ericsson and Cisco partner to transform Vodafone Portugal IP mobile backhaul

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Ericsson  Cisco show first fruits of partnership
article: BARCELONA  Feb 22 Ericsson and Cisco  said on Monday they will offer Ericsson's network service management tools  the first fruits of their partnership announced late last year

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco inks cloud sales deal with Pivotal
article: SAN FRANCISCO Cisco Systems Inc  has struck a deal with Pivotal Software Inc to offer each other's products in the cloud arena  a sign the giant network company is looking to work with others as it tries to build its presence in one of the fastest-growing areas of computing.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Earnings bolster Cisco  but raise concerns for broader IT spending
article: SAN FRANCISCO Networking giant Cisco Systems Inc reported it is weathering a global slowdown in information-technology spending  but signs potential customers are putting some projects on hold exacerbated concerns about broader IT growth.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco beats profit estimates  adds $15 billion to buyback
article: Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc reported a bigger-than-expected quarterly profit  helped by higher demand for its routers and security products  and added $15 billion to its share buyback program.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco to pay $1.4 billion for Internet of Things firm Jasper
article: Cisco Systems Inc said on Wednesday it was buying Jasper Technologies Inc  a startup that connects devices like cars and medical devices to the Internet  for $1.4 billion in cash and equity awards  its largest acquisition since 2013.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco to pay $1.4 bln for Internet of Things firm Jasper
article: Feb 3 Cisco Systems Inc said on Wednesday it was buying Jasper Technologies Inc  a startup that connects devices like cars and medical devices to the Internet  for $1.4 billion in cash and equity awards  its largest acquisition since 2013.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Commil scolds Federal Circuit for wasting time  resources after Cisco wins again
article: A patent holder in a years-long fight with Cisco Systems Inc has scolded a U.S. appeals court for wasting time and money ruling on an issue that was eventually reversed by the U.S. Supreme Court  only to later throw out the case on completely different grounds.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco wins U.S. patent dispute over wifi technology
article: NEW YORK Cisco Systems Inc did not infringe a patent holding company's wifi technology  a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday  reversing a near $64-million judgment against the networking equipment maker in the long-running patent dispute.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco reviews code after Juniper breach; more scrutiny expected
article: BOSTON Networking equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc said on Monday it has launched a product review to look for tampering after rival Juniper Networks Inc's disclosure it found code in firewall software that made in vulnerable to cyber attacks.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Tesla rival NextEV hires former Cisco tech chief Padmasree Warrior
article: Chinese electric car company NextEV has hired Cisco Systems Inc's former tech head  Padmasree Warrior  as its chief development officer and the chief executive of its U.S. unit.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Philips in lighting partnerships with Cisco  SAP and Bosch
article: AMSTERDAM Philips  has entered strategic partnerships with Cisco   SAP  and Bosch [ROBG.UL] under which each will jointly market networking systems using Philips programmable lights.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco chairman promises 'win-win' deal with China over network control
article: DUBAI Cisco’s  executive chairman on Monday declined to say whether it would cede to China’s demands to be able to control equipment deployed in the world’s largest internet market  instead pledging to find a “win-win” solution.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco wins chance to trim $16 mln patent payout to Australian research agency
article: The more than $16 million that Cisco Systems Inc was ordered to pay to Australia's national science agency for infringing a wifi patent is too high because a Delaware judge's damages award did not account for the patent's adoption as an international standard  a U.S. appeals court said on Thursday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Cisco to buy UK-based Acano to boost enterprise business
article: Nov 20 Cisco Systems Inc said it would buy UK-based Acano Ltd for $700 million in cash and equity awards  amid slowing order growth and weakness in the U.S. network gear maker's enterprise business outside the United States.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: NORDIC STOCKS - Factors to watch on Nov 16
article: The following stocks may be affected by newspaper reports and other factors on Monday:

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco second-quarter forecast misses on order slowdown
article: Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc's  forecast adjusted profit and revenue growth for the second quarter below analysts' estimates  citing a slowdown in order growth and weakness in its enterprise business outside the United States.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco  Ericsson reveal bigger ambitions for revenues in new partnership
article: BARCELONA The $1 billion in added revenue Cisco  and Ericsson  each expect to see by 2018 from their new partnership to build next-generation networks is just the beginning  top executives said on Wednesday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Ericsson cuts market growth view  looks beyond networks
article: STOCKHOLM Ericsson   the world's biggest mobile network equipment maker  pared back its market growth forecast on Tuesday  but said it could expand beyond its mainstay networks business  aided by a new deal with data network supplier Cisco.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Ericsson ceo says strategic partnership with Cisco its biggest so far
article: * Ericsson CEO says strategic partnership with Cisco its biggest so far  "you cannot even compare it".  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco buys Lancope for $452 million in latest security deal
article: Networking company Cisco Systems Inc  added to its small but growing security portfolio on Tuesday  saying it was acquiring privately held Lancope  which helps protect networks from cyber security breaches.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Big Cisco bet on France offers relief from Air France fiasco
article: PARIS Still reeling from front page images of shirtless Air France executives fleeing angry workers  the French government got a welcome boost on Thursday for its campaign to attract foreign investment from U.S. tech group Cisco.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco security researchers disable big distributor of 'ransomware'
article: SAN FRANCISCO Cisco Systems Inc said it had managed to disrupt the spread of one of the most pernicious systems for infecting Internet users with malicious software such as so-called ransomware  which demands payment for decrypting users' data.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Technicolor receives approval to take over CPE Division from Cisco Systems - ACM
article: * Technicolor is allowed to take over CPE Division from Cisco Systems  ACM decided Wednesday  Source text: http://bit.ly/1MrsxWG Further company coverage:    (Gdynia Newsroom)

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco router break-ins bypass cyber defenses
article: FRANKFURT (Company corrects the 15th paragraph beginning "The malicious programme..." to clarify that the nickname SYNful refers to the signal routers sent to open up communication with other routers  rather than how the implanted software jumps between routers.)

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Technicolor acquires The Mill
article: * Acquires London-based visual effects advertising company The Mill for 259 million euros ($291.8 million) on a debt-free basis

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Apple partners with Cisco to boost enterprise business
article: Apple Inc on Monday teamed up with network gear maker Cisco Systems Inc to improve the performance of its iPad and iPhone devices on Cisco's corporate network.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-OMERS tech fund raises C$260 million from Cisco  Bank of Montreal
article: TORONTO  Aug 17 OMERS Ventures  one of Canada's biggest venture-capital firms  said on Monday it has raised about C$260 million ($200 million) for a second fund to invest mainly in early-stage technology companies.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Wall St. ends flat as energy shares drop with oil
article: U.S. stocks finished flat on Thursday as a drop in energy shares offset a rebound in retail sales and stronger-than-expected Cisco results.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Strong U.S. sales help Cisco beat estimates
article: Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc  reported higher-than-expected quarterly revenue and profit as strong demand for its products in the United States more than offset weakness elsewhere.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Internet firms to be subject to new cybersecurity rules in EU
article: Internet firms such as Cisco  Google  and Amazon will be subject to a new EU cybersecurity law forcing them to adopt tough security measures and possibly report serious breaches to national authorities  according to a document seen by Reuters.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Amper finalises debt restructuring agreement with Cisco
article: * Said on Monday that the debt restructuring agreement that was signed by the company on July 16 was also signed by Cisco on July 20

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Amper to finalize debt restructuring with Cisco shortly
article: * Says to sign an agreement of payments with Cisco on its end today

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BlackBerry names Cisco veteran as new global head of sales
article: TORONTO BlackBerry Ltd named Carl Wiese as head of global sales on Monday  an appointment that comes at a critical juncture for the smartphone industry pioneer  which needs to spur top-line growth in order for its turnaround efforts to succeed.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: GM to test Cisco technology for sharing road safety spectrum
article: WASHINGTON General Motors Co plans to begin testing new Cisco Systems Inc technology that could allow "talking" cars to share radio communication bands with roadside Wi-Fi devices  a GM executive told U.S. lawmakers.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Cisco chief: achieving 5 pct of total revenues from India in 5 yrs seems possible

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: U.S. tech firm Cisco to invest $10 billion in China expansion
article: BEIJING Cisco  plans to invest more than $10 billion in China along with local business partners over the next several years  the U.S. network equipment maker said on Wednesday  as it seeks to shore up its position against strong domestic rivals.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: (Corrects headline to "for intelligent Wi-Fi network" from "to construct and manage an intelligent")  June 8 Cisco Systems Inc :   * Cisco  Sprint  and Kansas City  announce agreement to deploy smart+connected city framework   * Says Sprint will deploy Cisco hardware to construct and manage an intelligent wi-fi network   * Source text for Eikon    * Further company coverage

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Italtel eyes sale to private equity investor this summer - CEO
article: MILAN Italian telecoms equipment and software supplier Italtel has hired investment bank JP Morgan  to seek buyers  in particular among private equity funds  and expects to reach a deal this summer  its chief executive told Reuters on Friday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Bluegrace United investment in Amper conditional upon closure of negotiations with Cisco
article: * Said on Wednesday that Bluegrace United Ltd had not provided the proof for availability of funds to take part in Amper capital increase  as it decided not to carry out its investment until the negotiations with Cisco are completed

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Scalia says Cisco ruling by high court will increase power of 'patent trolls'
article: NEW YORK U.S. Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia  no stranger to speaking his mind both from the bench and in his opinions  used the derogatory term "patent trolls" in a strongly-worded dissent on Tuesday  saying the controversial entities have been handed a victory by the majority's opinion in a case involving Cisco Systems Inc.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco profit edges past estimates despite weak telecom spending
article: Cisco Systems Inc's  quarterly profit edged past market estimates as demand for new switches  routers  wireless gear and servers made up for sluggish spending by telecom customers and weak sales in emerging markets.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco looks to salesman Robbins for tech leadership
article: SEATTLE Chuck Robbins  the veteran salesman chosen by Cisco Systems Inc to succeed legendary CEO John Chambers  must prove he has the technical knowledge to chart a new course and lead the network equipment maker into the new world of cloud-based computing.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco veteran Robbins to take over as CEO from Chambers
article: Cisco Systems Inc Chief Executive John Chambers will step down in July after 20 years at the helm of the network equipment maker  a symbol of the dot.com stock boom 15 years ago now struggling to boost its bottom line in the era of cloud computing.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: PARIS U.S. network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc. plans to invest $100 million in French start-ups  French Prime Minister Manuel Valls' office said on Monday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Wall St. ends sharply higher on tech  Ukraine deal
article: NEW YORK U.S. stocks ended sharply higher on Thursday  with a rally in technology stocks leading the Nasdaq to a 15-year high  while a ceasefire agreement between Russia and Ukraine also eased tensions.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc  reported stronger-than-expected quarterly revenue and profit as demand for switching equipment and routers helped to make up for weak spending by the company's traditional telecom customers. | Video

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: TEL AVIV  Feb 10 Team8  an Israeli venture capital fund focused on the cyber-security industry  said on Tuesday it had raised $18 million in its first round of funding  including investment from Alcatel-Lucent and Cisco .

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Internet firms push to be left out of EU cybersecurity law
article: BRUSSELS Internet companies like Cisco  and Google  are seeking to be excluded from a new EU cybersecurity law that would force them to adopt tough security measures and report serious security breaches to national authorities.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco Systems sues rival for infringement of network patents

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Weak telecom spending  emerging markets weigh on Cisco forecast
article: Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc forecast current-quarter profit below analysts' average estimate  weighed down by capital budget cuts at telecom service providers and weak sales in emerging markets.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: BEIJING Cisco Systems Inc will establish an $80 million joint venture with Chinese hardware manufacturer TCL Corp to invest in commercial cloud computing services  TCL said in a stock exchange filing on Thursday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

name: Cisco Systems Inc

name: Cisco Systems Inc

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Cisco Systems Inc  forecast tepid current-quarter results and said it plans to cut another 6 000 jobs  as the network equipment maker works through a transition toward a new cycle of high-end switches and routers.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco to buy networking software maker Tail-f Systems
article: June 17 Cisco Systems Inc said it would buy privately held Swedish networking software maker Tail-f Systems for about $175 million to expand its network management and automation business.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500 at fresh record  small caps continue to bounce
article: * Cisco shares up on Deutsche Bank upgrade  price target hike

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK Cisco Systems Inc's chief executive officer has written a letter to President Barack Obama urging him to curtail government surveillance after evidence circulated showing the National Security Agency had intercepted Cisco equipment  a company spokesman said on Sunday.

article: (Corrects paragraph 4 to say book-to-bill ratio  not book-to-build ratio)

headline: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Cisco's revenue falls less-than-expected  shares up
article: (Corrects headline and first paragraph to say shares rose instead of fell)

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Dow  S&P 500 end at record highs again
article: NEW YORK The Dow and the S&P 500 eked out record closing highs again on Tuesday  while the Nasdaq resumed its recent slide  dragged down by shares of Cisco . | Video

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco Investments commits $150 million to start-up companies
article: SAN FRANCISCO Cisco's corporate venture-capital arm said it would deploy $150 million to start-up companies over the next two to three years  accelerating its investments into areas such as Internet-enabled communication between objects.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Arista Networks Inc  which makes network switches for large data centers  filed for an initial public offering on Monday  the latest in a string of cloud computing firms tapping investor enthusiasm around the technology.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Spherix Inc  which buys and licenses technology patents  said it filed a lawsuit against Cisco Inc alleging infringement of 11 patents Spherix acquired from Nortel Networks.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Cisco Systems Inc plans to offer cloud computing services  pledging to spend $1 billion over the next two years to enter a market currently led by the world's biggest online retailer Amazon.com Inc.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO  March 19 Online storage provider Box Inc has appointed Cisco Systems Inc senior executive Padmasree Warrior to its board of directors  the company said Wednesday  as it gears up for its anticipated stock market flotation.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco says probing possible bribery in Russia  other countries
article: NEW YORK Cisco Systems Inc is investigating potential violations of U.S. bribery laws by the company and its resellers in Russia  Eastern Europe and Central Asia  but doesn't expect financial results to be materially affected  it said in a regulatory filing.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Videoconferencing equipment maker Polycom Inc said it eliminated the position of chief operating officer at a time when the company is cutting costs to better compete against rivals such as Cisco and Google.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK  Feb 24 (IFR) - Cisco Systems has launched an US$8 billion seven-tranche jumbo bond issue after being deluged with more than US$21 billion of orders for its first debt transaction in three years.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK Stocks closed higher on Thursday  with the Nasdaq rising for a sixth straight day  as investors looked past disappointing data on consumer spending  chalking the weakness up to weather instead of weaker fundamentals. | Video

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: BRIEF-Cisco CEO says Q3 revenue to decline in 6-8 pct range
article: Feb 12 Cisco Systems Inc :  * CEO says Q3 revenue to decline in 6-8 percent range  * CFO says expects non-GAAP EPS of 47-49 cents per share  * CFO says expects Q3 non-GAAP gross margin in 61-62 percent range

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: FireEye takes on Cisco  Palo Alto with new cyber product
article: Cybersecurity firm FireEye Inc plans to take on Cisco Systems Inc and Palo Alto Networks Inc in selling intrusion prevention systems  which help companies detect cyber threats that breach their firewalls.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: WASHINGTON The volume of data crossing U.S. mobile networks will grow almost eight-fold by 2018  and demand for Internet-connected devices will also skyrocket  according to a report released on Wednesday that poses questions about U.S. spectrum policy.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Google Inc entered into a patent cross-licensing agreement with Cisco Systems Inc  the internet search giant's second such deal in as many months.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: DAVOS  Switzerland  Jan 24 Pepsico  Nestle and Cisco on Friday announced major investments that together totaled more than $7 billion in Mexico  where the government has pushed through a series of economic reforms that aim to boost foreign investment and growth.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Germany should ban U.S. contracting companies passing data to NSA: report
article: BERLIN U.S. contracting companies such as Cisco  which manages much of the German armed forces' data  should be contractually barred from passing sensitive information to the U.S. security services  a spokesman for Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservatives was quoted saying.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco plans to add 1 700 jobs in Canadian expansion
article: TORONTO Cisco Systems Inc will expand its research and development operations in Ontario  looking to add 1 700 jobs in the Canadian province over the next six years  the U.S. network equipment maker said on Friday.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK Cisco Systems Inc on Thursday cut its longer-term earnings and revenue growth targets due to problems in emerging markets  conservative customer spending and stalling growth in its core business of network equipment  the latest in a drumbeat of bleak developments at the Silicon Valley company.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO Signs of rapidly worsening Chinese demand for IT giants IBM and Cisco Systems Inc are starting to spook Hewlett-Packard investors.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Insight: For Cisco and Huawei  a bruising rivalry reaches stalemate
article: Cisco Systems Inc and Huawei Technologies Co  two of the world's largest communications equipment makers  have been slugging it out for a decade now - in court  in emerging markets  in the lobbies of government and even on blogs.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco warns of big second quarter revenue drop  shares fall
article: NEW YORK Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc warned that its revenue would decline between 8 percent and 10 percent in its second fiscal quarter  sending its shares down almost 10 percent in late trade.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Exclusive: Cisco rival Arista Networks picks banks for IPO - sources
article: NEW YORK Arista Networks  a maker of network switches that competes with much bigger rival Cisco Systems Inc  has selected banks to lead a proposed initial public offering for next year  according to people familiar with the matter.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc  looking to protect its core business from new competition  has bought out the remainder of its majority-owned data center technology start-up  Insieme  in a deal that could cost up to $863 million.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK Motorola Solutions Inc is exploring the sale of its underperforming wireless LAN business  which has grappled with declining share in a market dominated by rivals such as Cisco Systems Inc  people familiar with the matter said.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO BlackBerry Ltd  on the block as its smartphone business struggles  is in talks with Cisco Systems  Google Inc and SAP about selling them all or parts of itself  several sources close to the matter said.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
headline: Cisco and Facebook collaborating to offer free public Wi-Fi
article: NEW YORK  Oct 2 Cisco Systems Inc said on Wednesday it was working with Facebook Inc to offer free Wi-Fi Internet access to consumers at public places such as hotels or retail stores using their Facebook log-in.

name: Cisco Systems Inc

article: Cisco Systems Inc Chief Executive John Chambers' total annual compensation almost doubled  the world's biggest network equipment maker said in a regulatory filing.

name: Cisco Systems Inc
