headline: TEXT - S&P rates Comcast Corp proposed notes 'BBB+'
article: Nov 29 Standard & Poor's today assigned Philadelphia  Pa.-based broadband cable TV operator and media and entertainment provider Comcast Corp.'s     proposed senior notes issue of an unspecified amount its 'BBB+' issue level rating. Existing ratings on the company  including the 'BBB+' long-term and 'A-2' short-term corporate credit ratings  remain unchanged. The long-term rating outlook is stable. We assume that pro forma for the new debt issuance  leverage will remain in the low- to mid-2x are

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast's NBCUniversal unit lays off 500 employees: source
article: LOS ANGELES Comcast Corp's NBCUniversal entertainment unit is laying off about 500 employees at cable channels  Jay Leno's late-night TV show and the Universal Pictures movie studio  a person with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: TEXT - Fitch affirms Comcast Corp 'BBB+' issuer default rating
article: Nov 8 - Fitch Ratings has affirmed the 'BBB+' Issuer Default Ratings (IDRs) assigned to Comcast Corporation (Comcast) and its wholly owned subsidiaries included in Comcast's cross-guaranty structure that hold all  of the company's cable businesses. Fitch has also affirmed the 'BBB' IDR  assigned to NBCUniversal Media  LLC (NBCUniversal)  a direct wholly owned  subsidiary of NBCUniversal  LLC. NBCUniversal  LLC is a joint venture between  Comcast and General Electric Company (GE). Comcast manages

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: U.S. top court reviews Comcast  Amgen class actions
article: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court considered appeals by Comcast Corp  and Amgen Inc  that could help determine what kind of evidence must be presented before companies may be the subject of class-action lawsuits.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 3-Hurricane Sandy disrupts Northeast US telecom networks
article: * FCC says 25 percent of region's cell towers out of action

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 3-NBC Olympics coverage boosts Comcast quarterly results
article: * Earnings of 46 cents a share match Wall Street estimates

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Tennis Channel's upgrade on Comcast stalled pending appeal
article: WASHINGTON Comcast Corp will not have to move the independent Tennis Channel to a tier in line with competing sports networks until a pending court challenge is concluded  a U.S. appeals court said on Friday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast losses bid to limit class action case
article: In the latest test of U.S. class action limits  telecoms firm Comcast Corp. lost a bid on Tuesday to force a customer who filed an antitrust class action to arbitrate individually  when a judge ruled it would be too costly for the customer.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: RPT-After Olympics success  Bell poised for promotion at NBC
article: * Producer well-regarded by Comcast  open to anything - sources

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: After Olympics success  Bell poised for promotion at NBC
article: * Producer well-regarded by Comcast  open to anything - sources

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Verizon Wireless spectrum deal near regulatory approval: WSJ
article: U.S. regulators are close to approving Verizon Wireless's proposed $3.9 billion spectrum purchase from several cable companies  including Comcast Corp  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people close to the negotiations.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast seeks court reversal of FCC Tennis Channel ruling
article: Aug 1 Comcast Corp said it had asked a federal appeals court to reverse a ruling of the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) that could make the cable company distribute the Tennis Channel to more subscribers and result in millions of dollars in costs.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast profit beats; Olympics seen at break-even
article: Comcast Corp  posted a higher-than-expected profit on Wednesday as an increase in Internet and phone customers offset weakness at its NBC Universal unit  and executives said the company no longer expected to lose money on its expensive Olympics 2012 coverage.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Tennis Channel ekes out FCC win over Comcast on carriage rules
article: WASHINGTON The Federal Communications Commission upheld an administrative law judge's ruling that Comcast Corp discriminated against the Tennis Channel when it placed the network in a more expensive viewing tier than Comcast's affiliated sports networks.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast buys Microsoft stake in MSNBC.com
article: Comcast Corp  the parent company of NBC  has bought out Microsoft Corp's 50 percent stake in MSNBC.com for a reported $300 million to assume full control of the news website.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: TEXT-S&P: Comcast  Disney ratings are unchanged
article: July 11 - Standard & Poor's said today that the Comcast Corp.  (BBB+/Stable/A-2) and The Walt Disney Co. (A/Stable/A-1) ratings and outlook are unaffected by the announced agreement by its NBCUniversal unit to sell its 15.8% interest in A&E Television Networks LLC for $3.025 billion in cash. The other owners in A&E include Hearst Corp. (unrated) and Walt Disney Co.  which each own approximately 42%. Given Comcast Corp.'s relatively small stake in A&E  we did not view this as a strategic investme

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast's NBC to sell A&E Television stake for $3 billion
article: Cable operator Comcast Corp said its NBC Universal unit will sell its 15.8 percent stake in History Channel owner A&E Television Networks LLC to the other partners in the venture for $3.02 billion in cash.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast to pay $800 000 to resolve FCC probe
article: WASHINGTON The U.S. Federal Communications Commission said on Wednesday that Comcast Corp would pay $800 000 to resolve an investigation of its broadband-related merger conditions.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: TEXT-S&P rates Comcast Corp snr unsecured notes
article: June 25 - Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said today that it assigned its 'BBB+' issue-level rating to Comcast Corp.'s $2.25 billion in aggregate notes issuances  which consist of $1 billion of senior notes due 2022 and $1.25 billion of senior notes due 2042. The company intends to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes  including repayment of its $575 million senior notes due 2056 and $202 million of senior notes due 2012. The company recently announced an optional redemption for th

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Supreme Court to hear Comcast antitrust appeal
article: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court agreed to review Comcast Corp's appeal of a ruling that let cable TV subscribers in the Philadelphia area sue as a group over alleged overcharges stemming from an effort to monopolize that market.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-U.S. probes cable TV barriers to Internet video
article: LOS ANGELES  June 13 The U.S. Department of Justice is investigating whether cable television companies are improperly suppressing competition from  Internet companies and online video services  according to two people with direct knowledge of the probe.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast studio hunts for new COO: sources
article: LOS ANGELES Universal Pictures Vice Chairman Rick Finkelstein  the studio's chief operating officer for 12 years  decided to retire  sources told Reuters  a move that will allow Comcast Corp to put its imprint on leadership of the studio it acquired in 2009 along with parent NBC Universal.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Disney Channel to go mobile soon; CEO blasts Dish
article: LOS ANGELES Walt Disney Co plans as early as next week to launch a mobile application to let Comcast Corp cable TV subscribers watch the Disney Channel on the go  Chief Executive Officer Bob Iger told investors on Wednesday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Verizon unveils video app with Comcast  Netflix
article: NEW YORK Verizon Wireless plans to launch a mobile video streaming application later this month with content from everybody from Comcast Corp to Netflix Inc as the mobile provider looks to increase usage on its mobile network.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Battleship bomb may hit studio's profits: analysts
article: Battleship  Universal Picture's big budget science fiction film  is likely to dent the studio's profits after it opened with lower than forecast ticket sales  according to analysts.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast trying out Internet usage pricing  dropping caps
article: Comcast Corp said on Thursday it will introduce a trial for usage-based billing for its Internet subscribers in a move seen to pre-empt more complaints the cable company favors its own Web video service over rivals.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: GE reaches deals to buy two mining equipment firms
article: General Electric Co  said on Tuesday it was buying two mining equipment firms  Australia's Industrea Ltd  for $700 million as well as a privately held U.S. company  as it seeks to boost its presence in a $61 billion industry.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: RLPC: Comcast markets $6.25B refi
article: NEW YORK  May 8 Comcast Corp is in market with a $6.25 billion five-year unsecured revolver  sources told Thomson Reuters LPC. JP Morgan  Citi  Morgan Stanley MUFG Loan Partners and Wells Fargo lead the deal that will refinance an existing corporate revolver from January 2008. The loan launched today.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast to sell "substantial portion" of stake in A&E
article: NEW YORK Comcast Corp's NBCUniversal business exercised an option to sell "a substantial portion" of its stake in A&E Television Networks to joint-venture partners  a filing from the media company showed.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: FCC sides with Bloomberg over Comcast dispute
article: The Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday told Comcast Corp that it must place Bloomberg LP's financial news channel near other independent news channels in its channel lineup.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Court bars challenge to bundled cable channels
article: SAN FRANCISCO Television programmers and distributors do not have to face a lawsuit that sought to compel them to sell cable channels separately to consumers  instead of in multi-channel packages  a U.S. appeals court ruled.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Verizon tells Congress cable deals ease spectrum crunch
article: WASHINGTON Verizon Communications and Comcast executives  in testimony on Capitol Hill on Wednesday  defended joint spectrum and marketing deals as a way for the wireless carrier to handle a coming spectrum crunch.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast makes good on diversity promise - will it pay?
article: LOS ANGELES (TheWrap.com) - Just how serious is Comcast about attracting Latino and African-American viewers?

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast to take on Netflix with Web video service
article: Comcast Corp  the No. 1 U.S. cable operator  became the latest major name to take on Netflix Inc on Tuesday when it announced plans for an online video service offering a library of TV shows and movies.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast profit beats Street on subscriber gains
article: Comcast Corp  posted a better-than-expected rise in quarterly profit driven by strong subscriber additions  though it was tempered by weak performances at its NBC Universal broadcast and movie units.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Disney to recognize some ESPN revenue earlier
article: Walt Disney Co's ESPN cable network will recognize some affiliate revenue earlier in the year as a result of a new agreement with Comcast Corp  Chief Financial Officer Jay Rasulo said on Thursday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast  Disney ink 10-year carriage deal for TV  Web
article: Comcast Corp  the largest U.S. cable operator  and Walt Disney Co on Wednesday said they had reached a comprehensive 10-year programming carriage deal for TV  Web and handheld devices.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast CEO to pay $500 000 antitrust penalty
article: Comcast Corp Chief Executive Officer Brian Roberts will pay a $500 000 civil penalty for failing to notify antitrust authorities before acquiring voting securities in the cable company as part of his compensation package  the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast to start selling Verizon mobile early 2012
article: NEW YORK - NEW YORK Comcast Corp  the largest U.S. cable operator  will start selling Verizon Wireless products in four markets early next year  its top cable executive said on Monday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Verizon to buy cable spectrum  pressuring rivals
article: Verizon Wireless will pay top U.S. cable providers $3.6 billion for wireless airwaves and let them resell its mobile service  heating up competition with the wireless company's chief rivals.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast CFO Angelakis adds vice chairman role
article: Nov 23 Comcast Corp   the largest U.S. cable TV operator  has given Chief Financial Officer Michael Angelakis the additional title of vice chairman  according to a U.S. securities filing on Wednesday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Text-Fitch affirms Comcast NBCUniversal IDRs
article: CHICAGO  November 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the 'BBB+' Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) assigned to Comcast Corporation (Comcast) and its wholly owned subsidiaries included in Comcast's cross-guaranty structure that hold all of the company's cable businesses.     Fitch has also affirmed the 'BBB' IDR assigned to NBCUniversal Media  LLC (NBCUniversal)  a direct wholly owned subsidiary of NBCUniversal  LLC. NBCUniversal  LLC is a joint venture between Comcast and General Electric Company (

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Losing in fall ratings  NBC says the race is long
article: The network is down 11 percent in the ratings  while its rival networks gain or hold steady. It is the only network already to have canceled two shows this season. And according to Comcast earnings released Wednesday  its third-quarter ad revenue was flat.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Cable TV drives results at Time Warner  Comcast
article: Comcast Corp and Time Warner Inc reported stronger quarterly results on Wednesday  confirming that it pays to have a solid lineup of cable networks -- at least while advertisers keep spending.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Baseball eyes new $1B TV contract in off-season
article: Oct 31 The Major League Baseball season just ended  but the league is already weighing plans for a new television contract potentially worth more than $1 billion.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Hulu sale called off after months of talks
article: LOS ANGELES An attempted sale of online video website Hulu has fallen through after months of difficult and complex negotiations between owners such as Walt Disney Co and potential buyers.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Hulu taken off the block
article: The joint owners of Hulu  said they have decided against a sale of the popular online video service amid rumors that the bids received were lower than they were willing to accept.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Universal abandons "Tower Heist" early video on demand
article: LOS ANGELES (TheWrap) - Universal cried uncle on Wednesday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: U.S. FCC draws tough court for Web rule lawsuits
article: WASHINGTON  Oct 6 Challenges to new U.S. Internet traffic rules will be heard in the federal appeals court in Washington D.C.  a court that has previously been skeptical of the Federal Communications Commission's authority.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Microsoft reaches 40 content deals for Xbox
article: Microsoft Corp  has struck more than 40 deals with TV and entertainment companies  making it possible for owners of its Xbox gaming console who are also paying cable subscribers to watch live television through the devices.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Controversial "Playboy Club" first victim of TV season
article: LOS ANGELES Controversial new drama "The Playboy Club" was axed on Tuesday by NBC after just three episodes  making it the first victim of the new fall TV season.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Dolphin Tale jumps to top of movie box office
article: LOS ANGELES Simba the lion may rule the jungle  but he couldn't beat a plucky dolphin at the weekend box office. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Verizon asks court to halt FCC net neutrality rule
article: Verizon Communications Inc on Friday asked a federal appeals court to block the Federal Communications Commission from imposing new rules on how Internet service providers manage their networks.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Consumer group challenges new U.S. Internet rules
article: * Free Press disputes distinction between wired  wireless

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: In switch  cable operators want to go "a la carte"
article: NEW YORK Cable operators are privately working on a plan to force programmers to unbundle their networks and allow customers to subscribe to channels on an individual basis.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: 3D "Lion King" rules box office for second week
article: LOS ANGELES "The Lion King" fended off Brad Pitt to keep the box-office crown for a second straight weekend.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: U.S. Internet rules to take effect November 20
article: Long-delayed U.S. Internet rules that tackle the controversial issue of balancing consumer and content provider interests against those who sell access to the Web will take effect November 20.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: DirecTV customer growth "very good" in Q3: CEO
article: NEW YORK Leading U.S. satellite TV provider DirecTV Group is having a "very  very good" third quarter in terms of subscriber growth  Chief Executive Mike White said on Thursday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Hulu has more than 1 million paying subscribers: CEO
article: NEW YORK Hulu  the popular online video service which has been put up for sale by its joint owners  now has more than 1 million paying subscribers  Chief Executive Jason Kilar said on Wednesday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast sues to void 8 BT Group network patents
article: * BT threatening to add Comcast to lawsuit  Comcast says

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Emmy viewers down  mixed reviews for host Jane Lynch
article: LOS ANGELES Viewership for the 2011 Primetime Emmy Awards fell 8 percent from last year to just over 12 million Americans who watched Jane Lynch host the heavily promoted TV show that drew mixed critical reviews. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Mad Men tries to fend off "Boardwalk" at Emmys
article: LOS ANGELES Television's "Mad Men" went to the Primetime Emmy Awards on Sunday  hoping to fend off the Prohibition-era gangsters of "Boardwalk Empire" and win a fourth straight victory at the industry's top honors.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Hulu sale at risk even as new bids are due
article: NEW YORK The auction of online video site Hulu has been slowed by recent developments which could derail it completely  according to sources familiar with the process.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Hollywood rolls out red carpet for Cowell's "X Factor"
article: LOS ANGELES There aren't many reality TV shows that stage their own world premiere. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: HOW TO PLAY IT - Did Netflix's very bad day create value?
article: THE ISSUE: Netflix Inc   one of the most closely-watched "momentum" stocks"  dropped nearly 20 percent on Thursday. Is it time to buy 'bargain' shares in the fast-expanding web video service?

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Few sure winners seen at the Emmy Awards
article: LOS ANGELES If there are any sure bets at this year's Primetime Emmy Awards on Sunday  they are "Modern Family" again being crowned TV's best comedy series and Kate Winslet winning for her role in "Mildred Pierce". | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: FCC's Internet rules clear a review hurdle
article: WASHINGTON Controversial new Internet rules adopted late last year by the Federal Communications Commission will soon be published officially  a step expected to trigger legal challenges.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Contagion catches box office lead
article: LOS ANGELES "Contagion" gripped filmgoers as the thriller about the race to contain a deadly virus took hold of the top spot at the domestic box office and knocked hit drama "The Help" to second place. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Analysis: Plenty of backstage drama in TV season
article: NEW YORK This fall's TV schedule will be full of twenty-somethings looking for love  singers searching out fame and dinosaurs hunting down dinner -- and if that's not enough  there promises to be a heap of drama behind the scenes.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: NBC reporter Andrea Mitchell has breast cancer
article: WASHINGTON Andrea Mitchell  NBC's chief foreign affairs correspondent and wife of former Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan  said on her TV program on Wednesday that she has breast cancer.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-SeaChange Q2 misses market estimates
article: * Shares fall 6 pct in after-market trade   (Follows alerts)

article: * Summer sales break Hollywood record  (Adds details on top five films  summer sales totals)

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: The Help hangs on to box office crown
article: LOS ANGELES Surprise summer hit "The Help" retained the No. 1 spot at movie theater box offices on Sunday  beating back three newcomers and appearing headed for victory over a long U.S. holiday weekend. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Relax football fans: Obama speech won't trump NFL
article: WASHINGTON American football fans can rest easy: President Barack Obama's nationally televised jobs speech to Congress will not conflict with the season-opening NFL game between the Green Bay Packers and New Orleans Saints.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: U.S. moves to block AT&T  T-Mobile deal
article: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK The Obama administration sued to block AT&T Inc's $39 billion acquisition of wireless rival T-Mobile on concerns it would harm competition  launching its biggest challenge yet to a takeover and dealing the carrier a potentially costly blow. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: U.S. vote in 2012 will be record  $6 billion election
article: WASHINGTON Forget the struggling economy. There's one U.S. industry -- Big Politics -- that is looking ahead to a record year in 2012.

article: * "Apes" global total now tops $300 mln  (Corrects spelling of "Colombiana" paragraph 5)

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: The Help holds on at top of storm-hit box office
article: LOS ANGELES The hard-working maids of "The Help" hung on to the top of a storm-battered box office over the weekend and beat a trio of new releases with $14.3 million in domestic ticket sales  studio estimates released on Sunday showed.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: SK Telecom says no plan to bid for Hulu
article: SEOUL  Aug 25 South Korea's top mobile carrier  SK Telecom   said on Thursday that it had no plans to bid for U.S. online video site Hulu.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: US cable cos challenge plan for broadband subsidies
article: WASHINGTON  Aug 24 U.S. cable companies are warning regulators about a plan that would give traditional phone companies a first bite at government subsidies to build out broadband in underserved areas.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: The Help outflexes "Conan" to win box office
article: LOS ANGELES The maids of "The Help" proved far mightier than muscle-flexing "Conan the Barbarian" and three other new releases at the weekend box office  taking the top spot with an estimated $20.5 million in U.S. and Canadian ticket sales.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: 'Real Housewives' to be tweaked after Armstrong suicide
article: LOS ANGELES  Aug 19 Reality TV show "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" is being re-edited following the suicide of Russell Armstrong in a strong indication that the network plans to go ahead with the second season.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Box office heading toward record despite economy
article: LOS ANGELES A popular boy wizard  comic-book heroes and some foul-mouthed women are leading Hollywood toward a record-breaking summer despite the sour economy and high unemployment resulting in tightened consumer spending. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Cable execs wary as Google acquires Motorola boxes
article: NEW YORK The pay-TV industry is nervously watching Google Inc's acquisition of Motorola Mobility -- the largest supplier of set-top boxes to consumers' homes.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business news - August 15
article: Aug 15 The following were the top stories on The New York Times business pages on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-'Apes' hangs on to domestic box office lead
article: * 'Smurfs' ring up strong overseas sales  (Adds quotes  details on film sales)

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Cable  satellite TV feel economic pinch
article: NEW YORK Cable and satellite TV providers lost more subscribers than ever in the second quarter  as tough economic conditions and stiffer competition from telephone companies hurt performance.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Verizon strike tensions heighten on Day 2
article: NEW YORK The second day of a strike by Verizon workers turned ugly after unions accused managers of injuring three workers while driving past picket lines  and the phone giant complained of a spike in network sabotage cases.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Apes take box office with $77 milllion globally
article: LOS ANGELES Chimps reigned over humans  Smurfs and aliens at movie theaters over the weekend as "Rise of the Planet of the Apes" climbed to the top of box office charts with global ticket sales of $77.4 million. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast sues DirecTV  says false ads lure NFL fans
article: NEW YORK Comcast Corp  the largest U.S. cable operator  has sued pay TV rival DirecTV  accusing it of misleading consumers by promising "free" broadcasts of National Football League games.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Big media's profits defy gloomy outlook  for now
article: NEW YORK Big media companies reported strong results but a bleak economic outlook has investors worried over whether they can deliver again in the face of high unemployment and slumping U.S. consumer spending.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Broadband closer to advertised speeds: study
article: WASHINGTON Broadband speeds on average are within 80 percent of what major Internet service providers advertise  a big improvement from two years ago  according to a government study.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast renames Versus as NBC Sports Network
article: NEW YORK Comcast Corp  trying to capitalize on the lucrative sports television market  will re-brand its Versus cable channel as the NBC Sports Network starting next year  it said on Monday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Surprise box office tie for "Cowboys"  "Smurfs"
article: LOS ANGELES The tiny blue "Smurfs" battled big-name  big-budget "Cowboys & Aliens" to a surprising tie at the domestic weekend box office with each film ringing up an estimated $36.2 million in ticket sales  according to studio estimates on Sunday. | Video

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Amazon unveils latest video streaming deal
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com unveiled its latest video streaming deal on Thursday as the world's largest Internet retailer adds more digital content ahead of the expected launch of a new tablet computer later this year.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: TV watchdog says "Playboy Club" glamorizes porn
article: LOS ANGELES A TV watchdog group on Wednesday accused NBC of glamorizing the porn industry in its upcoming new drama series "The Playboy Club" and urged NBC affiliates around the United States not to air it.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Reid's debt plan could speed wireless auctions
article: WASHINGTON Efforts to give U.S. regulators the authority to auction off some television airwaves for mobile broadband use are getting a boost in a debt ceiling plan proposed by Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-'Captain America' shoots down 'Harry Potter'
article: * 'Captain America' $66 mln puts it No. 1 in U.S.  Canada

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Stan Lee reveals details of new comic "Seekers"
article: SAN DIEGO Comic book legend Stan Lee on Friday revealed details of his new web-based  digital series "The Seekers " saying it is set in modern times on an Earth in danger of imminent destruction.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Comcast awards media work to WPP  Publicis
article: NEW YORK  July 21 Comcast Corp   the largest U.S. cable company  has awarded its $1 billion media strategy and planning account to Publicis Groupe SA's  Starcom MediaVest and WPP Plc's  Maxus and MediaCom agencies.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Hollywood turns on the starpower for Comic-Con
article: LOS ANGELES Heading into this year's giant Comic-Con International pop culture convention in San Diego  media watchers believed Hollywood might play a smaller role because some heavily promoted movies there in 2010 fizzled at box offices.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Final "Harry Potter" wields big wand at box office
article: LOS ANGELES Harry Potter's final film adventure has bolted to a big start at worldwide box offices  breaking the record for midnight screenings in the U.S. and Canada with $43.5 million and setting the stage for a massive weekend debut.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Lesser-known networks spark Emmy buzz in Hollywood
article: LOS ANGELES With 104 Emmy nominations on Thursday  cable TV's HBO again dominated rival networks for the industry's highest awards  but several nods from lesser-known networks truly had Hollywood talking.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: NBC names Jennifer Salke entertainment president
article: LOS ANGELES NBC television on Wednesday appointed a top Twentieth Century Fox Television executive as its new entertainment programing chief.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Transformers global box office hits $645 million
article: LOS ANGELES Big-budget action film "Transformers: Dark of the Moon" won the battle of the box office for the second-straight weekend  generating $140 million in global ticket sales and pushing its worldwide total since its debut to $645 million  studio estimates showed on Sunday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: U.S. Internet providers to act against online pirates
article: LOS ANGELES Consumers who illegally download copyrighted films  music or television shows might see their Internet speed slowed or access restricted under an industry anti-piracy effort announced on Thursday.

name: Comcast Corporation
headline: Internet providers to act against online pirates
article: LOS ANGELES Consumers who illegally download copyrighted films  music or television shows might see their Internet speed slowed or access restricted under an industry anti-piracy effort announced on Thursday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's Sandberg cites need to do more after reports of Russia meddling
article: Facebook Inc's Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Tuesday the company needs to step up its efforts to curb misinformation after research revealed that Russia-backed organizations targeted African-Americans  who favored Hillary Clinton  to suppress voter turnout during the 2016 election.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Irish regulator investigates Facebook over private photo glitch
article: An Irish regulator said on Friday it was investigating Facebook Inc  following the company's disclosure that a bug may have exposed private photos of up to 6.8 million users  the latest in a series of Facebook privacy glitches. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Police sound 'all clear' after bomb threat at Facebook's Silicon Valley campus
article: SAN FRANCISCO A bomb threat prompted authorities on Tuesday to evacuate a building at the Silicon Valley headquarters of Facebook Inc   police said  but gave the "all clear" after an hours-long search turned up no sign of a device. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Instagram promotes Vishal Shah as head of product
article: Facebook Inc's photo-sharing app Instagram said on Monday it promoted its director of product management Vishal Shah as the head of product  effective immediately.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook to buy back additional $9 billion of shares
article: Facebook Inc  will buy back an additional $9 billion of its shares  as it looks to pacify investors following a slump in its stock.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Fed up with Facebook  U.S. fund managers look for alternatives
article: NEW YORK Facebook Inc's  losses are becoming other companies' gains. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 4-Facebook gave data on user's friends to certain companies -documents
article: Dec 5 Facebook Inc offered some companies  including Netflix and Airbnb  access to data about users' friends it did not make available to most other apps in 2015  according to documents released by a British lawmaker who said the social media company dodged questions about privacy practices and market dominance.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Instagram's new feature allows users to share stories with smaller group
article: Facebook Inc's Instagram said on Friday it launched a new feature dubbed "Close Friends" allowing users to share their stories with a smaller group of people.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook starts verification for UK political ads
article: UK advertisers seeking to run political ads on Facebook Inc  must now confirm their identity  location and reveal who paid for the ad  the social network said on Thursday as it faces increasing scrutiny following the Cambridge Analytica scandal.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: U.S. rights groups seek secret documents in Facebook encryption case
article: SAN FRANCISCO Two civil rights groups asked a judge on Wednesday to release documents describing a secret U.S. government effort to force Facebook Inc to decrypt voice conversations between users on its Messenger app.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Former Facebook worker says firm not doing enough to deal with racial discrimination
article: A former Facebook Inc  employee who worked closely with racial minority groups said in a blog post https://www.facebook.com/notes/mark-s-luckie/facebook-is-failing-its-black-employees-and-its-black-users/1931075116975013 on Tuesday that he left this month over frustration with the social network's "systematic disenfranchisement of underrepresented voices" and other diversity issues.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp hires Ezetap's Bose to be its India head
article: MUMBAI Facebook-owned WhatsApp said on Wednesday it had hired Abhijit Bose  the co-founder and chief executive of Indian mobile payments firm Ezetap  to be the head of its operations in India  its biggest market by users.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 3-Facebook sued by Russian firm linked to woman charged by U.S.
article: Nov 20 A Russian company whose accountant was charged by federal prosecutors for attempting to meddle in U.S. elections sued Facebook Inc on Tuesday  claiming it is a legitimate news outlet and its Facebook account should be restored.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook to fund trainee local newspaper reporters in Britain
article: LONDON Facebook is donating 4.5 million pounds ($5.8 million) to train journalists in Britain to support communities that have lost local newspapers and reporters  in no little part due to ad revenue and readers switching online to the social media giant.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT- S&P  Dow gain; Nasdaq dragged down by Nvidia  Facebook
article: Nov 16 The S&P 500 and Dow Industrials rose on Friday after President Donald Trump said the United States may not have to impose further tariffs on Chinese goods  but declines in shares of Nvidia Corp  Amazon.com Inc and Facebook Inc helped to drag down the Nasdaq.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Mark Zuckerberg pushes wrong kind of independence
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg is pushing the wrong kind of independence. The social network’s chief executive on Thursday revealed he plans to set up an external committee to help police fake news and hateful content. The move follows yet more revelations about how poorly he and others dealt with Russian meddling in U.S. elections. Outsourcing decisions won’t fix Facebook’s culture  though. Removing Zuckerberg as chair would be a step in the right direction.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: France to 'embed' regulators at Facebook to combat hate speech
article: PARIS Facebook  will allow French regulators to "embed" inside the company to examine how it combats online hate speech  the first time the wary tech giant has opened its doors in such a way  President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook to quadruple size of Dublin international headquarters
article: DUBLIN Facebook has taken on a long-term lease in Dublin which will quadruple the floor space at its international headquarters and allow the company to more than double its current staff of over 4 000.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook blocks more accounts potentially linked to foreign entity
article: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it blocked more accounts  in addition to the about 115 accounts it blocked over the weekend  in the run up to the U.S. midterm elections that saw democrats capture U.S. House majority.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: NBC  Fox News  Facebook pull Trump campaign ad linking immigration  crime
article: NEW YORK NBC  Fox News and Facebook  pulled a campaign ad linking a caravan of Central American migrants and a cop killer  which U.S. President Donald Trump endorsed and CNN deemed "racist " the media companies said on Monday. The primetime TV ads on NBC  paid for by Donald J. Trump for President  ran during a "Sunday Night Football" broadcast.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: MEDIA-Private messages of 81 000 Facebook users leaked online - BBC
article: * The personal data of 257 000 Facebook users  including the private messages of 81 000 users  has been freely available online since early September  shared by what may be Russian hackers  a BBC Russian Service investigation said on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall Street opens higher on strong earnings
article: Oct 31 U.S. stocks opened higher on Wednesday and were set for a second day of gains at the end of a brutal month  as Facebook led a slew of encouraging earnings reports.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Facebook heads into an earnings pincer movement
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Facebook is heading into an earnings pincer movement. Sales growth at the $410 billion social-media network slowed in the third quarter  the company said on Tuesday. Combating that and other problems means spending more  hitting both top and bottom lines. That may force Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to take rash countermeasures.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook removes fake accounts tied to Iran that lured over 1 million followers
article: WASHINGTON Facebook Inc  said on Friday it had deleted accounts originating in Iran that attracted more than 1 million U.S. and British followers  its latest effort to combat disinformation activity on its platform.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Weak reports from Amazon and Alphabet hit Facebook  Netflix
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 25 So-called FANG stocks dropped in extended trade on Thursday following disappointing quarterly reports from Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc   two of the group's components.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Google  Facebook executives meet with UK government over no-deal Brexit - Telegraph
article: The UK chiefs of Microsoft Corp   Facebook  and Alphabet Inc's  Google met with British government ministers in London on Wednesday to seek assurances over the impact of a no-deal Brexit on jobs and investment  the Telegraph reported on Wednesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook launches searchable database for U.S. political ad spending
article: Oct 23 Facebook Inc on Tuesday unveiled a searchable database that will provide information on spending by advertisers for political ads and issues of national importance in the run-up to the midterm elections.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Oculus co-founder to leave Facebook
article: VR headset maker Oculus co-founder Brendan Trexler Iribe is leaving Facebook Inc  according to his post on the social media network on Monday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Brazil election battle rages over Facebook's WhatsApp
article: BRASILIA Facebook Inc's  WhatsApp messaging service became the frontline in Brazil's bitter presidential campaign on Friday  as front-runner Jair Bolsonaro angrily denied accusations he had encouraged widespread misinformation campaigns on the platform.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's WhatsApp taking legal action against Brazil election spammers
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 19 Facebook Inc's WhatsApp messaging application business said on Friday it was "taking immediate legal action" against companies that are sending spam messages ahead of the Brazilian presidential election.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook tentatively concludes spammers were behind recent data breach: WSJ
article: Facebook Inc  has tentatively concluded that spammers looking to make money  and not a nation-state  were behind the largest-ever data theft at the social media company  the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: At Facebook  public funds join push to remove Zuckerberg as chairman
article: Four major U.S. public funds that hold shares in Facebook Inc on Wednesday proposed removing Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg as chairman following several high-profile scandals and said they hoped to gain backing from larger asset managers. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Exclusive: Facebook to ban misinformation on voting in upcoming U.S. elections
article: MENLO PARK  Calif. Facebook Inc will ban false information about voting requirements and fact-check fake reports of violence or long lines at polling stations ahead of next month's U.S. midterm elections  company executives told Reuters  the latest effort to reduce voter manipulation on its service. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook now says data breach affected 29 million users  details impact
article: Cyber attackers stole data from 29 million Facebook accounts using an automated program that moved from one friend to the next  Facebook Inc  announced on Friday  as the social media company said its largest-ever data theft hit fewer than the 50 million profiles it initially reported. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 5-Facebook now says data breach affected 29 mln users  details impact
article: Oct 12 Cyber attackers stole data from 29 million Facebook accounts using an automated program that moved from one friend to the next  Facebook Inc announced on Friday  as the social media company said its largest-ever data theft hit fewer than the 50 million profiles it initially reported.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Amazon says 'breathtaking' class in Facebook job ads age-bias case should be rejected
article: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday told a federal judge in San Jose  California that a proposed class of millions of older Facebook users suing the online retailer because they allegedly were not shown job ads would include an "infinite variety" of people and should be rejected.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's WhatsApp says has fixed video call security bug
article: NEW YORK/LONDON Facebook Inc's WhatsApp messenger service said on Wednesday it has fixed the latest bug on its platform that allowed hackers to take over users' applications when they answered an incoming video call.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp builds system to comply with India's payments data storage norms
article: MUMBAI/NEW DELHI WhatsApp has built a system to store payment-related data in India  in line with a central bank directive that all such data must only be stored locally  as the Facebook-owned messenger looks to deepen its offerings in its biggest market by users.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Facebook is late to fight second existential crisis
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Facebook is late to fighting an existential threat for the second time in its 14-year life. Poor security  low-quality content and excessive advertising are as big a danger to Mark Zuckerberg’s company as the 2012 growth of mobile. Facebook finally appears focused on the threat  but it won’t be as easy to solve via acquisitions and improved apps.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Facebook's lead EU regulator opens probe into data breach
article: DUBLIN  Oct 3 Facebook's lead regulator in the European Union  the Irish Data Protection Commissioner (DPC)  on Wednesday began an investigation into a massive cyberattack on the social networking site disclosed by the company last week.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Dow hits record close  but Facebook weighs on S&P
article: NEW YORK  Oct 2 The Dow hit a record closing high on Tuesday  but a drop in Facebook shares weighed on both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Instagram names Adam Mosseri as new head
article: Facebook Inc's  Instagram on Monday announced that long-term insider Adam Mosseri will take over as the new head of the photo-sharing app  a week after its co-founders resigned.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook says big breach exposed 50 million accounts to full takeover
article: Facebook Inc  said on Friday that hackers stole digital login codes allowing them to take over nearly 50 million user accounts in its worst security breach ever given the unprecedented level of potential access  adding to what has been a difficult year for the company's reputation. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook unveils new VR headset 'Oculus Quest' for $399
article: Facebook Inc  unveiled its new wireless virtual reality headset at a conference on Wednesday and said it plans to start shipping it in spring next year.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook shares slip after Instagram founders quit
article: Shares of Facebook Inc  fell more than 2 percent in early trading on Tuesday after the two founders of photo-sharing app Instagram left the social networking giant under unexplained circumstances. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook not protecting content moderators from mental trauma -lawsuit
article: Sept 24 A former Facebook contract employee has lodged a suit against the company  alleging that content moderators who face mental trauma after reviewing distressing images on the platform are not being properly protected by the social networking giant.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook to drop on-site support for political campaigns
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  said on Thursday that it would no longer dispatch employees to the offices of political campaigns to offer support ahead of elections  as it did with U.S. President Donald Trump in the 2016 race.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook expands fake election news fight  but falsehoods still rampant
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc on Wednesday said it would team with two U.S. non-profits to slow the global spread of misinformation that could influence elections  acknowledging that fake news sites were still read by millions. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Vietnam urges Facebook to open office ahead of controversial cyber law
article: HANOI Vietnam has asked Facebook  to open a local office as the Communist-ruled country increases pressure on global technology firms to abide by a controversial cyber security law.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Online firms to risk EU fine if extremist posts linger
article: STRASBOURG The European Union's chief executive on Wednesday proposed hefty fines on Google  Facebook  Twitter and other online platforms if they fail to remove extremist content within one hour.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook to invest $1 billion in first Asian data center in Singapore
article: SINGAPORE Facebook  said on Thursday it will invest more than $1 billion to build its first data center in Asia in Singapore  slated to open in 2022.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook  Twitter fall as they face U.S. Congress
article: Shares of Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc fell on Wednesday as their top executives testified before the U.S. Congress  defending the companies against what lawmakers see as a failure to combat continuing foreign efforts to influence U.S. politics.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook  Nike drag Wall Street lower; trade concerns linger
article: NEW YORK U.S. stocks fell on Tuesday as trade concerns lingered and declines in Facebook and Nike shares weighed on Wall Street's major indexes  though data showing U.S. manufacturing activity accelerated in August kept losses in check. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: FOCUS-In India  Google races to parry the rise of Facebook
article: SAN FRANCISCO/MUMBAI  Sept 4 Google retains only a slight lead over Facebook in the competition for digital ad dollars in the crucial India market  sources familiar with the figures say  even though the search giant has been in the country far longer and has avoided the controversies that have dogged its rival.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Britain's Johnston Press hit by Facebook and Google changes
article: * Shares down nearly 12 pct (Adds share price reaction  debt detail)

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Instagram says users can now evaluate authenticity of accounts
article: Photo-sharing app Instagram's more than 1 billion users will now be able to evaluate the authenticity of accounts  weeks after parent Facebook Inc  rolled out similar measures in a bid to weed out fake accounts on its social media platform.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Fidelity's Danoff backs Facebook's response to content  privacy issues
article: BOSTON Facebook Inc's  second-biggest outside investor has offered backing for the world's largest social media company as it faces public criticism for what people see on its service and how much user information is shared with third parties.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Judge narrows BlackBerry patent claims against snap  Facebook  others
article: A federal judge has invalidated three claims in a 2012 patent covering time stamps for messaging services that BlackBerry Ltd has accused Snap Inc and Facebook Inc of infringing  finding the claims cover an unpatentable abstract concept.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook  Twitter dismantle disinformation campaigns tied to Iran and Russia
article: SAN FRANCISCO/WASHINGTON Facebook Inc   Twitter Inc  and Alphabet Inc  collectively removed hundreds of accounts tied to an alleged Iranian propaganda operation on Tuesday  while Facebook took down a second campaign it said was linked to Russia. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Exclusive: Trump says it is 'dangerous' for Twitter  Facebook to ban accounts
article: WASHINGTON U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that it is "very dangerous" for social media companies like Twitter Inc  and Facebook Inc  to silence voices on their services.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook says it was 'too slow' to fight hate speech in Myanmar
article: YANGON Facebook  has been “too slow” to address hate speech in Myanmar and is acting to remedy the problem by hiring more Burmese speakers and investing in technology to identify problematic content  the company said in a statement on Thursday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Soros Fund Management adds popular tech names  BlackRock in second quarter
article: NEW YORK Soros Fund Management LLC added Facebook Inc  Apple Inc and Twitter Inc  but trimmed stakes in Alphabet Inc and Amazon.com Inc in the quarter through June  according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Soros Fund Management adds popular tech names  BlackRock in Q2
article: NEW YORK  Aug 14 Soros Fund Management LLC added Facebook Inc  Apple Inc and Twitter Inc   but trimmed stakes in Alphabet Inc and Amazon.com Inc in the quarter through June  according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Soccer-Liga announces landmark free-to-air deal with Facebook in India
article: BARCELONA  Aug 14 Spain's top flight soccer division La Liga announced on Tuesday a landmark deal with Facebook which will allow viewers in the Indian sub-continent to watch every game over the next three seasons for free on the social network.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook pages with large U.S. following to require more authorization
article: Facebook Inc  will introduce an authorization process for users who manage Facebook pages with a large U.S. following  it said https://www.facebook.com/business/news/new-authorization-for-pages on Friday  seeking to make it harder to administer a page using a fake or compromised account. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: L'Oreal adds to Facebook sales push with virtual make-up tests
article: PARIS Maybelline parent L'Oreal  is pairing up with Facebook to roll out virtual tests for shoppers to see how they might look with different lipsticks or eye shadows  adding to its push to drive more sales online and through social media networks.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook in talks with banks to expand customer service
article: Facebook Inc  said on Monday it is in talks to deepen links with banks and financial institutions  saying it can help the firms improve their customer service.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook fakers get better at covering tracks  security experts say
article: WASHINGTON Creators of fake accounts and news pages on Facebook  are learning from their past mistakes and making themselves harder to track and identify  posing new challenges in preventing the platform from being used for political misinformation  cyber security experts say. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: U.S. lawmakers demand firms do more to fight fake social media
article: WASHINGTON U.S. lawmakers demanded that technology firms do more to fight "shocking" foreign efforts to influence U.S. politics on Wednesday  a day after Facebook Inc  identified a new influence campaign tied to November's elections and despite President Donald Trump's denunciation of the issue as a "hoax."

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Pence vows to defend U.S. elections against foreign meddling
article: NEW YORK U.S. Vice President Mike Pence vowed on Tuesday to protect domestic elections from foreign interference  hours after Facebook said it had identified a new effort to use its site to influence November’s U.S. congressional elections.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook is sued after stock plunge 'shocked' market
article: NEW YORK Facebook Inc  and its chief executive Mark Zuckerberg were sued on Friday in what could be the first of many lawsuits over a disappointing earnings announcement by the social media company that wiped out about $120 billion of shareholder wealth.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Zuckerberg loses more than $15 billion in record Facebook fall
article: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's fortune took a more than $15 billion hit on Thursday  as the social media company suffered the biggest one-day wipeout in U.S. stock market history a day after executives forecast years of lower profit margins. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook removes pages of Brazil activist network before elections
article: SAO PAULO Facebook Inc  on Wednesday took down a network of pages and accounts used by a right-wing Brazilian activist group  cracking down on what it called a misinformation network ahead of elections in October.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook signs agreement with Washington state to end discriminatory ad targeting
article: Facebook Inc  has signed an agreement with the state of Washington to stop third-party advertisers in the United States from excluding protected groups from seeing their ads  the Washington State Attorney General said on Tuesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp to limit message forwarding
article: July 19 Facebook Inc's WhatsApp is launching a test to limit forwarding messages that will apply to all users  the messaging app said on Thursday  after a series of violent incidents in India triggered by false social media messages.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Social media companies defend filtering practices before Congress
article: WASHINGTON Facebook Inc   Alphabet Inc  and Twitter Inc  told a U.S. House panel on Tuesday that the social media companies are not discriminating against content for political reasons. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook removes 'treason' as tag to identify users' interests
article: COPENHAGEN Facebook  has removed "treason" as a keyword to identify its users' interests for advertisers  it said on Wednesday  after Danish state broadcaster DR revealed its existence.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp launches Indian media blitz to dispel fake news woes
article: MUMBAI Facebook Inc's WhatsApp messaging platform on Tuesday published advertisements in key Indian newspapers to tackle the spread of misinformation  its first such effort to combat a flurry of fake messages that prompted mob lynchings.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: As inflation soars  Facebook drives trading in Argentina's barter clubs
article: SAN MIGUEL  Argentina At an abandoned train station in Buenos Aires' working-class suburb of San Miguel  hundreds of Argentines gather with bags of clothes  rice  flour and sugar to trade. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: INSIGHT-As inflation soars  Facebook drives trading in Argentina's barter clubs
article: SAN MIGUEL  Argentina  July 5 At an abandoned train station in Buenos Aires' working-class suburb of San Miguel  hundreds of Argentines gather with bags of clothes  rice  flour and sugar to trade.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp in India says partnership with government  society needed to combat misinformation
article: MUMBAI Facebook Inc's  WhatsApp messenger service has responded to a call from India's technology ministry to curb the spread of false information on its platform  saying such a task required a partnership between the pair as well as with society in general.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook shares drop on report of widened probe on data scandal
article: Shares of Facebook Inc fell 2 percent on Tuesday  after a report that a federal probe on the data breach linked to Cambridge Analytica had been broadened and would include more government agencies. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nordic power surge will not deter Facebook's data centre plans
article: OSLO  June 29 A surge in power prices in the Nordic countries will not deter Facebook from looking at building data centres in the region  a company spokeswoman said.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: U.S. court halves $500 million verdict in Facebook virtual reality lawsuit
article: A federal court in Dallas on Wednesday halved the $500 million verdict that a jury ordered Facebook Inc  its virtual reality unit Oculus  and others to pay ZeniMax Media Inc  a video game publisher that alleged Oculus stole its technology.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook eases ban on cryptocurrency related ads
article: Facebook Inc on Tuesday decided to allow certain ads promoting cryptocurrency and related content from pre-approved advertisers  but would continue its ban on those tied to binary options and initial coin offerings.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Index provider MSCI delays decision on unequal voting rights stocks
article: NEW YORK  June 21 Stock index provider MSCI said on Thursday it extended its review of how to treat stocks with unequal voting rights  with a decision now expected by the end of October.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook expands offerings for video creators to cash in on views
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 19 Facebook Inc launched a matchmaking system Tuesday to cultivate partnerships between advertisers and video creators as the world's largest social media company tries to quickly parallel the variety of commercial opportunities offered by its video rival YouTube.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Facebook's public relations chief to step down
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 14 Facebook Inc said on Thursday that Elliot Schrage  who as head of communications and public policy has led the social network's response to scandals about privacy and election meddling  would step down from the company after a decade.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Uber hires Facebook's product director as its driver product head
article: Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] has hired Facebook Inc product director Daniel Danker as its head of driver product  Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said in a tweet on Wednesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook launches user review  potential bans for advertisers
article: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it would allow users to review businesses that advertise on the social network and possibly ban those that receive the most negative feedback.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-U.S.  Canada urge delay in vote on Vietnam's cybersecurity bill
article: * Vietnam's controversial cyber law due to be voted this month

name: Facebook Inc
headline: U.S. lawmakers press Facebook over Chinese data sharing
article: WASHINGTON/SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc faced criticism on Wednesday from Republican and Democratic U.S. lawmakers who demanded that the social media company be more forthcoming about data it has shared with four Chinese firms.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: U.S. senators demand answers from Facebook about user privacy data
article: WASHINGTON  June 5 The Republican chairman of the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee and the top Democrat on the panel on Tuesday demanded that Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg answer questions about whether user privacy was compromised by information disclosed to at least 60 device manufacturers.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Washington state sues Facebook  Google over election ad disclosure
article: SAN FRANCISCO The state of Washington said on Monday it had sued Facebook Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google for allegedly violating state campaign finance law by failing to maintain information about who buys election ads.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: World's top wealth fund backs activist proposals at Facebook meeting
article: OSLO Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund backed a wide range of activist shareholder proposals at Facebook's annual meeting on Thursday  including a measure to improve the company's oversight of questionable content  the fund's voting record showed on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Facebook prevails on shareholder votes  tallies to come later
article: BOSTON  May 31 Facebook Inc executives said the company prevailed on all its director nominees and shareholder proposals up for a vote at its annual meeting on Thursday  where activist investors pressed leaders on topics like the oversight of questionable content.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's size no barrier to deals in new areas: executive
article: RANCHO PALOS VERDES  Calif. Facebook Inc believes it could acquire other large companies without running afoul of antitrust enforcers if the world's largest social media network chose to enter a new market  Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Tuesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Austrian data privacy activist takes aim at "forced consent"
article: * TV: EU data law provides fresh ammo to Facebook nemesis https://reut.tv/2kqVhYS (Adds fresh quote  link to Schrems TV interview)

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook launches searchable archive of U.S. political ads
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  on Thursday launched an archive of U.S. political ads that appear on the world's largest social network  showing who paid for them and other details  after an outcry over Russians' alleged purchase of such ads during the 2016 elections.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook users unite! 'Data Labour Union' launches in Netherlands
article: AMSTERDAM Activists in Amsterdam on Wednesday launched the 'Datavakbond' or "data labor union"  which hopes to elect leaders to negotiate directly with Facebook and Google over what they do with users' data.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook director to start after annual meeting  avoid shareholder vote
article: BOSTON Facebook Inc named a new director this month and timed his appointment to avoid a shareholder vote  raising concern among some investors who want to see more accountability from the social media company.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Cambridge Analytica files for bankruptcy in U.S. following Facebook debacle
article: Cambridge Analytica  the political consultancy at the center of Facebook Inc's privacy scandal  filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy in the United States late on Thursday. | Video

headline: BRIEF-Facebook Announces New Election Partnership With The Atlantic Council
article: * FACEBOOK SAYS ANNOUNCING NEW ELECTION PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ATLANTIC COUNCIL

name: Facebook Inc
headline: ISS recommends votes against Facebook CEO Zuckerberg  4 other directors
article: BOSTON  May 16 Proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services on Wednesday recommended investors withhold their support from five Facebook Inc directors  including Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg and Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg  citing issues including the social media company's lack of a formal nominating committee.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: BRIEF-Third Point Raises Share Stake in Facebook  Takes Share Stake in Worldpay
article: * THIRD POINT LLC TAKES SHARE STAKE OF 400 000 SHARES IN ADOBE SYSTEMS INC - SEC FILING

headline: U.S. senators oppose trade group's lawyer as consumer watchdog
article: WASHINGTON  May 14 The U.S. Federal Trade Commission should delay a vote to name its top consumer advocate  three Democratic U.S. senators said on Monday  citing the appointee's work for Equifax  Facebook  Uber and other companies the FTC has probed.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: BRIEF-Facebook Plans To Create Its Own Cryptocurrency - Cheddar  Citing Sources
article: * FACEBOOK PLANS TO CREATE ITS OWN CRYPTOCURRENCY - CHEDDAR  CITING SOURCES Source text - http://bit.ly/2KSsFDG Further company coverage:

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook asks European users which news sources they trust
article: LONDON Facebook is asking users in Europe which news sources they trust to help it gauge whether to extend a change to its News Feed that it made in the United States earlier this year  designed to filter out misinformation.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Three-quarters Facebook users as active or more since privacy scandal: Reuters/Ipsos poll
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Most of Facebook's U.S. users have remained loyal to the social network despite revelations that a political consultancy collected information about millions of accounts without owners' permission  a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Sunday showed.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Tinder-owner Match beats estimates  plays down Facebook threat
article: Tinder-owner Match Group Inc  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue and profit on Tuesday as it attracted more subscribers to its dating apps and websites  and said Facebook Inc's  plan to create a dating tool will not hurt Tinder.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook effect turns Swedish steel town into tech hot-spot
article: * Brings Facebook's total investment in area to around $1 billion

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Germany demands more privacy safeguards from Facebook: report
article: BERLIN Germany's justice minister has asked Facebook  Chief Executive in a letter to be transparent with users by giving them more control  saying allegations of the improper use of data for millions of people is unacceptable  a German media group reported on Thursday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook employee fired over bragging about access to user information
article: Facebook Inc on Thursday said that it fired an employee accused of bragging on matchmaking app Tinder about his access to private user information.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Market swipes left on Match  Tinder as Facebook swipes right on dating
article: Like an old flame wrecking a first date  Facebook Inc burst in on the matchmaking scene on Tuesday and sent investors in rival apps on a panicked rush for the door.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp co-founder to quit in loss of privacy advocate at Facebook
article: SAN FRANCISCO The co-founder of WhatsApp  a messaging service owned by Facebook Inc  with more than 1 billion daily users  said on Monday he was leaving the company  in a loss of one of the strongest advocates for privacy inside Facebook.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: BRIEF-Facebook Says Eliminating Platform Fee On All Fundraisers
article: * FACEBOOK INTRODUCES NEW TOOLS TO MAKE FUNDRAISERS EVEN MORE IMPACTFUL

name: Facebook Inc
headline: U.S. Congress spars over social media filtering; companies skip hearing
article: WASHINGTON Democrats and Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives on Thursday sparred over the role of social media platforms Facebook  Google and Twitter in filtering content after representatives of the tech companies skipped a hearing.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 5-Facebook's rise in profits  users shows resilience after scandals
article: April 25 Facebook Inc shares rose on Wednesday after the social network reported a surprisingly strong 63 percent rise in profit and an increase in users  with no sign that business was hurt by a scandal over the mishandling of personal data.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: WhatsApp raises minimum age in Europe to 16 ahead of data law change
article: LONDON  April 24 WhatsApp  the popular messaging service owned by Facebook Inc  is raising its minimum age from 13 to 16 in Europe to help it comply with new data privacy rules coming into force next month.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Gundlach says buy oil producers  bet against Facebook: Sohn Conference
article: NEW YORK Billionaire investor Jeffrey Gundlach on Monday said investors should consider betting against Facebook Inc because the prospect of regulation still hangs over the social media company's stock.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Acxiom CEO says data industry bracing for regulation
article: SAN FRANCISCO Companies that buy and sell consumer data are preparing for increased scrutiny from U.S. lawmakers after a scandal over how social network Facebook handles personal information  Acxiom Corp's chief executive said on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's damage limitation drive hits trouble in Germany
article: BERLIN/FRANKFURT Facebook's attempt to limit fallout from a massive data breach hit trouble in Germany on Friday as a privacy watchdog opened a case against the social network and politicians accused its bosses of evasion.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Exclusive: Facebook to put 1.5 billion users out of reach of new EU privacy law
article: SAN FRANCISCO If a new European law restricting what companies can do with people's online data went into effect tomorrow  almost 1.9 billion Facebook Inc users around the world would be protected by it. The online social network is making changes that ensure the number will be much smaller. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Zuckerberg under pressure to face EU lawmakers over data scandal
article: STRASBOURG Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg came under pressure from EU lawmakers on Wednesday to come to Europe and shed light on the data breach involving Cambridge Analytica that affected nearly three million Europeans.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: BRIEF-Trillium Asset Management Urges Facebook Shareholders To Vote For Risk Oversight Committee Proposal
article: * TRILLIUM ASSET MANAGEMENT URGES FACEBOOK SHAREHOLDERS TO VOTE IN FAVOR OF PROPOSAL REGARDING RISK OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE - SEC FILING Source text - (https://bit.ly/2HtGKZz)

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Netflix’s advantage is Facebook’s weakness
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Netflix’s advantage is Facebook’s weakness. Subscriptions give the video-streaming service an edge – and an incentive for boss Reed Hastings to keep customers’ data close by. Cash burn is always a risk but for now Netflix is handily outperforming its FAANG associate.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook fuels broad privacy debate by tracking non-users
article: SAN FRANCISCO Concern about Facebook Inc's  respect for data privacy is widening to include the information it collects about non-users  after Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said the world's largest social network tracks people whether they have accounts or not. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook CEO's compensation jumps to $8.9 million as security costs soar
article: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's compensation rose 53.5 percent to $8.9 million in 2017  a regulatory filing showed on Friday  largely due to higher costs related to the 33-year old billionaire's personal security.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Instagram might want to unfriend Facebook
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Instagram could do worse than unfriend Facebook. The photo-sharing site may be worth more than 80 times what the social network founded by Mark Zuckerberg paid six years ago. Now  though  the data leaks engulfing its corporate parent risk becoming a liability. Separating Instagram off – even if Facebook were to remain its biggest shareholder – might be a wise pre-emptive move.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 7-Facebook's Zuckerberg unscathed by congressional grilling  stock rises
article: WASHINGTON/SAN FRANCISCO  April 11 Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg fielded 10 hours of questions over two days from nearly 100 U.S. lawmakers and emerged largely unscathed and considerably richer.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: BRIEF-U.S. lawmakers question Facebook CEO on privacy  antitrust
article: April 10 Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg testified for nearly two hours on Tuesday in the first session of privacy-focused hearings on Capitol Hill this week. Questioning is scheduled to resume on Tuesday after a break.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Zuckerberg ditches T-shirt  apologizes for Facebook mistakes
article: WASHINGTON Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg swapped his trademark T-shirt and jeans for a dark suit and a purple tie on Monday as he met U.S. lawmakers to apologize for the social network's misuse of its members' data and to head off possible regulation. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Republican senator says Facebook scandals may be 'too big' for company to fix alone
article: WASHINGTON A Republican U.S. senator warned on Sunday that Facebook Inc may need to be regulated to address concerns about the company's privacy and foreign propaganda scandals  saying they may be "too big" for the social media company to solve alone.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook suspends Canadian firm AggregateIQ over data scandal
article: Facebook Inc  said on Friday that it had suspended Canadian political consultancy AggregateIQ from its platform after reports that the data firm may have improperly had access to the personal data of Facebook users.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: EU says Facebook confirmed data of 2.7 million Europeans 'improperly shared'
article: BRUSSELS Facebook  has confirmed that the data of 2.7 million EU citizens were among those improperly used by political consultancy Cambridge Analytica  the EU executive said on Friday. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook fined $33 million for failing to aid Brazil graft probe
article: BRASILIA A Brazilian judge has ordered that Facebook Inc  pay 111.7 million reais ($33.4 million) for failing to cooperate with a corruption investigation  federal prosecutors said on Thursday  prompting Facebook to say it was exploring "all legal options."

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Exclusive: Facebook CEO stops short of extending European privacy globally
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday that he agreed "in spirit" with a strict new European Union law on data privacy but stopped short of committing to it as the standard for the social network across the world. | Video
