article: SAN FRANCISCO Joe Lockhart  Facebook Inc's head of global communications and a former press secretary for President Bill Clinton  is leaving the social networking company  Facebook said.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook IPO lawsuits to be heard in New York
article: Dozens of lawsuits against Facebook Inc  the NASDAQ exchange and various underwriters will be consolidated before a federal judge in New York  who must sort through the legal aftermath of Facebook's botched initial public offering.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook lets U.S. users pay to boost visibility of postings
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc is letting users in the United States pay a fee to boost the visibility of their postings on the social network  the company's latest effort to look beyond advertisers for revenue.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Medvedev points Facebook's Zuckerberg towards Russian IT sector
article: GORKI  Russia Prime minister Dmitry Medvedev told Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg on Monday that Russia's IT industry was as promising an area for investment as its natural resources sectors.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's new pitch to brand advertisers: forget about clicks
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  stung by doubts that advertising on the social network delivers enough bang for the buck  is preparing to unveil data to counter its critics and show that "clicks " the current metric of choice  tell only half the story. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: EU lawmaker calls for tighter data rules after Facebook row
article: BRUSSELS An EU lawmaker called for tighter control of on-line social networks under a data protection regulation now being debated after some Facebook users said their personal messages appeared on their public profiles.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: California schools  employers banned from social media snooping
article: SACRAMENTO Californians who use social media like Twitter and Facebook have a little more privacy protection from employers or universities who may want access to usernames or passwords after the governor signed two bills into law on Thursday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Middle East telcos mull alliance in Facebook fight
article: DUBAI Middle East telecommunications firms are discussing the idea of creating a pan-Arab online platform that would earn them more revenue from their networks by challenging Facebook and other Internet behemoths of the West.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-French watchdog to continue Facebook glitch inquiry
article: PARIS  Sept 25 France's data watchdog CNIL said it would continue an inquiry into how some users of Facebook Inc  came to believe that their privacy had been infringed on the social network.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook shares drop after Barron's snub
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook shares dropped on Monday after financial weekly Barron's questioned the social networking company's value and priced its stock at just $15.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Party invite on Facebook sparks melee in Dutch town
article: AMSTERDAM  Sept 22 Riot police broke up crowds of youths who turned violent in a  Dutch town late on Friday after several thousand people descended on the community following an invitation to a birthday party posted on Facebook  Dutch media reported.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Man releases hostage  surrenders to police in Pittsburgh
article: PITTSBURGH A man armed with a kitchen knife and a hammer took a business owner hostage for several hours inside a Pittsburgh high-rise building on Friday and posted messages on Facebook before surrendering to police  officials said.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook pix spat sparks Philadelphia plane bomb hoax
article: PHILADELPHIA A man avenging his girlfriend over a questionable Facebook photograph was charged on Friday with falsely reporting explosives aboard a plane that was ordered to return to Philadelphia Airport  authorities said. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - Sept 7
article: The European Central Bank agreed on Thursday to launch a new and potentially unlimited bond-buying programme to solve the euro zone crisis.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook rules out share sale to cover tax bill
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc promised not to sell stock to cover a nearly $2 billion tax bill and said it will allow employees to cash in their stock weeks ahead of schedule  moving to soothe nervous investors and its own staff as its share price spirals downward. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook says no secondary offering to cover tax bill
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc promised not to sell stock to cover a nearly $2 billion tax bill and said it will allow employees to cash in their stock weeks ahead of schedule  moving to soothe nervous investors and its own staff as its share price spirals downward.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Dutch boy sentenced in "Facebook murder"
article: ARNHEM  The Netherlands A 15-year-old Dutch boy was sentenced to a year in juvenile detention on Monday for stabbing to death a girl whose Facebook posts reportedly led to a contract for her killing.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook hits new low after price target cuts
article: Shares of Facebook Inc  fell 4.5 percent to a new low on Friday after brokerages cut their price targets on the company's shares  saying several lock-up expirations over the next year will weigh on the stock.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Knight accepts Nasdaq's $62 mln Facebook payback plan
article: * Says SEC should hold off on discussion of exchanges' liabilities

name: Facebook Inc
headline: SEC reviews 'quiet period' IPO rule after Facebook mess
article: The Securities and Exchange Commission is looking at whether it should relax rules governing what companies can say ahead of initial public offerings  Chairwoman Mary Schapiro said in a letter obtained by Reuters.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook envisions swanky new digs as shares sink
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc on Friday unveiled plans for a massive new campus annex in Menlo Park to be designed by Frank Gehry  the renowned architect who has won plaudits for metal-sheathed works like the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao  Spain  and the Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UBS says Nasdaq's Facebook compensation plan inadequate
article: NEW YORK The $62 million compensation plan proposed by Nasdaq OMX Group for fallout from Facebook's botched IPO is "inadequate to address the magnitude of Nasdaq's unprecedented failures"  UBS Securities LLC said in a letter to U.S. regulators.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-Citigroup slams Nasdaq's Facebook compensation plan
article: * Citi says Nasdaq should be liable for Facebook IPO losses

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's director in spotlight after cashing out
article: SAN FRANCISCO Peter Thiel was the first investor to take a gamble on Facebook Inc. Now some people are wondering whether  in selling most of his stake  the Facebook board member is signaling to others that it's time to rush for the exits.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook director Thiel sold 20 million shares after lockup
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc director Peter Thiel sold roughly $400 million worth of shares in the Internet social networking company last week  cashing out most of his stake  according to a regulatory filing.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Judge rejects Facebook settlement over ad feature
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge rejected Facebook Inc's proposed legal settlement to resolve allegations that the social networking company violated its members' rights through the its 'Sponsored Stories' advertising feature.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook shares drop 4 percent  hit another low
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc shares sank as much 4.3 percent on Friday to set a new low  a day after early investors got the green light to sell for the first time.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook plumbs new lows as sales curbs start to expire
article: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Facebook Inc shares sank 6.3 percent to a record closing low after early investors got the greenlight to sell for the first time since the No. 1 social network went public  starting a string of insider lockup expirations that will pressure the stock for months.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Analysis: Facebook insider lockup ending  share impact seen muted
article: A deluge of Facebook shares are set to hit the market Thursday as a lockup period preventing some insider sales comes to an end  but this may not trigger more pain for an already battered stock.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Soros  Coleman among few hedge fund fans of Facebook
article: As dozens of top hedge funds disclosed their second-quarter stock holdings on Tuesday  few reported owning shares in slouching social network Facebook Inc.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: FTC approves final settlement with Facebook over privacy issues
article: WASHINGTON The Federal Trade Commission on Friday gave the final approval to a settlement of federal charges reached last year over Facebook Inc deceiving consumers and forcing them to share more personal information than they had intended.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Spanish investor buys Facebook London HQ for $94 mln
article: LONDON  Aug 9 Spanish property company Allegra European Holdings has exchanged contracts to buy a block containing the London headquarters of social network company Facebook for about 60 million pounds ($93.8 million)  a source close to the deal told Reuters.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook opens doors to real-money gambling in Britain
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc will allow users in Britain to wager real money on its service  opening its doors to gambling for the first time as revenue growth slows at the world's No. 1 social network.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Russia's Mail.Ru to pay $795 mln in special dividend
article: MOSCOW  Aug 6 Russian internet group Mail.Ru  said on Monday it would pay shareholders a special dividend of $3.80 per share  or a total of $795 million.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq expects 'significant' new expenses over Facebook IPO
article: NEW YORK  Aug 3 Nasdaq OMX Group Inc  expects to incur costs well above the $62 million it has set aside to pay back firms harmed by the glitch-ridden Facebook  IPO  as it fights lawsuits and updates its systems  it said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Hackers hit Major League Baseball teams' Facebook sites
article: Hackers hit Major League Baseball teams' Facebook pages with phony postings on Thursday  including an announcement that New York Yankees star Derek Jeter would undergo sex change surgery  the sports site Deadspin reported.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UBS's huge Facebook loss throws doubt on Nasdaq plan
article: NEW YORK Facebook's disastrous May IPO took on a new dimension on Tuesday  as Swiss bank UBS said it lost more than $350 million on botched order execution and would take legal action against Nasdaq for the exchange's alleged failures.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook sinks to record low as doubts grow
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc's shares slid 6.2 percent to another record low on Tuesday  diving for the third straight day since lackluster results showed decelerating user growth and revived doubts about its ability to sustain its rich valuation.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Irish data watchdog to publish Facebook review by Oct
article: VIENNA/DUBLIN  July 30 An Irish watchdog says it will determine by early October whether Facebook  the world's biggest social network  will face legal action under European privacy laws.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Liking or hating social media
article: Shares of social media giant Facebook Inc  which bungled its initial public offering in May  have been under the gun ever since  hitting a nadir on Friday after dismal inaugural results.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook's value slides by $10 billion; outlook unclear
article: Investors wiped $10 billion off the value of Facebook Inc on Friday  taking the recently listed shares to a new low  after the social network offered no forecast and analysts said mobile investments would put future earnings under pressure.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook revenue growth skids  shares plunge
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc reported a drastic slowdown in revenue growth and failed to offer financial forecasts to quell fears about its ability to boost advertising growth  sending its shares plummeting to a record low. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Zynga slashes outlook  denting its stock and Facebook's
article: SAN FRANCISCO Zynga Inc  the social gaming company  slashed its 2012 earnings outlook after its second-quarter results badly missed Wall Street's targets  sending its stock plunging more than 40 percent to a record low.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Knight nears compromise in Nasdaq-Facebook repayment plan-source
article: NEW YORK Knight Capital Group  is closer to accepting Nasdaq OMX Group's  repayment plan for firms that lost money due to Facebook's  bungled initial public offering  but still has some concerns  a source familiar with the company's thinking said on Tuesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - July 24
article: Spain's borrowing costs rose severely on Monday  raising fears that Madrid may be forced to request a sovereign bailout.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq to unveil Facebook compensation plan next week: report
article: NEW YORK Nasdaq OMX Group Inc plans next week to release its compensation plan for firms that lost money in the bungled Facebook initial public offering  the FOX Business channel reported on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq says filing $62 million Facebook compensation plan
article: WASHINGTON Nasdaq OMX Group Inc  said on Friday it will file a $62 million compensation plan for firms that lost money in the bungled Facebook Inc  initial public offering in May.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook  Wal-Mart chiefs meet to "deepen" relationship
article: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg is about to add the biggest retail players to his list of friends.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: REFILE-UPDATE 3-Knight Capital weighing legal options for Facebook IPO losses
article: * Recorded pre-tax loss of $35.4 million from Facebook IPO

name: Facebook Inc
headline: 'Text me'  say Britons with no time to talk
article: LONDON  July 18 Britons prefer to text friends or keep in touch on Facebook rather than chat on the phone  leading to the first ever decline in mobile voice calls  according to the UK's telecoms regulator.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Tajikistan launches crackdown on Internet critics
article: DUSHANBE  July 13 Tajikistan plans to create a volunteer-run body to monitor Internet use and reprimand those who openly criticise President Imomali Rakhmon and his government  the head of the Central Asian country's state-run communications service said on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Social networks scan for sexual predators  with uneven results
article: San FRANCISCO On March 9 of this year  a piece of Facebook software spotted something suspicious.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Judge steps away from Facebook privacy lawsuit
article: SAN FRANCISCO A judge recused herself from overseeing a privacy lawsuit against Facebook over the social networking service's "Sponsored Stories" feature  one day before she was set to hold a hearing on a proposed settlement.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook  Yahoo tie up  settle lawsuits
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc and Yahoo Inc agreed to forge a broad Internet advertising and licensing partnership on Friday  laying to rest their dueling patent lawsuits.

name: Facebook Inc

article: DETROIT/SAN FRANCISO General Motors Co and Facebook Inc are discussing the return of the U.S. automaker as a paid advertiser almost two months after GM said it would stop running ads on the social networking website  sources close to the situation said on Tuesday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Ad exec sues Interpublic over Facebook investment
article: Facebook Inc's explosive growth has spawned a $380.6 million lawsuit by a former Interpublic Group of Cos executive seeking payment for having persuaded the advertising giant to make an early  enormously profitable investment.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook Q2 earnings results scheduled for July 26
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  will report its second-quarter financial results after the market closes on July 26  the company announced on Friday.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 1-ServiceNow IPO prices above range
article: June 28 IT software company ServiceNow  priced its initial public offering on Thursday above its expected range at $18  an underwriter said.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq to detail compensation to SEC next week-source
article: * Nasdaq  SEC making sure language of proposal is acceptable - sources

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 2-Zynga plans to build a gamers' social network
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 26 Zynga Inc  unveiled a social network for gamers dubbed "Zynga with Friends" on Tuesday  hoping to wean itself from a longstanding  symbiotic relationship with Facebook Inc  while becoming a major Internet destination.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook taps COO Sandberg to be first woman on board
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc named Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg a director on Monday  adding the first woman to a board that includes seven men.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq volume surges on Russell rebalance
article: NEW YORK  June 22 Nasdaq OMX conducted its highest-volume close of the year without a hitch on Friday  carrying out the rebalancing of the U.S. Russell indexes a month after it botched the market debut of Facebook Inc.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Louisiana sex offenders must soon post their status on Facebook
article: NEW ORLEANS Convicted sex offenders and child predators who set up a Facebook or other social networking page will have to post their criminal status in their profile under a Louisiana law that takes effect on August 1.

name: Facebook Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook's U.S. user numbers dwindled in May from April and March  according to data compiled by research firm comScore  in the latest sign that growth may be leveling off at the No. 1 social network.

name: Facebook Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc is updating its payments service so that it supports pricing in local currencies instead of the special Facebook "credits."

name: Facebook Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc is paying $55 million to $60 million to buy Face.com  according to people familiar with the matter  acquiring the company that provides the facial-recognition technology used by the world's largest social network to help users identify and tag photos.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Big investors on sidelines in Facebook case: Frankel
article: NEW YORK On Friday  Facebook Inc and its underwriters offered some clues about how they intend to defend the more than 40 suits filed so far in state and federal court that accuse them of deceiving investors in their initial public offering.

name: Facebook Inc

article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc has agreed to pay $10 million to charity to settle a lawsuit that accused the site of violating users' rights to control the use of their own names  photographs and likenesses  according to court documents made public over the weekend.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Facebook sketches out IPO-mess defense; CTO departs
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc   facing a raft of lawsuits from investors seeking to recoup losses from its botched IPO  laid out on Friday how cascading Nasdaq trading glitches might have stoked the confusion that marred its May 18 debut.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq to skip U.S. House market hearing
article: * House Financial Services market structure hearing June 20

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Zynga shares dive as Facebook game craze wanes
article: SEATTLE Zynga Inc shares fell more than 10 percent on Tuesday  extending three months of steady losses  as the social gaming company's user numbers wane and investors worry that the craze for games on Facebook may have passed its peak.

name: Facebook Inc

article: NEW YORK Facebook Inc is on the preliminary list to join the Russell 3000 index  according to Russell Investments on Monday. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: UPDATE 3-Kraft moves blue chip listing to Nasdaq
article: June 8 Kraft Foods Inc is moving its stock listing to the Nasdaq from NYSE Euronext's New York Stock Exchange  handing Nasdaq OMX Group Inc its biggest victory yet in its listings war with the Big Board.

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Nasdaq rivals blast its Facebook compensation plan
article: Rival exchanges on Thursday lashed out at Nasdaq OMX's  $40 million plan to compensate clients for its mishandling of Facebook's  initial public offering last month  calling the plan "illegal " "anti-competitive" and saying it was unlikely to be approved by U.S. regulators. | Video

name: Facebook Inc
headline: Twitter's mobile revenue surpassed Web on many days: CEO
article: SAN FRANCISCO Twitter has generated more advertising revenue from its mobile platform than from its website on many days in the last quarter  CEO Dick Costolo said Wednesday  highlighting Twitter's progress in squeezing ad dollars out of the growing number of smartphone and tablet users worldwide.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel  TPG in early talks to sell McAfee to Thoma Bravo: source
article: Private equity firm Thoma Bravo LLC is in early talks to buy security software company McAfee from TPG Capital and Intel Corp  a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

name: Intel Corporation

article: Intel Corp  said on Wednesday that it has developed a way to stack its computing circuits on top of one another in a bid to regain the lead in chip manufacturing technology that it has lost to rivals like Taiwan Semiconductor Co Ltd  in recent years.

name: Intel Corporation

article: SAN FRANCISCO Qualcomm Inc   the biggest supplier of chips for mobile phones  on Thursday pushed further into the PC market with a line of chips designed to power business machines.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: 9th Circuit adopts plaintiff-friendly test for timeliness of ERISA claims in Intel case
article: The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals has ruled that the time period for participants in retirement plans to sue under the federal law governing employee benefits does not begin to run until they have "actual knowledge" of a legal violation  creating a circuit split.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel adds $15 billion to its buyback program
article: Chipmaker Intel Corp  said on Thursday its board has approved a $15 billion increase to its share repurchase program.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Former Intel CEO Brian Krzanich to head CDK Global
article: CDK Global Inc  on Wednesday named Brian Krzanich as its new chief executive officer and president  more than four months after he resigned from the top job at Intel following a probe that found he had a consensual relationship with an employee.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel bucks chip industry woes; powered by PCs  iPhones
article: Intel Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit and revenue on Thursday  driven by its high-margin data center business and strong demand for its PC chips  sending its shares up as much as 6.0 percent in extended trading  though those gains later evaporated on concerns about U.S. trade tensions with China.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Data center and PC demand drives Intel profit beat
article: Oct 25 Intel Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit and revenue on Thursday  after three days of grim outlooks from other major chipmakers which have shaken stock markets globally.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Micron to buy Intel's stake in joint venture IM Flash Technologies
article: Micron Technology Inc  said on Thursday it planned to take full control of IM Flash Technologies joint venture with Intel Corp .

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Rivals ARM and Intel make peace to secure Internet of Things
article: LONDON Rival semiconductor giants ARM and Intel  have agreed to work together to manage networks of connected devices from both firms  clearing a major stumbling block to market growth of the so-called Internet of Things (IoT).

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel reduces stake in ASML to below 3 percent
article: AMSTERDAM Intel  has reduced its stake in supplier ASML Holding  to just below 3 percent  according to an update from the registry of the Netherlands' Authority for Financial Markets (AFM) on Friday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Dow closes at record but Facebook drags on S&P  Nasdaq
article: NEW YORK The Dow hit a record closing high on Tuesday  but another drop in Facebook shares weighed on both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq  driving both to finish in the red. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: U.S. trade judge declines to block iPhone imports
article: A U.S. trade judge on Friday declined to block the importation of Apple Inc  iPhones with chips from Intel Corp   handing a major defeat to Qualcomm Inc  in its high-stakes legal dispute with the iPhone maker.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Qualcomm accuses Apple of stealing its secrets to help Intel
article: Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday accused Apple Inc of stealing its chip-making secrets and giving them to rival Intel Corp  paving the way for Apple to switch to Intel's improved semiconductors  which may have cost Qualcomm billions of dollars in lost sales.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: As new iPhones go on sale  studies reveal chips from Intel and Toshiba
article: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc's  latest iPhones hit stores around the world on Friday  featuring components made by Intel Corp  and Toshiba  among others  according to two firms that cracked open the iPhone Xs and Xs Max models.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-Startup headed by Intel's ex-president releases first chips
article: Sept 18 Ampere Computing  the startup headed by Intel Corp's former president Renee James  on Tuesday said it released its first data center chips derived from the same underlying technology as mobile phone chips.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-As Nvidia expands in artificial intelligence  Intel defends turf
article: Aug 17 Nvidia Corp dominates chips for training computers to think like humans  but it faces an entrenched competitor in a major avenue for expansion in the artificial intelligence chip market: Intel Corp.

name: Intel Corporation

article: U.S. chipmaker Intel Corp  on Tuesday disclosed three more possible flaws in some of its microprocessors that can be exploited to gain access to certain data from computer memory.

name: Intel Corporation

article: SANTA CLARA Intel Corp  on Wednesday said it sold $1 billion of artificial intelligence processor chips in 2017  the first time  the world's second-largest chipmaker disclosed revenue from the fast-growing computing segment that has fueled sales expansions at rivals such as Nvidia Corp .

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel sold $1 bln of artificial intelligence chips in 2017
article: SANTA CLARA  Aug 8 Intel Corp on Wednesday said it sold $1 billion of artificial intelligence processor chips in 2017  the first time  the world's second-largest chipmaker disclosed revenue from the fast-growing computing segment that has fueled sales expansions at rivals such as Nvidia Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel shares slip on fears of AMD data center chip challenge
article: Intel Corp  shares fell 9 percent on Friday  after the chipmaker's upbeat results were overshadowed by concerns that Advanced Micro Devices Inc  may be chiseling off market share from its high-margin data center business.

name: Intel Corporation

article: Intel Corp's  fast-growing data center business missed Wall Street targets on Thursday as the world's second-largest chipmaker faced stiff rivalry from Advanced Micro Devices Inc   and it again delayed the release of its next-generation chips until the end of 2019.

name: Intel Corporation

article: U.S. chipmaker Intel Corp on Tuesday promoted three executives to the post of senior vice president.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel acquires small chipmaker to bolster efforts beyond CPUs
article: Intel Corp  said on Thursday that it plans to acquire  eASIC  a small chipmaker that will help further Intel's efforts to diversify away from CPU chips.

name: Intel Corporation

article: Diane Bryant  a former Intel Corp  executive who headed the chipmaker's data center unit  is leaving Alphabet Inc's  cloud computing unit less than a year after joining and just as her old employer searches for a new chief executive.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CEO resigns after probe of relationship with employee
article: Intel Corp  Chief Executive Brian Krzanich resigned on Thursday after an investigation found he had a consensual relationship with an employee in breach of company policy. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel has paths around Trump's China tariffs  analysts say
article: Intel Corp  the world's biggest chipmaker by revenue and a prominent U.S. manufacturer  could avoid the most severe effects of a new list of Chinese tariffs proposed by U.S. President Donald Trump by shifting its production among its facilities  analysts said Monday.

article: * MICRON AND INTEL EXTEND THEIR LEADERSHIP IN 3D NAND FLASH MEMORY

headline: UPDATE 1-Germany calls on chip and hardware makers to tackle processor flaws
article: BERLIN  May 18 Germany's federal cyber agency called on chip and hardware-makers to address new vulnerabilities discovered in computer central processing units  but said no complete fix was possible at the moment.

name: Intel Corporation

article: Intel Corp  beat earnings expectations for the first quarter and raised its full-year revenue and profit forecasts on Thursday  driven by the biggest-ever quarterly jump in its data center business and small-but-steady growth in its personal computer business.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Apple plans to replace Intel chips in Macs with its own: Bloomberg
article: Apple Inc  is planning to use its own chips in Mac computers beginning as early as 2020  replacing processors from Intel Corp   Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing people familiar with the matter.

article: March 28 The Nasdaq Composite index opened lower on Wednesday  pulled lower by Apple  Intel and Amazon  while the S&P 500 and the Dow rose on gains in financial and healthcare stocks.

name: Intel Corporation

article: * INTEL BOARD OF DIRECTORS ELECTS NEW DIRECTOR AND EXTENDS ANDY BRYANT’S TERM AS INTEL CHAIRMAN UNTIL 2019

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel: Problem in patches for Spectre  Meltdown extends to newer chips
article: Data center computers with Intel Corp's  newer chips might reboot more often than normal because of problems with the patches issued to fix the so-called Spectre and Meltdown security flaws  the company said on Wednesday.

headline: U.S. lawmaker asks Intel  others for briefing on chip flaws
article: WASHINGTON  Jan 16 A Democratic U.S. lawmaker asked Intel Corp and two other microchip makers on Tuesday to provide a briefing on the recently detected Spectre and Meltdown security flaws that could allow hackers to steal information from most computers and devices.

name: Intel Corporation

article: Intel Corp on Thursday said that recently issued patches for flaws in its chips could cause computers using its older Broadwell and Haswell processors to reboot more often than normal and that Intel may need to issue updates to fix the buggy patches.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Reuters Select: The optics of Intel's Mobileye acquisition
article: Intel is paying more than $15 billion to get into direct competition with Nvidia and Qualcomm to develop driverless systems for automakers. And  as Reuters' Tova Cohen  Ari Rabinovitch and Paul Lienert report  they're paying big to do it: 21 times Mobileye's expected 2017 revenue and 60 times earnings -- high valuations in just about any field  but certainly in this one. Find out why Intel thinks the cost is worth it.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel to invest up to $1.5 billion in two Chinese mobile chipmakers
article: BEIJING/SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp INTC.O said it will pay as much as $1.5 billion for a 20 percent stake in two mobile chipmakers with ties to the Chinese government  in the hopes of catching up in a smartphone chip industry dominated by rival Qualcomm Inc QCOM.O.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Israel approves Intel's $6 billion investment in chip plant
article: TEL AVIV Israel's finance and economy ministries on Monday approved a plan by Intel Corp to invest $6 billion in the upgrade of its chip manufacturing plant  in what would be the largest single investment by a foreign company in the country.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's CEO says its costly tablet chip strategy has paid off
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's  plan this year to pay manufacturers to use its processors to make tablets was boosting the chipmaker's market share  Chief Executive Officer Brian Krzanich said on Tuesday  adding that he hoped to avoid such a costly strategy with smartphones.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel and Fossil to create wearable tech
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel Corp on Friday said it would work with watches and fashion accessory retailer Fossil Group to develop wearable computing devices.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Intel hires senior Qualcomm exec to boost mobile business
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel Corp  has hired Amir Faintuch  a senior executive at rival Qualcomm Inc   to step up efforts in mobile and Internet-connected gadgets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Avago to sell LSI's Axxia Networking Business to Intel for $650 million
article: Avago Technologies Ltd  said it agreed to sell LSI's Axxia Networking Business to chipmaker Intel Corp  for $650 million in cash.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 3-Judge rejects $324.5 mln settlement over Apple  Google hiring
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 8 Four Silicon Valley companies including Apple and Google failed to persuade a U.S. judge to sign off on a $324.5 million settlement to resolve a lawsuit by tech workers  who accused the firms of conspiring to avoid poaching each other's employees.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: CORRECTED-VIETNAM PRESS-Intel to make 80 pct of Haswell computer chips in Vietnam - Tuoi Tre
article: (In July 30 press item  corrects headline and paragraph 1 to say Intel Vietnam will make 80 pct of Haswell CPUs  not global computer chips) Intel's factory in Vietnam will produce 80 percent of its Haswell CPUs used in computers globally by July 2015  according to an Intel Products Vietnam official  the Tuoi Tre (Youth) newspaper reports.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Applied Micro ships microserver chips in challenge to Intel
article: SAN FRANCISCO Applied Micro Circuits has begun shipping a new kind of low-power server chip that might challenge heavyweight Intel in cutting-edge data centers.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Nikkei rises to 1-1/2-week high on U.S. gains  Intel forecast
article: * U.S. M&A activity boosts confidence in market - fund manager     * Intel supplier Shinko Electric soars to 6-month high      By Ayai Tomisawa     TOKYO  July 17 Japan's Nikkei share average rose to a 1-1/2-week high on Thursday  buoyed by gains on Wall Street  while Shinko Electric Industries Co jumped on Intel Corp's strong forecast.     The Nikkei rose 0.4 percent to 15 443.56 points in mid-morning trade after hitting as high as 15 465.74  the highest level since July 7.     U.S.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St gains on M&A  results; Dow ends at record high
article: * Dow up 0.5 pct; S&P 500 up 0.4 pct; Nasdaq up 0.2 pct   (Updates with eBay results)

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel says worst is over for battered PC industry
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp  believes the worst is over for a personal computer industry hammered by the mobile revolution. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Samsung  Intel  Dell team up on standards for connected gadgets
article: SAN FRANCISCO Samsung Electronics  Intel Corp and Dell have joined to establish standard ways for household gadgets like thermostats and light bulbs to talk to each other  at odds with a framework backed by Qualcomm  LG Electronics and other companies.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel to make audio/visual gear chips for Panasonic under contract
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp said on Monday it would make chips for Panasonic for the audio- and visual-equipment markets  the latest expansion of Intel's contract manufacturing business in the face of slow personal computer sales.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's sales chief to step down  advise on corporate strategy
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's global sales and marketing chief  Thomas Kilroy  will cede his position upon his return from extended medical leave on July 17  taking on an advisory role instead.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel buys into New Zealand sports technology developer
article: WELLINGTON U.S. chipmaker and technology company Intel Corp said on Thursday it has invested in a New Zealand company producing software for use in sports and exercise sectors.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Jury in trial of Rajaratnam's brother hears of insider's tips
article: NEW YORK A former Intel Corp  executive on Tuesday  testifying in the insider trading trial of Rengan Rajaratnam  told jurors how he leaked details of a major deal to the former Galleon Group portfolio manager's brother  Raj Rajaratnam.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel launches messaging app using cartoons to mimic sender's face
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp is getting into voice instant messaging with a smartphone app that uses facial tracking technology to caricature a sender's expressions.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel woos Internet heavyweights with flexible server chips
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp is taking a new approach to the powerful server chips it sells to Internet heavyweights like Facebook and Google.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Nikkei drops on Iraq anxiety; chip-related shares rise on Intel
article: TOKYO  June 16 Japanese stocks dropped to a two-week low on Monday as oil prices extended gains as the insurgency in Iraq raised concerns about potential disruption to oil exports  but chip-related firms outperformed on Intel Corp's  rosy outlook.     The Nikkei fell 1.1 percent to 14 933.29  the lowest closing price since May 30.     The broader Topix dropped 0.8 percent to 1 234.68  while the JPX-Nikkei Index 400 declined 0.8 percent to 11 238.01.     Brent crude rose above $113 pe

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Wall St. edges up on Intel but posts weekly decline
article: NEW YORK U.S. stocks edged up on Friday  boosted by bullish news from the tech sector  but major indexes fell for the week as unrest in Iraq kept investors on edge.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel raises outlook on stronger PC demand  shares jump
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel Corp  on Thursday raised its outlook for the second quarter and the full year  citing stronger-than-expected demand for personal computers used by businesses.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel VP among six Mt. Rainier climbers missing and presumed dead
article: SAN FRANCISCO An Intel vice president is among six climbers missing and presumed dead in the worst accident in three decades on Washington's Mount Rainier  the company said on Monday as search efforts for the group were scaled back.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Intel TV creator leaves Verizon months after deal
article: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Erik Huggers is leaving Verizon Communications Inc  just five months after joining the company via the acquisition of the Intel Corp  “OnCue” streaming service he developed  signaling the communications giant’s waning interest in providing an Internet-delivered TV service.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel: new tablets a big step toward reaching aggressive target
article: SAN FRANCISCO New Intel-based tablets from major brands will start hitting store shelves in June  and senior executives at the chipmaker hope the offerings will move it closer to an aggressive sales goal.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel readies 3D-printed robots for handy consumers
article: RANCHO PALOS VERDE California Intel Corp introduced a walking  talking robot on Wednesday made from 3D-printed parts that will be available to consumers later this year  if they are willing to assemble it with a kit that costs around $1 600.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-Intel to make tablet chips with China's Rockchip
article: SAN FRANCISCO  May 27 Intel Corp said on Tuesday it reached an agreement with Chinese mobile chipmaker Rockchip to make chips for inexpensive tablets running Google Inc's Android platform.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Apple  Google  Intel  Adobe to pay $325 mln to settle hiring lawsuit
article: (Adds comment from plaintiffs' lawyer  details about plaintiffs)

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Intel CEO promises Broadwell PCs on shelves for holidays
article: SAN MATEO  California Intel Corp's next-generation Broadwell processors will ship in time to be used in personal computers sold during the holiday season but probably won't be available for back-to-school shopping  Chief Executive Brian Krzanich said.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's CEO looks to hobbyists for wearable innovations
article: SAN MATEO  California Intel Corp's Chief Executive Officer Brian Krzanich mingled with electronics buffs at Silicon Valley's annual maker mecca on Saturday as the chipmaker looks to amateur inventors to inspire a new wave of smart clothing.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel trims marketing staff ahead of new chief's arrival
article: SAN FRANCISCO  May 14 Intel Corp is shedding jobs in its marketing department ahead of the arrival of new chief marketing officer Steven Fund  who the struggling chipmaker is betting will restore some shine to its brand.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: -EU court to rule June 12 on Intel challenge to $1.5 bln EU fine
article: BRUSSELS  May 6 Europe's second-highest court will rule next month on U.S. chipmaker Intel Corp's  challenge to a record 1.06-billion-euro ($1.47 billion) fine levied by EU antitrust regulators five years ago  a court official said on Tuesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Workers exposed to chemical leak at Intel plant in Arizona
article: PHOENIX A chemical leak at Intel Corp's manufacturing complex in Arizona has been contained and two workers were taken to hospital for observation  a spokesman for the chipmaker said on Monday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel submits plan to upgrade Israeli chip plant
article: JERUSALEM  April 30 U.S. chip manufacturer Intel Corp said on Wednesday it had submitted a business plan to upgrade a facility in southern Israel.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's quarterly net beats Street  CEO talks up tablets
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's first-quarter net profit exceeded Wall Street's estimates as the chipmaker wrestles with slow demand for personal computers and its chief executive officer said an ambitious goal to stake out market share in tablets was on track.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft  Apple diverge on bankrolling big patent buyer
article: SAN FRANCISCO Patent buyer Intellectual Ventures has persuaded Microsoft and Sony to invest in its latest acquisition fund while Apple and Intel  which invested with IV previously  declined to participate  according to people briefed on the fundraising.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 3-Intel closes Costa Rica operation  cuts 1 500 jobs
article: SAN FRANCISCO  April 8 Chipmaker Intel  struggling with a shrinking personal computer market  is shutting its assembly and test operation in Costa Rica and eliminating 1 500 jobs  a spokesman said on Tuesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel closes Costa Rica operation  cuts 1 500 jobs
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel  struggling with a shrinking personal computer market  is shutting its assembly and test operation in Costa Rica and eliminating 1 500 jobs  a spokesman said on Tuesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel adjusts financial reporting to reflect mobile gadgets
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel Corp said on Monday it was adjusting its financial reporting structure to better reflect its focus on two key areas: mobile and the growing field of linking up electronic devices.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Globalfoundries edges out Intel for IBM chip-making business: WSJ
article: Contract chipmaker Globalfoundries has emerged as the leading candidate to buy IBM's semiconductor operations  edging out Intel Corp  the Wall Street Journal cited unidentified sources as saying on Thursday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel invested $740 million to buy 18 percent of Cloudera
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's investment in Cloudera announced last week amounts to $740 million and gives the chipmaker an 18 percent stake in the distributor of software for crunching Big Data  Cloudera said in a press release on Monday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Swedish eye tracking technology firm Tobii plans IPO: report
article: STOCKHOLM Swedish eye tracking technology firm Tobii  co-owned by chipmaker Intel  is planning a stock market listing which could value the firm at around 2 billion crowns ($309 million)  business daily Dagens Industri reported.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel widens agreement to manufacture chips for Altera
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Altera Corp is working with Intel Corp to combine separate components like processors  memory and programmable chips into customized devices in a technique aimed at reducing manufacturing costs and improving performance.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Britain's ARM targets 10 percent of server chip design market by 2017
article: * Sees value of ARM-based wearables  related devices at $20 bln by 2018

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel lead on conflict minerals helps  challenges other firms
article: March 13 (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Intel Corp has spent more than five years figuring out how to rid its supply chain of minerals that finance violence in the Democratic Republic of Congo region  and now it is offering to show other companies how they can do the same.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Alcatel to stay out of telecom price war  inks Intel deal
article: BARCELONA  Feb 23 Alcatel-Lucent said it would stay out of a brewing price war in the telecom equipment market and set itself apart with better service and new products  including those from a partnership announced on Sunday with Intel Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel aims to boost corporate demand with high-end server chip
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Feb 18 Intel Corp  unveiled a new high-end processor aimed at boosting lackluster demand from corporate customers like banks and retailers.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel tightens executive pay as PC demand slows
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp  wrestling with shrinking personal computer sales and struggling to expand into mobile devices  said on Monday it was tightening its compensation policy to make senior executives more accountable.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Facebook cites progress on low-power server technology
article: SAN JOSE  Calif.  Jan 28 Facebook Inc's  executive in charge of revolutionizing data centers on Tuesday lauded low-energy server technology that is expected to compete against heavyweight Intel Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel expects to make decision this year on next new chip plant
article: TEL AVIV U.S. chip manufacturer Intel Corp expects to make a decision this year on the location of a new multi-billion dollar semiconductor plant using new 10 nanometer technology  executives at its Israeli unit said on Sunday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Analysis: Verizon deal may push U.S. cable to offer online TV services
article: Verizon Communications Inc's acquisition of Intel Corp's venture to create a web-based TV service may be the catalyst that pushes U.S. cable players to start similar products to fend off fast-growing video rivals such as Netflix Inc and Amazon.com Inc.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: India Morning Call-Global Markets
article: NEW YORK - The S&P 500 and Nasdaq declined on Friday as results from Intel and General Electric were the latest to dampen the view on fourth-quarter earnings. Volatility picked up late in the session  thanks in part to selling related to options expiration  analysts said. Earnings season is still in the early phase  but S&P 500 companies so far are beating analysts' expectations at a rate that is below what is typical  according to Thomson Reuters data.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel to reduce global workforce by five percent in 2014
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp plans to reduce its global workforce of 107 000 by about 5 percent this year as the chipmaker  struggling with falling personal-computer sales  shifts focus to faster-growing areas  a company spokesman said on Friday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Dow  S&P 500 dip after bond trading bites bank profits
article: * Dow down 0.4 pct  S&P 500 off 0.1 pct  Nasdaq up 0.1 pct

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel launches marketing campaign aimed at cloud
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel Corp is taking its long-running Intel Inside marketing campaign into cloud computing in a bid to head off competition from smaller rivals designing low-power chips for servers.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel shelves cutting-edge Arizona chip factory
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp   hit by slumping personal computer sales  has put off opening a major chip factory that President Barack Obama once held up as an example of U.S. manufacturing potential.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: John McAfee: glad Intel dropping name from security software
article: BOSTON John McAfee  the flamboyant millionaire who founded a pioneering anti-virus software company that Intel Corp bought for $7.7 billion  says he is glad that the chipmaker plans to drop his name from its products.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Barcelona strike sponsorship deal with Intel
article: BARCELONA Barcelona have agreed a sponsorship deal with Intel under which the chipmaker's logo will be printed on the inside of players' shirts  the Spanish champions announced on Thursday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St jumps on jobs; Dow  S&P end lower for the week
article: * Dow  S&P end 5-day losing streak and 8-week winning streak

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-Fitch affirms Intel's ratings at 'A+'; outlook stable
article: Nov 26 (The following statement was released by the rating agency)

article: Nov 22 Intel Corp :  * Nomura raises target price to $20 from $18 For a summary of rating and price target changes on U.S. companies:    Reuters Eikon users  click on    Reuters 3000Xtra users  double-click    Reuters Station users  click .1568    For a summary of rating and price target changes on Canadian companies:    Reuters Eikon users  click on    Reuters 3000Xtra users  double-click    Reuters Station users  click .4899  For a summary of rating actions and price target changes

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CEO says contract manufacturing business to expand
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel CEO Brian Krzanich said on Thursday he would expand his company's small contract manufacturing business  paving the way for more chipmakers to tap into the world's most advanced process technology.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Insight: For Intel  Hollywood dreams prove a leap too far
article: Earlier this year  Intel Corp rented temporary retail space in New York  Los Angeles and Chicago for a splashy launch of Intel TV  a new Internet entertainment service that the chipmaker promised could revolutionize the television industry.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: STOCK NEWS US-Traders eye later term Intel call options
article: Real-time equity news [E U] U.S. stock market report   1452 ET 12Nov2013 Traders eye later term Intel call options  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------      Some players on Intel Corp appear to be shedding near-term calls and initiating new positions in longer-term options for upside exposure.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-Intel creates new business division for connected gadgets
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Nov 5 Intel Corp has set up a business division aimed at making money out of a new technology wave that can link up a host of electronic devices.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel looking to exit TV project  in talks with Verizon
article: Chipmaker Intel Corp is having second thoughts about getting into the television business and is in talks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over its Internet TV initiative  a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's Dadi Perlmutter to step down in February
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp senior executive David Perlmutter  who developed technology that was key to the success of laptop personal computers  is leaving after 34 years at the chipmaker.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St jumps 1 pct as debt ceiling deal seems near
article: * Bank of America swings to profit  Intel gives weak outlook

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-Intel reports mixed quarter  delays cutting-edge chip
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 15 Intel Corp's  third-quarter results modestly beat expectations on Tuesday  but its current-quarter revenue outlook fell short and it warned that production of its upcoming Broadwell processors was delayed.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: GE partners with AT&T  Cisco  Intel for 'Industrial Internet'
article: Oct 9 General Electric Co announced partnerships with AT&T Inc  Cisco Systems Inc and Intel Corp to expand its 'Industrial Internet' service that allows its customers to analyze data and predict outcomes.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Fab times: Taiwan's TSMC thinks big in micro chip race
article: TAINAN  Taiwan Top contract chip maker TSMC may have outsmarted rivals Samsung Electronics Co and Intel Corp in the race to build the tiniest and most powerful chips for smartphones and tablets by building big.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St ends up; Dow posts best weekly gain since Jan
article: NEW YORK  Sept 13 U.S. stocks rose on Friday and the Dow registered its best weekly gain since January  helped by a rise in Intel shares  though trading was subdued ahead of the Federal Reserve's expected reduction of stimulus measures next week.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel prepares ultra-small chips for Dick Tracy-style gadgets
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel is working on a new line of ultra-small and ultra-low-power microchips for wearable devices like smartwatches and bracelets  a bid by the company to make sure it will be at the crest of the next big technology wave after arriving late to the smartphone and tablet revolution.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel Media opens offices in LA  New York in TV push
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's media arm is opening offices in New York and Los Angeles as the company pushes ahead with an Internet television service that it plans to launch later this year  an Intel spokesman said on Friday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500  Dow flat but Nasdaq rises on tech stocks
article: NEW YORK  Aug 19 The S&P 500 and Dow stock gauges were little changed on Monday  with investors reluctant to make new bets because the Federal Reserve is expected to begin slowing its stimulus  while the Nasdaq composite index rose on large-cap technology shares.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel to launch low-power version of powerful server chips
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel Corp said it is planning to launch a low-power version of its brawny server processors  potentially heading off competitors hoping to expand into the data center with energy efficient-chips based on smartphone technology.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Dow  S&P 500 end at all-time highs on earnings  Bernanke
article: * Shares of eBay  Intel fall after disappointing forecasts

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel cuts 2013 revenue forecast as PC industry sags
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp  cut its full-year revenue forecast and said it is scaling back capital spending as it adjusts to a painful contraction of personal computer sales and economic weakness in China  one of its biggest markets. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Dow  S&P advance before Alcoa opens earnings season
article: * Alcoa rises before reporting earnings after market's close

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Gas leak at Intel Arizona plant sickens 43  sends 11 to hospital
article: PHOENIX A gas leak at Intel Corp's second-biggest manufacturing plant  located in Chandler  Arizona  sickened up to 43 people  including 11 who were taken to a local hospital  company and local fire officials said on Saturday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's new CEO focused on mobile chips  cautious on TV
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's new CEO said on Friday he would speed up the rollout of chips for smartphones  tablets and wearable devices as consumers move away from personal computers.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ARM sees strength in numbers against Intel  Nvidia
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chip designer ARM  said the size and depth of its partner network across hardware and software gave it an edge in mobile technology that top chipmaker Intel Corp  and new graphics rival Nvidia Corp  would struggle to match.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-Intel offers to pay up for Internet TV programming deals
article: June 7 Intel Corp's talks to buy content from media companies for its new TV service are advancing  and the chipmaker is offering to pay as much as 75 percent more than traditional cable rates  people familiar with the talks said.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel offers to pay up for Internet TV programming deals
article: Intel Corp's talks to buy content from media companies for its new TV service are advancing  and the chipmaker is offering to pay as much as 75 percent more than traditional cable rates  people familiar with the talks said.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Mcafee extends tender offer for Stonesoft shares
article: HELSINKI  June 5 Intel Corp :  * Mcafee extends the acceptance period under its tender offer for all the

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel sees tablet-chip efforts paying off this year
article: TAIPEI Intel Corp is ramping up its efforts to have more of its chips used in mobile devices  a market it was initially slow to respond to  as officials said on Monday they expect more than 30 tablets using its processors hitting the market this year.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Samsung unveils first Android tablet using Intel chip
article: SEOUL  June 3 Samsung Electronics Co  said on Monday it will use Intel Corp processors to power a new version of one of its top-tier Android tablets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-UPDATE 2-Intel scores major win in new Samsung Galaxy tablet -source
article: SAN FRANCISCO  May 30 Samsung Electronics  has chosen an Intel Corp processor to power a new version of one of its top-tier Android tablets  a source with knowledge of the plans told Reuters  in a major victory for the U.S. chipmaker  which is  struggling to find its footing in the mobile market.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ST-Ericsson sells GPS business to Intel
article: PARIS/SAN FRANCISCO ST-Ericsson  a money-losing joint venture being wound down by owners STMicroelectronics and Ericsson  has sold its GPS mobile business to Intel.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-Intel CEO shakes up units  creates 'new devices' group
article: SAN FRANCISCO  May 21 Intel Corp's new chief executive  Brian Krzanich  has launched a sweeping company reorganization and created a unit aimed at growing its market share in mobile technology.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: New CEO vows Intel will be more responsive in mobile push
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's new CEO Brian Krzanich said on Thursday that under his leadership the top chipmaker will be more responsive to customers in an intensified focus on the fast-growing smartphone and tablet market where it lags its rivals.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel revamps Atom chips in bid to find mobile footing
article: SANTA CLARA  California Intel Corp on Monday unveiled the most extensive overhaul of its Atom mobile processors  with improved performance that the PC chipmaker expects will help it challenge Qualcomm in smartphones and tablets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Run silent  run deep: The life of Brian Krzanich at Intel
article: SAN FRANCISCO It took him 30 years  but Brian Krzanich - the understated  analytical engineer who started his career at an Intel chip factory in New Mexico - quietly worked his way up to the top. Now  the man who once prided himself on halving production times will have to act swiftly to move the company into new areas of growth.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel picks insider as CEO  dashing hopes for shakeup
article: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Intel Corp chose veteran insider Brian Krzanich as chief executive  disappointing some investors who hoped an outsider would push for aggressive changes to help the world's largest chipmaker catch up in the mobile revolution.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CEO backs SoftBank's bid for Sprint over Dish's offer
article: Intel Corp Chief Executive Paul Otellini said in a letter to the Federal Communications Commission that he supports SoftBank's bid for Sprint Nextel Corp  rather than Dish Network's counter offer.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: AMD results beat expectations in declining PC market
article: Advanced Micro Devices Inc forecast current-quarter revenue above Wall Street's expectations as it rushes to find new markets to offset its declining core business of PC chips.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Futures fall as commodities  earnings weigh
article: * Futures down: Dow 96 pts  S&P 11.9 pts  Nasdaq 23.5 pts

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's foresees second-quarter sales decline as PC market shrinks
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp said its current-quarter revenue would decline as much as 8 percent and trimmed its 2013 capital spending plans  as personal computer sales drop due to the growing popularity of tablets and smartphones. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Intel shares down 2.7 pct premarket
article: NEW YORK  April 11 Intel Corp :  * Shares down 2.7 percent premarket after pc sales data

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Dow gains more than 1 pct  led by tech stocks
article: NEW YORK  April 10 The Dow Jones Industrial Average index was up 1 percent in afternoon trading Wednesday  led by gains in blue chip technology stocks  including Cisco and Intel.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's new approach to retirement: encore careers
article: CHICAGO Intel Corp. has something new inside: A $25 000 retiree benefit to help older workers transition into new careers in non-profit organizations.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's media unit on hiring spree to prep for TV debut
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's media group has been on a hiring spree as it prepares to launch an Internet television service later this year  underscoring the chip maker's seriousness about the new business.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Global PC shipments falling more than expected: IDC
article: SAN FRANCISCO Global PC shipments  already hit by consumers' growing preferences for tablets and smartphones  are falling more than previously predicted due to weakness in China  according to market research firm IDC.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Analysis: Next Intel CEO to guide new business  maybe Apple deal
article: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Intel's next CEO is likely to shepherd the top chipmaker into a growing contract-manufacturing business  a strategic shift that could lead to a deal with Apple Inc and give it a fighting chance to make inroads in the mobile arena.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel launches latest platform for crunching Big Data
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Feb 26 Intel launched a new software platform for number-crunching on a massive scale  its latest offering in a growing field that it hopes will boost sales of its powerful server chips.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel takes big step in chip foundry business
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp has agreed to make chips on behalf of Altera  a significant step toward opening its prized manufacturing technology to customers on a larger scale  potentially including Apple.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel plans online TV service as PC chip sales wane
article: DANA POINT  California Top chipmaker Intel Corp plans to launch an Internet television service this year with live and on-demand content  entering a hotly competitive race as its core PC business erodes.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: AppliedMicro sees future in low-power server chips
article: SUNNYVALE  California Chipmaker Applied Micro Circuits Corp believes selling low-power processors for cloud data centers run by the likes of Facebook  Google and Amazon.com Inc could account for half of its business within three years.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: CORRECTED-Chipmaker Intel faces long march to mobile salvation
article: Jan 31 Intel Corp  the world's biggest chipmaker  opened a new front on Thursday in a long and stuttering campaign to get its processors into mobile phones  although it appears to still have a long way to go.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-Chipmaker Intel faces long march to mobile salvation
article: Jan 31 Intel Corp  the world's biggest chipmaker  opened a new front on Thursday in a long and stuttering campaign to get its processors into mobile phones  although it appears to still have a long way to go.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel may have little choice in big manufacturing bet
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's decision to spend $13 billion in 2013 to develop and build future manufacturing technology has not gone down well on Wall Street but it may be necessary if it wants to stay on top of rivals in coming years.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's weak outlook  spending hikes unnerve Wall Street
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's current-quarter revenue forecast disappointed Wall Street  while a sharp rise in planned 2013 capital spending unnerved investors who expect personal computer demand to dwindle. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: PC titans take notes from tablets to regain customers
article: SAN FRANCISCO Personal computer makers  trying to beat back a tablet mania that's eating into their sales  are making what may be a last-ditch attempt to sway customers by mimicking the competition.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel bets big on thin PCs and phones at Las Vegas show
article: LAS VEGAS Top chipmaker Intel Corp on Monday announced shipments of a new low-power chip and showed off next-generation ultra thin laptops and convertible tablets in its latest bid to prove that the struggling PC industry still has a bright future.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel wins patent appeal against N-Data
article: WASHINGTON Intel Corp. won an appeal in a patent fight with Negotiated Data Solutions LLC (N-Data) over Ethernet patents that make it possible for computers to easily talk to one another.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Sprint in talks with major Clearwire investors: sources
article: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp  is in talks with Intel Corp  and Comcast Corp  to buy out their stakes in the U.S. wireless provider Clearwire Corp   two people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel says on track to launch smaller mobile chips
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel presented new manufacturing technology that it said keeps it on track to launch a new generation of chips for smartphones and tablets as it rushes to catch up with Qualcomm and other rivals in the fast-growing mobile market.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CEO Otellini expects insider to replace him
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel's outgoing chief executive  Paul Otellini  said he expected to be replaced by a company insider and also signaled that the top chipmaker could open its factories to strategic customers.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: New Issue - Intel sells $6 bln notes in 4 parts
article: Dec 5 Intel Corp on Tuesday sold $6 billion of notes in four parts  said IFR  a Thomson Reuters service.      Bank of America Merrill Lynch and J.P. Morgan were the joint bookrunning managers for the sale.
