name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel sells debt  shares jump on stock buyback hopes
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp shares jumped more than 2 percent on Tuesday as the top chipmaker sold $6 billion in bonds to fund stock buybacks and other business activities.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Analysis: Intel Inside - Looking inward for CEO may be best bet
article: SAN FRANCISCO Wanted: Visionary CEO to help world-class chipmaker expand beyond struggling personal computer market into tablets and smartphones. Experience with cutting-edge manufacturing plants and $10 billion annual capital expenditures a plus.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - Nov 20
article: Paul Otellini is stepping down from the top job at Intel   leaving no clear successor in place for the first time at the world's biggest chipmaker.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CEO to retire as chipmaker struggles with mobile
article: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Intel Corp's Chief Executive Officer Paul Otellini will retire sooner than expected and the top chipmaker said it may name an outsider for the position for the first time to steer a difficult transition toward mobile computing. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel  Qualcomm may invest $378 million in Sharp: sources
article: TOKYO U.S.-based Intel Corp and Qualcomm Inc are in talks to jointly invest about 30 billion yen ($378 million) in debt-stricken Japanese consumer electronics maker Sharp Corp  two sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel  Qualcomm in talks to invest up to $300 million in Sharp: Jiji
article: TOKYO Intel Corp and Qualcomm Inc are in talks to jointly invest 16 billion yen to 24 billion yen ($200 million to $300 million) in struggling Japanese liquid crystal display maker Sharp Corp  Jiji news agency reported on Wednesday  citing unnamed sources.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel  HP tout newest Itanium server technology
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel and Hewlett-Packard Co unveiled new server technology based on the high-end niche Itanium processors at the center of a recent dispute between Hewlett-Packard and Oracle Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Mobile revolution  economy trip up tech giants
article: SAN FRANCISCO Mobile may be the future for technology  but even with the worldwide proliferation of high-powered devices like smartphones and tablets  some companies are struggling to maintain consistent revenue streams. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-Chipmaker AMD announces layoffs as PC sales stumble
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 18 PC chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices said on Thursday it will cut its work force of nearly 12 000 by 15 percent  its second round of layoffs in less than a year as it struggles with a weak global economy and a consumer shift toward tablets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Housing lifts S&P 500  but Intel and IBM dent the Dow
article: NEW YORK  Oct 17 The S&P 500 rose on Wednesday  putting the benchmark index on track for its third straight day of gains  as U.S. housing starts hit a four-year high  but weak results from tech bellwethers curbed the Dow.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's outlook fails to inspire hopes for PC recovery
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's weak outlook for fourth-quarter revenue and margins dispelled lingering hopes for a revival in PC demand towards the end of the year  pushing its shares 2 percent lower.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Analysis: As PC era fades  good times may be over at Intel
article: SAN FRANCISCO As tablets and smartphones draw more and more users away from PCs  Intel Corp is facing some difficult questions.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Samsung Elec sends Seoul shares lower after U.S. tech sell-off
article: * Samsung Elec falls most since U.S. court ruling in August

name: Intel Corporation
headline: The doctor (in the next cubicle) will see you now
article: NEW YORK So much for the "I have a doctor's appointment" excuse when seeking a three-hour lunch break from work.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Intel's McAfee security plans layoffs
article: BOSTON Intel Corp's McAfee security division is planning to lay off a "small percentage" of its workforce of about 7 100 employees  a company spokesman said on Monday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel zeroes in on enterprise customers with first tablet wave
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp roped in device makers such as Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and Hewlett Packard Co on Thursday to showcase tablets powered by its new "Atom" processor - a chip it hopes will help it biannually break into that crowded market.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel Inside ignites mobile branding war
article: SAN FRANCISCO As the mobile computing wars heat up  chipmakers that supply the crucial components inside smartphones and tablets aim to grab more of the glory.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Sharp in talks to supply panels for ultrabooks: sources
article: TOKYO Japan's cash-strapped Sharp Corp is in talks to supply liquid crystal display panels for ultra-thin laptops that typically use processors made by Intel Corp  sources familiar with the matter said.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Nikkei ends flat  exporters offset gains in China-linked shares
article: * Exporters under pressure as yen rises on QE expectations     * Komatsu  HCM extend gains on China infrastructure spending plans     * Tech firms hurt by Intel's disappointing earnings      By Sophie Knight     TOKYO  Sept 10 Japan's Nikkei average closed flat on Monday  with losses from exporters hurt by a strong yen cancelling out gains for China-related firms boosted by the country's infrastructure drive.     Technology firms also came under pressure after Intel Corp  cut its thi

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel seeks software experts in growing Windows tablet push
article: SAN FRANCISCO Top chipmaker Intel Corp is recruiting for a new software team focused on tablets  according to a new job ad  underscoring the top chipmaker's efforts to expand beyond the lackluster PC industry.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ZTE launches Intel-based smartphone
article: BERLIN Chinese group ZTE  the world's fourth-largest mobile phone maker  unveiled its first smartphone model using Intel processors  marking an important break into a top-tier handset maker by the U.S.-based group.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Integrated Device Technology to develop chips for Intel
article: Aug 29 Analog chipmaker Integrated Device Technology Inc said it will develop a transmitter and receiver chipset for Intel Corp products that use wireless charging technology.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ASML says Samsung invests in its latest chip technology
article: AMSTERDAM ASML  the world's top chip equipment maker  said Samsung Electronics would invest 779 million euros ($975 million) in its research into costly next-generation chipmaking technology and in buying a 3 percent equity stake.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel  Apple leading charge against conflict minerals: report
article: UNITED NATIONS Intel  Motorola Solutions  Hewlett Packard and Apple are pioneering progress toward wiping out the use of conflict minerals - like tantalum  tin and tungsten - in their products  but other companies are lagging  according to a report by a nonprofit rights group.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ASML says TSMC joins Intel to invest in latest chip kit
article: AMSTERDAM ASML  the global chip equipment maker  has signed up TSMC to further bankroll its research and development into costly next-generation chip-making kit to make micro chips smaller  smarter and cheaper  the Dutch firm said on Sunday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Chipmaker AMD's revenue forecast disappoints
article: SAN FRANCISCO Advanced Micro Devices  forecast third-quarter revenue below expectations on Thursday as it struggles with a weak global economy  tepid PC sales and relentless pressure from top chipmaker Intel .

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500 rises to 2-1/2-month high on profits
article: NEW YORK  July 18 The S&P 500 touched its highest level since early May on Wednesday as corporate profits from bellwethers Intel and Honeywell defied fears of a collapse in earnings.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel forecast portends weak PC sales
article: SAN FRANCISCO Top chipmaker Intel Corp  reduced its growth forecast  reinforcing fears that a wavering global economy and a lack of consumer interest are dampening personal computer sales.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: TEXT-S&P keeps Interline Brands ratings on watch
article: Overview      -- The parent of U.S.-based distributor Interline Brands Inc. is seeking to issue $365 million senior holding company notes in part to fund its  acquisition by affiliates of GS Capital Partners LP and P2 Capital Partners  LLC.      -- We are assigning a 'B+' corporate credit rating to Interline Brands  Inc. (Delaware Corp.)  the parent of Interline Brands Inc.  and are assigning  a 'B-' issue rating to its proposed $365 million holding company notes.      -- The ratings on Interlin

name: Intel Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Moody's says Intel's investment in ASML Holding N.V. is credit positive
article: July 11 Moody's says Intel's investment in ASML Holding N.V. is credit positive

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel funds next-gen chipmaking  buys into ASML for $4.1 billion
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp will spend more than $4 billion to buy a stake in ASML and bankroll its research into costly next-generation chipmaking technology  a major vote of confidence in the Dutch company that sent its U.S. shares soaring 6 percent on Monday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel fights $1.3 billion EU antitrust fine in court
article: LUXEMBOURG EU antitrust regulators relied on "profoundly inadequate" evidence in their case against Intel  the U.S. chipmaker said in court on Tuesday in a bid to quash a record 1.06 billion euro ($1.33 billion) fine.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Microsoft announces Surface tablet
article: LOS ANGELES  June 18 Microsoft Corp  unveiled a tablet called Surface on Monday  in a move to rival Apple Inc's massively successful iPad.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CFO eyes more connected living rooms
article: NEW YORK New markets including home entertainment will be major sources of growth for Intel Corp as more gadgets become connected to the Internet and drive demand for powerful data centers  the top chipmaker's chief financial officer said.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ARM says Intel is no threat in smartphones
article: LONDON Chip designer ARM  said its rival Intel Corp  had made a credible debut in smartphones  but the British company's better technology and the size of its partner network meant it would remain dominant in the hot sector.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Mellanox wins Intel contract  shares hit life high
article: Mellanox Technologies Ltd won a contract to supply chip equipment to Intel Corp for use in servers  sending shares of the Israel-based company to a lifetime high.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Analysis: Stakes high as "Wintel" puts all its chips on Windows 8
article: TAIPEI The world of Wintel - Microsoft  Intel and the Taiwan-based companies that build the computers their products power and run on - is taking a huge collective bet on Windows 8.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Insight: Intel's plans for virtual TV come into focus
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Intel is counting on facial-recognition technology for targeted ads and a team of veteran entertainment dealmakers to win over reluctant media partners for its new virtual television service.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel inspired by aerospace to make sturdier laptops
article: SAN FRANCISCO Engineers at Intel Corp are applying lessons from aircraft design to create sturdier laptops in a bid to reduce the prices of the new ultra-thin computers the top chipmaker is promoting heavily.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel set to rise on move into mobile-Barrons
article: May 27 Shares of computer chip maker Intel Corp  could rise as much as 50 percent over the next two years as the company pushes into smart phones and other wireless mobile devices  according to a report in Barron's financial newspaper.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel eyes future with computers that learn
article: TEL AVIV Intel Corp is launching research in Israel into technology that mimics the human brain and develops devices that "learn" about their user.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: AMD's CEO catches Intel's wave of sleek laptops
article: SAN FRANCISCO PC chipmaker AMD's chief executive is betting that its larger rival Intel has overestimated consumers' willingness to pay top dollar for a new category of premium laptops.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CEO plays down concerns about tech spending
article: SANTA CLARA  California Intel Corp Chief Executive Paul Otellini said that he was not seeing unexpected weakness in enterprise technology spending that Cisco Systems Inc CEO John Chambers cited when he forecast quarterly earnings below estimates.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Security startup CrowdStrike adds board members
article: Cyber security start-up CrowdStrike is expanding its board of directors with the addition of former executives from JP Morgan Chase & Co  and software maker McAfee.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Insight: As chip plants get pricey  U.S. risks losing edge
article: CHANDLER  Arizona It goes by the anodyne moniker Fab 42  but the new Intel Corp factory being built in the Arizona desert is hardly a run-of-the-mill production facility.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Aware to sell patents to Intel for $75 million  shares surge
article: Software maker Aware Inc said it will sell some patents related to WiFi and 4G LTE to Intel Corp for about $75 million  sending its shares up 70 percent.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel to challenge antitrust fine in EU court
article: BRUSSELS U.S. chipmaker Intel Corp will ask Europe's second-highest court in July to scrap a 1.06 billion euro ($1.4 billion) EU antitrust fine  arguing regulators failed to prove it blocked a rival in their 2009 decision.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Cray to sell certain assets to Intel for $140 mln
article: April 24 U.S. supercomputer firm Cray  agreed to sell its interconnect hardware development program and related intellectual property to Intel Corp for $140 million in cash.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Chipmaker AMD's first-quarter revenue beats Street
article: SAN FRANCISCO  April 19 Chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices posted first-quarter revenue of $1.59 billion and a net loss of $590 million  or 80 cents a share  as it fights to win market share in a personal computer industry dominated by Intel.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St falls on day after big gains as IBM  Intel drag
article: NEW YORK  April 18 U.S. stocks slipped on Wednesday  a day after Wall Street's best gains in a month  as uninspiring earnings from tech bellwethers IBM and Intel  gave investors a reason to take profits.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel revenue forecast beats  but stock falls
article: Top chipmaker Intel Corp forecast revenue above expectations  as demand for personal computers remained resilient in the face of consumers' growing preference for tablets and other mobile gadgets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Ex-Intel employee pleads guilty to theft charges
article: SAN FRANCISCO A former Intel Corp employee who allegedly stole from the chipmaker documents worth hundreds of millions of dollars pleaded guilty on Friday to five counts of wire fraud.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: HP  Oracle seek pretrial wins in Itanium case
article: SAN FRANCISCO U.S. tech giants Hewlett Packard  and Oracle  on Monday both sought pretrial wins in their bitter legal battle over whether Oracle can end support for Itanium  a heavy-duty microprocessor.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: RPT-SPECIAL REPORT-Intel shows Iran nuclear threat not imminent

name: Intel Corporation
headline: CORRECTED-Samsung loses bid to ban iPhone  iPad sales in Netherlands
article: SEOUL  March 15 Samsung Electronics Co  said on Thursday a Dutch court rejected its 3G patent bid to ban sales of Apple's iPhone and iPad in the Netherlands.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: GE Healthcare  Intel open test lab in Israel
article: JERUSALEM GE Healthcare  the healthcare division of General Electric  and Intel Corp said on Wednesday they have established a laboratory in Israel to jointly test new technologies.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's supply chain chief says ready for mobile
article: SANTA CLARA  California Intel's manufacturing whiz and new chief operating officer  Brian Krzanich  says he has fine-tuned his supply chain to meet expected demand for chips for smartphones and tablets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: BRIEF: Moody's Disclosures on Credit Ratings of Intel Corporation
article: 13 March Moody's Disclosures on Credit Ratings of Intel Corporation

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Micron buys Intel stake in flash joint venture for $600 million
article: Micron Technology  will pay $600 million to buy back Intel Corp's  stake in two wafer factories as the chipmaker bets on the fast-growing NAND flash market to offset margin erosion in its mainstay memory chips.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Orange to offer smartphone with "Intel Inside"
article: SAN FRANCISCO The "Intel Inside" logo on hundreds of millions of personal computers is finally making its way onto a smartphone.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Gasoline pushes inflation up in January
article: WASHINGTON Gasoline prices jumped in January  leading overall consumer prices higher and offering a reminder of the risks energy costs pose to the economic recovery.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Jobs  factory data strengthen growth outlook
article: WASHINGTON The number of Americans filing for new unemployment benefits unexpectedly fell to a near four-year low last week  suggesting the labor market recovery was quickening. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel settles NY antitrust case for just $6.5 million
article: Intel Corp agreed to pay just $6.5 million to resolve an antitrust lawsuit in which New York's attorney general accused the world's largest chipmaker of threatening computer makers and paying billions of dollars of kickbacks to maintain its market dominance.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Singapore Hot Stocks-Artivision soars on Intel tie-up
article: SINGAPORE  Feb 6 Shares of Artivision Technologies Ltd  a Singapore firm specialising in online video advertising  surged as much as 9.1 percent after it said its technology may be incorporated into a software kit being developed by Intel Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel CFO faces fewer worried investors
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Chief Financial Officer Stacy Smith likes the questions he is receiving from Wall Street these days a lot more than the concerns many investors voiced last year about the PC chip giant's ability to adapt to consumers' growing preference for smartphones and tablets.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Synacor sees IPO priced at $10-$12/shr
article: Synacor Inc  partly owned by Intel Corp   said it expects its initial public offering of 6.8 million shares to be priced between $10.00 and $12.00 per share.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: McAfee rejects Symantec claim about market share
article: BOSTON Security software maker McAfee rejected a claim that several large corporate customers had recently switched over to using products from rival Symantec Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Samsung seeks to merge smartphone operating platforms
article: SEOUL/HELSINKI  Jan 17 Samsung Electronics Co plans to merge its own 'bada' mobile phone operating software with an open-source Tizen platform as the world's biggest smartphone maker seeks alternatives to Google's  Android in its devices.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: It's earnings vs Europe for stocks
article: NEW YORK U.S. stock investors will return to a tug of war between signs of domestic strength and overseas concerns this week as a batch of critical earnings reports look to add credence to the idea the economy is improving  while credit rating downgrades in Europe will keep that region's difficulties in view. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: It's earnings versus Europe for stocks
article: NEW YORK Stock investors will return to a tug of war between signs of domestic strength and overseas concerns next week as a batch of critical earnings reports look to add credence to the idea the economy is improving  while credit rating downgrades in Europe will keep that region's difficulties in view. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Motorola  Lenovo sign on to first Intel-powered smartphones
article: Intel announced multi-year pacts with Motorola Mobility and Lenovo to develop smartphones and tablets  and said the first Google Android phones using the top chipmaker's processors would go on sale this year.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Barclays upgrade Micron  shares jump
article: Shares of Micron Technology Inc climbed as much as 11 percent after Barclays Capital raised the chip devices maker's stock to "overweight " even as the brokerage downgraded five other stocks from the sector  including Intel Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel's smartphone guru angles for smooth landing
article: SANTA CLARA  California Mike Bell likens his new job at Intel Corp to piloting a glider.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel combines divisions in bid to boost mobile
article: SAN FRANCISCO Chipmaker Intel is combining four divisions under a new mobile and communications unit in a bid to catch up in smartphones and tablets  where it has so far failed to gain traction.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel says sales hit by hard drive shortage
article: Intel Corp warned that hard-disk drive supply shortages would hurt its current-quarter revenue  the latest heavyweight in the PC industry to caution about the effects of flooding that has crippled factories in Thailand.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 3-McAfee cuts 3 percent of workforce
article: Dec 6 Security software maker McAfee laid off about 250 workers  equivalent to 3 percent of its workforce  in a bid to focus on core businesses and improve efficiency in a market led by rival Symantec .

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-McAfee lays off 3 percent of workforce
article: Dec 6 Security software maker McAfee laid off about 250 workers  equivalent to 3 percent of its workforce  in a bid to improve efficiency  a spokesman said.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel  Total Immersion working on augmented reality chipsets
article: Total Immersion  a pioneer in emerging field of augmented reality (AR)  is working with Intel to bring AR features  like gesture recognition  into Intel's chipsets  an executive of the privately held firm said on Wednesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: HP prods EU antitrust authorities against Oracle
article: SAN JOSE  California Hewlett-Packard is trying to enlist European antitrust authorities to investigate whether Oracle improperly leveraged its strength in software to freeze HP out of certain parts of the hardware market  attorneys for both companies said in court.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: HP  Intel plotted to keep Itanium processor alive: Oracle
article: Oracle Corp accused Hewlett-Packard C of "secretly" contracting with Intel Corp to keep Intel's Itanium microprocessor from being phased out  according to a court filing from Oracle in its long-running legal battle with HP over the Itanium platform.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel-backed Synacor revives IPO plans
article: Synacor Inc  partly owned by Intel Corp  filed with U.S. regulators on Friday to raise up to $75 million in an initial public offering  reviving its plans to tap the public markets after three years.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-AMD to lay off a 10th of workforce by 2012
article: Nov 3 Advanced Micro Devices Inc  unveiled a plan on Thursday to save about $200 million of operating costs in 2012 by slashing 10 percent of its global workforce and streamlining internal business processes.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: HP launches plan to build low-power servers
article: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett Packard Co unveiled plans to develop extremely low-energy servers  partnering with companies such as chip designers ARM Holdings Plc and Advanced Micro Devices Inc in a move that could threaten the dominance of Intel Corp.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-Volterra gives bleak outlook on soft server demand
article: Oct 24 U.S. chipmaker Volterra Semiconductor  signaled a weak fourth quarter as a slowdown in the economy hurts demand for servers and notebooks  echoing the outlook given by larger rival Texas Instruments Inc .

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Thai floods  hard drive shortage threaten PC sales
article: SAN FRANCISCO A looming shortage of hard drives caused by floods in Thailand threatens to disrupt computer manufacturers as soon as December and hurt tech giants like Intel   Apple  and Dell .

name: Intel Corporation
headline: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Meezan Bank starts Islamic financing for laptops
article: KARACHI  Oct 19 Pakistan-based Islamic bank Meezan has started a shariah-compliant hire-purchase scheme for personal computers in collaboration with Intel Corp   a senior official of the bank said on Wednesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Anlaysis: Intel's outlook  buybacks  add shine to shares
article: SAN FRANCISCO Record earnings  a better-than-expected outlook and potential to buy back $10 billion in stock have put some shine back on the world's top chipmaker although investors are wary of jumping in for the long haul. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 5-Intel outlook defies worries of PC decline
article: * Stock rises after hours  (Adds detail on outlook and Windows release; updates stock price)

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Firms urge action on skilled immigrant reform
article: WASHINGTON/SANTA CLARA  California When U.S. restrictions on work permits barred Intel from moving nearly 50 Finnish engineers to the United States this year  the microchip maker reluctantly parked them in a new research center in Finland.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-ASML sees slowdown in chip sector
article: * Q3 net profit 355 mln euros  above forecast 329.9 mln euros

name: Intel Corporation
headline: ASML Q4 orders a beacon for tech sector
article: AMSTERDAM Investors will focus on ASML's fourth-quarter orders for signs of a recovery in the global chip sector when the Dutch chip equipment maker reports third-quarter results on Wednesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: UPDATE 8-Tributes pour in for Steve Jobs  dead at 56
article: Oct 6 U.S. President Barack Obama was among the many people who paid tribute to Steve Jobs  calling the Apple co-founder a visionary and great American innovator.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: CORRECTED - Intel acquires Israeli mobile navigation firm Telmap
article: (Corrects name of Intel's AppUp general manager to Peter Biddle throughout)

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Nomura sees challenging Q4 for U.S. chip companies
article: U.S. semiconductor stocks are expected to see a challenging fourth quarter due to weak electronics demand  rising inventories and lower factory utilization  Nomura said in a note to clients.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel acquires Israeli mobile navigation firm Telmap
article: TEL AVIV Chipmaker Intel Corp has agreed to acquire mobile navigation software maker Telmap  the chief executive of the Israel-based company said on Sunday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Intel Capital says India tech startup valuations "near-bubble"
article: MUMBAI Intel Capital  the investment arm of Intel Corp   the world's biggest chipmaker  believes valuations of early-stage technology companies in India have reached a "near-bubble" stage  as too much capital chases too few quality opportunities.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: AMD cuts Q3 rev view on supply issues; shares fall
article: (Reuters) Advanced Micro Devices Inc cut its third-quarter revenue and gross margin forecast citing manufacturing issues at its German foundry supplier.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Tech firms to invest $4.4 bln in upstate New York
article: ALBANY  N.Y.  Sept 27 A group of five technology firms will invest $4.4 billion in New York State in an effort to develop a new generation of computer chips  Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced on Tuesday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Rambus faithful set up verdict vigil
article: SAN FRANCISCO Pat Hughes left the bar he owns in New York City  flew across the country and showed up at 4:45 a.m. Wednesday morning to stand in line.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Dealtalk: Microsemi must raise Zarlink bid or lose to rival
article: A C$550 million hostile bid for specialty chipmaker Zarlink will likely fail as investors wait for predator Microsemi to raise its bid  or for a friendly suitor to emerge.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Rambus: Hynix  Micron conspired to block chips
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microchip heavyweights Micron Technology Inc and Hynix Semiconductor Inc conspired to squelch Rambus Inc's superior chip technology and keep it from becoming an industry standard  a Rambus lawyer argued in court on Monday.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Obama signs patent bill  sees boost for innovators
article: President Barack Obama signed into law a patent overhaul bill on Friday that backers say will curb frivolous lawsuits and help the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office do the hiring needed to clear a huge backlog of applications.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: New Issue-Intel Corp. sells $5 bln notes in 3 parts
article: Sept 15 Intel Corp.  on Wednesday sold $5 billion of senior unsecured notes  said IFR  a Thomson Reuters service.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Developers get early taste of Windows 8
article: ANAHEIM  California Microsoft Corp handed out 5 000 sleek Samsung tablet computers running a test version of Windows 8 at its annual developer conference on Tuesday  hoping to stoke excitement over its new operating system. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Bets on euro zone progress boost Wall Street
article: NEW YORK Stocks gained on Tuesday as investors bought shares beaten down in recent weeks and bet European leaders would take action soon to ease the Greek debt crisis. | Video

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Chip stocks may have hit bottom - Barron's
article: NEW YORK  Sept 11 Chips stocks may have hit bottom and could be poised for a rebound ahead of January's Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas  according to a report in the Sept. 12 issue of Barron's.

name: Intel Corporation
headline: Nvidia up on outlook  analysts skeptical
article: Shares of Nvidia Corp  jumped more than 11 percent on Wednesday  as investors bet on strong sales for the company's chips used in mobile devices like smartphones and tablets.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft names general counsel Brad Smith as chief legal officer
article: Microsoft Corp on Friday appointed its general counsel  Brad Smith  as the company's president and chief legal officer  effective Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft urges US court to block warrant for emails held abroad
article: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp asked a federal appeals court on Wednesday to block the U.S. government from forcing the company to hand over a customer's emails stored on an Irish server  warning that the precedent would create a "global free-for-all" that eviscerates personal privacy.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Amazon video to join Disney's cloud movie service
article: Walt Disney Co's studio unit said customers of Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp's video services will get access to the collection on its cloud-based movie storage service from Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. International Trade Commission clears Microsoft of patent infringement
article: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp avoided a potentially costly setback to its mobile phone business on Friday as the U.S. International Trade Commission declined to block the import of its devices in a longstanding patent dispute.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft files antitrust suit against InterDigital in patent feud
article: NEW YORK InterDigital Inc has violated U.S. antitrust law by failing to keep its promise to fairly license its technology considered essential to mobile phone communications  Microsoft Corp said in a lawsuit on Thursday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-Google loses bid to overturn low-cost patent licenses to Microsoft
article: NEW YORK  July 30 In a setback for Google Inc   a U.S. appeals court ruled on Thursday that the low licensing rate Microsoft Corp pays to use some of Google's Motorola Mobility patents had been properly set.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: A fresh Start: Microsoft's Windows 10 wins plaudits
article: Microsoft Corp's  launch of its first new operating system in almost three years  designed to work across laptops  desktop and smartphones  won mostly positive reviews for its user-friendly and feature-packed interface. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: France's Technicolor to buy Cisco's set-top box business
article: PARIS French media and entertainment technology group Technicolor will buy Cisco System's home video equipment business for 550 million euros ($602 million)  it said on Thursday  sending its shares to a five-year high.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St ends lower as tech stocks weigh
article: * Indexes down: Dow 0.38 pct  S&P 0.24 pct  Nasdaq 0.7 pct   (Updates to market close)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft posts record loss as it writes down Nokia
article: Microsoft Corp  reported a $3.2 billion quarterly net loss  its biggest ever  as the company wrote down its Nokia phone business and demand fell for its Windows operating system.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Wall Street ends flat as commodity drop caps gains
article: Wall Street was little changed on Monday  as a better-than-expected start to corporate earnings season boosted investor confidence  but gains were curbed by a drop in commodities.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Lines go silent in Finnish town of Salo as Microsoft shuts Nokia phone unit
article: HELSINKI When U.S. software giant Microsoft bought Nokia's struggling mobile phone business last year  the inhabitants of Salo – a town of 54 000 in southern Finland – thought the move would revive the local economy.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft's mobile future hinges on success of Windows 10
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Inc's  future in mobile devices likely hinges on the software maker's ability to convince developers to create apps for the phone version of Windows 10 after its ill-fated Nokia acquisition helped trigger 7 800 layoffs. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Cisco to buy OpenDNS for $635 million to boost security business
article: Cisco Systems Inc  said on Tuesday it would buy OpenDNS  a privately held cloud-based security firm  for $635 million  the latest move to boost its security business as cyber attacks increase in number and sophistication.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft hands display ads to AOL  maps to Uber
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  said on Monday it will hand over its display advertising business to AOL Inc and sell some map-generating technology to ride-hailing app company Uber  as it slims down its money-losing online operations.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia CEO says to get back into phones - Manager Magazin
article: FRANKFURT  June 18 Nokia  once the world's biggest maker of mobile phones  plans to start designing and licensing handsets again once an agreement with partner Microsoft allows it to in 2016  its chief executive told Germany's Manager Magazin.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Stephen Elop  former Nokia CEO  to leave Microsoft
article: SEATTLE Stephen Elop  the former top boss at phone-maker Nokia  is one of four high-level executives leaving Microsoft Corp as the company sharpens its focus on software services and the cloud  Chief Executive Satya Nadella announced on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St rises as Fed meet eyed; M&A picks up
article: * UnitedHealth biggest boost to Dow; Microsoft to S&P  Nasdaq

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to sell big-screen Surface Hub for up to $20 000
article: SEATTLE  June 10 Revealing its price tag for the first time  Microsoft Corp will sell a bigger version of its new  wall-mounted video-conferencing and digital whiteboard device for $20 000  making it the most expensive product in its hardware line-up  the software company said on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Apple said to build high-speed data network: Bloomberg
article: Apple Inc is setting up a high-speed network and upgrading how it builds data centers  to compete better with Amazon.com Inc  Google Inc and Microsoft Corp in cloud services  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the plans.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Madrona taps Amazon  Microsoft alumni for new $300 mln venture fund
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 4 Seattle-based Madrona Venture Group said it has raised $300 million for a new fund  its sixth  drawing on the growing start-up community in the backyard it shares with Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Deutsche Bank partners with Microsoft  HCL  IBM in tech lab launch
article: FRANKFURT Deutsche Bank  will launch three innovation labs this year  partnering with big development firms to speed creation of financial technology for its own uses and will spend up to 1 billion euros ($1.11 billion) on digital development in the next 5 years.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: HP CEO says split effective from November 1
article: Hewlett-Packard Co Chief Executive Meg Whitman said the separation of HP Inc and Hewlett-Packard Enterprise would be effective on Nov. 1.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-U.S. stocks recover gains after mixed economic data
article: * Indexes up: Dow 0.4 pct  S&P 0.4 pct  Nasdaq 0.5 pct   (Updates to early afternoon)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Proact buys business unit from VX Company
article: * Proact acquires the business unit "Microsoft datacenter innovation services" from VX Company

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. top court rules against Cisco Systems in patent infringement fight
article: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled against Cisco Systems Inc over a patent infringement claim the tech giant is fighting.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St ends lower after Yellen comments fail to inspire
article: * Yellen comments leave rate expectations unchanged on Wall Street

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: HP forecasts split-related costs below expectations
article: Hewlett-Packard Co   which is in the process of splitting itself  forecast separation-related costs below the expectation of several analysts and reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT - INSIGHT-Apple  Android app makers cool to Microsoft overtures
article: SEATTLE  May 20 Microsoft's plan to make its new version of Windows a mobile hit by letting it accept tweaked Apple and Android apps has met an obstacle: some of the software developers the company needs to woo just aren't interested.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St little changed on weak data  bond market swings
article: * Indexes up: Dow 0.1 pct  S&P 0.2 pct  Nasdaq 0.3 pct   (Updates to early afternoon)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Sunrise Communications enters into strategic partnership with Microsoft
article: * Enters into a strategic partnership with Microsoft: cloud solution for enterprises  Source text - http://bit.ly/1bLVr5S Further company coverage:    (Gdynia Newsroom)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Stocks leap as Wall Street lauds jobs growth
article: * S&P 500  Dow up for the week; Nasdaq down slightly for week

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Sky? Skype? EU court backs Murdoch over Microsoft in name battle
article: LUXEMBOURG In a clash of corporate titans over naming rights in a fast-changing industry  Microsoft  and its Skype phone service came out on the losing side of an EU court battle on Tuesday with Rupert Murdoch's television business Sky.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Salesforce shares spike on report of Microsoft evaluating bid
article: Shares of Salesforce.com Inc  jumped as much as 6.4 percent on Tuesday after a Bloomberg report that Microsoft Corp  was evaluating a bid for the cloud software provider.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Oracle CEO sees benefit if rival buys Salesforce.com
article: REDWOOD CITY  Calif. Oracle Corp  Chief Executive Safra Catz said her company could benefit if Microsoft Corp  or another rival bought online customer relationship management firm Salesforce.com Inc .

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft targets $20 billion in annual cloud revenue by 2018
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp is targeting $20 billion in annual revenue from its cloud-computing businesses by the end of fiscal 2018  Chief Executive Satya Nadella said on Wednesday  signaling a tripling of such revenue in three years.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft phones infringe patents - U.S. Int'l Trade Commission judge
article: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp lost a round in a potentially costly patent battle when a U.S. International Trade Commission judge on Monday found that the software giant used InterDigital Inc's technology in its mobile phones without permission.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Tech triumvirate propels Nasdaq  S&P to record highs
article: The Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 chalked up record high closes on Friday  propelled by strong results from tech behemoths Google  Amazon and Microsoft. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Yahoo  Microsoft add termination clause in search deal: filing
article: The 10-year search partnership  crafted by former Microsoft Chief Executive Steve Ballmer and former Yahoo CEO Carol Bartz  allowed the companies to amend or terminate the agreement five  years after its commencement on Feb. 23  2015.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT-EU to investigate transparency of Internet search results -document
article: BRUSSELS  April 17 Internet platforms such as Google  Microsoft and Yahoo! will be the subject of a widespread inquiry by European regulators to determine whether they are transparent enough in how they display search results.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-What to Watch in the Week Ahead and on Monday  April 20
article: A slew of Dow 30 companies report results in the week: Chemicals conglomerate DuPont  industrial conglomerate United Technologies Corp  property and casualty insurer Travelers Companies Inc and wireless carrier Verizon Communications Inc on Tuesday; McDonald's Corp  AT&T Inc  Boeing Co and Coca-Cola Co on Wednesday; and diversified manufacturer 3M Co  Procter & Gamble and Microsoft Corp on Thursday. While DuPont is expected to report lower first-quarter results  Travelers Companies Inc's first-q

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Microsoft and Yahoo amend search deal
article: April 16 Microsoft Corp and Yahoo Inc  amended a 2009 search partnership  giving Yahoo more control over how search results are displayed on desktops and mobile devices.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Court questions Google on patent values in Microsoft case
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. appeals court appeared skeptical on Wednesday toward Google Inc's bid to charge Microsoft Corp a high royalty rate to use some of the Internet search provider's Motorola Mobility patents.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Getty Images settle dispute over online photo tool
article: NEW YORK Getty Images has dropped its lawsuit against Microsoft Corp over alleged "massive" copyright infringement  announcing on Tuesday a plan to amicably bring Getty's photos to Microsoft's Internet search engine and devices.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft brings document scanner app to iPhones  Android
article: SEATTLE  April 2 Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it is bringing one of its most popular apps  which lets people take photos of a document and turn it into a editable file  to Apple Inc's iPhone and Google Inc's  Android.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Yahoo  Microsoft extend search partnership talks for 30 days
article: SAN FRANCISCO  March 27 Yahoo Inc and Microsoft Corp agreed to extend by 30 days the deadline to re-negotiate a ten year search deal  as the two Internet companies attempt to revamp a thorny partnership crafted by former chief executives.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Samsung to pre-install Microsoft apps on Android tablets
article: SEATTLE  March 23 Microsoft Corp's  Office apps will be pre-installed in some Samsung  tablets running Google Inc's Android system  extending an agreement to put some Microsoft apps on the new Samsung Galaxy S6 phone.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Oracle object to RadioShack sale to shield licenses
article: Microsoft Corp and Oracle America Inc have objected to RadioShack's sale of its stores  citing concerns about licensed products used by the bankrupt electronics retailer.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft must face Xbox 360 class action claims
article: Microsoft Corp must face class action claims by Xbox 360 owners who say the video game console has a design defect that causes game discs to be gouged  a federal appeals court ruled on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to offer biometric sign-in for Windows 10
article: SEATTLE  March 17 Microsoft Corp will introduce an automatic biometric sign-in option with its Windows 10 operating system due out later this year  the first time it has offered such a service widely across devices.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft's digital assistant to head to Android  Apple devices
article: SEATTLE Microsoft is working on an advanced version of its competitor to Apple's Siri  using research from an artificial intelligence project called "Einstein."

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sues Kyocera over cell phones  seeks U.S. injunction
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp sued Kyocera Corp for patent infringement on Friday  alleging the Japanese company's Duraforce  Hydro and Brigadier cell phone lines violate seven Microsoft patents.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft warns Windows PCs also vulnerable to 'Freak' attacks
article: BOSTON Hundreds of millions of Windows PC users are vulnerable to attacks exploiting the recently uncovered "Freak" security vulnerability  which was initially believed to only threaten mobile devices and Mac computers  Microsoft Corp warned.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Bill Gates tops Forbes rich list  Michael Jordan joins
article: Bill Gates stands atop Forbes magazine's annual list of the world's richest people  as Facebook Inc's Mark Zuckerberg joined the top 20 and basketball star Michael Jordan plowed new air by making the list for the first time.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ex-executives say fired by Microsoft for hostess charge doubts
article: SEATTLE Two former Microsoft Corp managers have sued the company  saying they were forced out after they raised concerns about an employee's large claims for expenses in South Korea that may have included sex services.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: InterDigital loses another round in patent fight
article: WASHINGTON InterDigital Inc  a patent licensing firm  lost an infringement fight on Wednesday as a U.S. appeals court ruled that wireless phones made by Nokia  since purchased by Microsoft  and ZTE Corp do not infringe on InterDigital patents.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Bill Gates meets with China technology minister - ministry
article: SHANGHAI  Feb 13 Bill Gates  Microsoft Corp's  former CEO  met with China's technology minister this week  said a Friday statement on the ministry website  days after U.S. tech groups expressed concerns over Chinese regulation damaging their businesses.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Samsung settle contract dispute over patents
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd have settled a contract dispute over patent royalties  though terms of the settlement are confidential  Microsoft said in a statement on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  AT&T risk ratings
article: NEW YORK  Jan 30 (IFR) - Microsoft's coveted Triple A rating could come into question and AT&T is likely to lose its Single A rating after both brand names outlined plans that could see their leverage surge.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft gives away more Office software to attract mobile users
article: SEATTLE  Jan 29 Microsoft Corp made its popular Word  Excel and PowerPoint applications available for free on Android tablets on Thursday  marking the latest step in its drive to get as many mobile customers as possible using its software.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Amazon ramps up enterprise push with email service
article: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc  accelerated its efforts to win over corporate clients on Wednesday by announcing an email and scheduling service that will compete with Microsoft Corp  and Google Inc .

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Yahoo! says mobile revenue in Q4 was $254 million
article: Jan 27 Yahoo Inc :  * Says mobile revenue in Q4 was $254 million  * CEO says native gemini ads generated $106 million in Q4  up 32 percent from

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft profit falls on sluggish Windows  currency pressure
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Monday reported a fall in its quarterly profit that was in line with Wall Street forecasts  as sluggish personal computer sales dampened demand for Windows software and the company struggled with the impact of the strong U.S. dollar.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft shows off holographic lens device at Windows briefing
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  on Wednesday unveiled a holographic lens device that allows users to see three-dimensional renderings of computer-generated images.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to give away Windows 10  unveils hologram glasses
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  will give away its upcoming Windows 10 operating system as a free upgrade to users of the most recent versions of Windows and Windows Phone  as the world's largest software company tries to retain customers in the mobile era.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: British police arrest man over Christmas Xbox  Playstation hacks
article: LONDON British police said on Friday they had arrested a man in northwest England following the 2014 cyber attacks on Sony PlayStation and Microsoft Xbox systems.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Google tangle over Windows security patch
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp has complained publicly about tech rival Google Inc revealing a security flaw in its Windows 8.1 system just days before Microsoft was scheduled to roll out a fix for the problem  potentially exposing users to hacking.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-Bad code update triggered Yahoo  Bing search crash-source
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Jan 2 Yahoo Inc and Microsoft Corp search engines temporarily went dark on Friday after Microsoft pushed out a bad code update and then struggled to roll it back  a person briefed on the outages told Reuters.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Yahoo search engine down shortly after Bing outage
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Jan 2 Yahoo Inc's search engine was down on Friday  shortly after Microsoft Corp's  search engine  Bing  was also briefly unavailable before recovering.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft Xbox Live back up  Sony PlayStation Network still down
article: Microsoft Corp's Xbox Live was back up on Friday while Sony Corp's PlayStation Network remained offline for a second day after a hacker group claimed responsibility for attacking the two Internet gaming services. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Sony PlayStation  Microsoft Xbox websites hit by delays
article: Dec 25 Microsoft Corp's Xbox Live and Sony Corp's PlayStation Networks experienced user connection problems on Christmas Day  for which a hacker group claimed responsibility.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-RPX buys Apple-backed Rockstar patents for $900 mln
article: (Adds detail about patent valuation and comment from RPX  Microsoft)

headline: BRIEF-Line to buy MixRadio music streaming service from Microsoft
article: * Messaging app Line Corp says has agreed to buy music streaming service MixRadio from Microsoft Corp  price not disclosed  Further company coverage:     (Tokyo newsroom)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Tech companies support Microsoft in overseas data fight with U.S.
article: NEW YORK/SEATTLE Corporate lobbyists  news organizations and academics joined forces with Microsoft Corp  on Monday in the software company's legal battle with the U.S. government over access to customer data stored overseas.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Facebook dumps Microsoft Web search results
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  has stopped including results from Microsoft Corp's  Bing search engine on its social networking site.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Censors loom large over Sony's PlayStation prospects in China
article: (Updates with pricing and sale date  executive's comments)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft exec sees autumn release for Windows 10
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp expects to have its new Windows 10 operating system on the market by autumn 2015  slightly later than previous comments had suggested.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BRIEF-HUS selects Innofactor as provider of Microsoft Azure services
article: * Hospital District of Helsinki and Uusimaa (HUS) selects Innofactor as the provider of its Microsoft Azure cloud ervices

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Activist fund ValueAct to raise capital to target new companies
article: BOSTON Activist hedge fund ValueAct Capital Management  which played a key role in shaking up Microsoft Corp's management  plans to raise more capital as it sees a number of investment opportunities.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-Barnes & Noble  Microsoft end Nook Media pact
article: Dec 4 Barnes & Noble Inc struck a deal to buy Microsoft Corp's stake in Nook Media LLC  ending a two-year partnership and clearing the way for the bookseller to spin off its loss-making e-reader and digital content division.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft ex-CEO Ballmer  activist Jesse Jackson pep up annual meet
article: BELLEVUE  Wash. Former Microsoft Corp  Chief Executive Steve Ballmer and civil rights activist Jesse Jackson livened up the technology company's annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday  grabbing the spotlight from the current leaders on stage.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China to crack down on tax avoidance by foreign firms: Xinhua
article: SHANGHAI China will toughen its stance on tax avoidance by foreign firms to prevent tax payments being directed overseas  the official Xinhua news agency has said  after Beijing levied $140 million in back taxes from U.S. firm Microsoft Corp  last week.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to pay China $140 million for 'tax evasion'
article: SEATTLE China has levied about $140 million in back taxes from Microsoft Corp in the first major case concerning cross-border tax evasion in the country  as regulators ramp up pressure on U.S. corporations doing business there.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sues IRS for details of probe on internal transactions
article: Microsoft sued the Internal Revenue Service on Monday  seeking information about a law firm hired by U.S. tax authorities in a review of how the software company books sales between subsidiaries.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft cloud service partially down  MSN unavailable
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's Azure cloud-computing service  which hosts websites and lets customers store and manage data remotely  suffered serious outages on Tuesday taking its popular MSN web portal offline.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft issues update to fix domain privileges security
article: Microsoft Corp issued an emergency software update to fix a security glitch that affects domain privileges in all supported versions of Windows.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft fixes 19-year-old Windows bug
article: Microsoft Corp issued patches on Tuesday to fix a bug in its Windows operating system that remained undiscovered for 19 years.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft unveils first Lumia smartphone without Nokia name
article: Microsoft Corp  said it would roll out its Lumia 535 smartphone this month with an affordable price tag in its key markets  dropping the Nokia name just months after buying the Finnish company's handset business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Geldof to fire up charity hit 30 years on to fight Ebola
article: LONDON Musician and philanthropist Bob Geldof  who in 1984 inspired a host of rock stars to record a charity single for Africa  will raise money to combat Ebola with a new version of the song.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft makes more Office features free on iPads
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Thursday said users of its Office suite of applications on Apple Inc's iPad would be able to create and edit documents for free instead of paying for a subscription  in a bid to capture more mobile users.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft partners with Dropbox for online file-sharing
article: Nov 4 Microsoft Corp said it teamed up with online file-sharing company Dropbox Inc to allow Office software users to manage and share files through Dropbox's website and mobile app.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Samsung says Microsoft deal invites 'charges of collusion': filing
article: Samsung said its collaboration with Microsoft on Windows phones raised antitrust problems once Microsoft completed its acquisition of Nokia's handset business  according to a court filing.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft launches wearable fitness device for $199
article: Microsoft Corp launched a device called "Microsoft Band" that will allow users to monitor their fitness and exercise regime  marking the world's largest software company's debut into the wearable technology market.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Paul Allen's sister steps away from managing $17 bln fortune
article: SEATTLE  Oct 27 Paul Allen's sister  Jody  who has managed the Microsoft Corp co-founder's multi-billion dollar philanthropy and investment efforts for three decades  is taking an indefinite sabbatical  according to an Allen spokeswoman.

article: * Microsoft  Procter & Gamble results lift U.S. shares     * Ebola scare diminishes  boosting U.S. shares     * U.S. Treasuries prices stable on reduced Ebola concerns     * Euro rises ahead of European bank stress test results   (Adds close of U.S. markets)     By Sam Forgione     NEW YORK  Oct 24 Global equity markets rose on Friday after strong corporate results from Microsoft and Procter & Gamble and reduced concerns over the possible spread of Ebola boosted U.S. shares and kept

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sales beat Street hopes  cloud profits up
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  reported higher-than-expected quarterly revenue  helped by stronger sales of its phones  Surface tablets and cloud-computing products for companies  while keeping its profit margins largely intact.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft looks set to drop Nokia name from smartphones
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  looks set to ditch the Nokia name from its Lumia range of smartphones just months after buying the Finnish company's handset business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: What Minecraft is teaching your kids about money
article: NEW YORK If your kids are chattering non-stop about things like emeralds  pickaxes and creepers  you may have a unique opportunity to turn a video game addiction into a life lesson about money.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: New Microsoft CEO pay tops $80 million with big stock awards
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's new Chief Executive Satya Nadella has become one the technology industry's biggest earners  with a total compensation package worth $84.3 million this year  according to a document filed with securities regulators on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft plans to launch smartwatch within weeks: Forbes
article: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp.  is preparing to launch a smartwatch within the next few weeks that will passively track a user's heart rate and work across different mobile platforms  Forbes reported on Sunday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Getty fails to get injunction on Microsoft image widget
article: NEW YORK Getty Images Inc [GETTY.UL] has failed to convince a federal judge to halt Microsoft Corp's  Bing Image Widget  which it said enabled massive copyright infringement  because the software company had already taken it down voluntarily.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: INDIA PRESS-Microsoft to launch dedicated e-store for India market - Economic Times
article: Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy.   (Compiled by Derek Francis in Bangalore)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: As US tech takes China hit  software maker part-owned by Microsoft leaps ahead
article: BEIJING  Oct 13 Although Microsoft Corp  is among U.S. technology firms caught up in Chinese security worries and antitrust probes  a local software company in which the Seattle giant is a strategic investor is riding high on the growth of cloud computing.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: After gaffe  Microsoft board to look at gender pay gap  male culture
article: SEATTLE/SAN FRANCISCO A well-known picture in tech circles  taken in 1978  shows the first 11 employees at Microsoft. Two are women. One of them left two years later after a pay dispute.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Samsung seeks Hong Kong arbitration after Microsoft lawsuit
article: NEW YORK Samsung Electronics Co Ltd initiated an arbitration proceeding in Hong Kong against Microsoft Corp on Tuesday  amid ongoing U.S. litigation over smartphone patent royalties.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Endor AG says has closed license agreement on Xbox One accessories with Microsoft Corp.
article: * Says has closed license agreement on accessories for Xbox One with Microsoft Corp.  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says Samsung owes $6.9 million in unpaid interest
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp  is demanding $6.9 million interest from Samsung Electronics  in a dispute over smartphone patent royalties  according to a lawsuit unsealed by a New York federal court on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft names next operating system 'Windows 10'
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp announced its 'Windows 10' operating system on Tuesday to replace the largely unpopular Windows 8  skipping a number to mark a leap toward unifying the way people work on tablets  phones and traditional computers.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia says not liable in Mexico damages ruling on former unit
article: MEXICO CITY Finland's Nokia said on Monday the liabilities of its former unit Nokia Mexico S.A. de C.V. were now held by Microsoft Corp  responding to a Mexican court ruling that Nokia Mexico would have to pay damages for faulty equipment.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft boss Nadella promises cooperation in Chinese antitrust probe
article: BEIJING Microsoft Corp chief executive Satya Nadella promised to cooperate fully with Chinese authorities in their antitrust investigation into his company during a meeting with a top regulator in Beijing  the Chinese government said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Romania seeks probe into ex-ministers in school software deal
article: BUCHAREST Romania's anti-corruption prosecutor's office  or DNA  is seeking to launch a criminal inquiry against nine ex-government ministers suspected of money laundering  abuse of office and bribery related to Microsoft  educational licenses from 2004 to 2009.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft offers first look at new Windows - and gives it a name
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp will unveil a new name for its best-known product on Tuesday when it offers the first official glimpse of its latest Windows operating system.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: At L.A. Clippers  Steve Ballmer prizes team tested by adversity
article: LOS ANGELES After Steve Ballmer plunked down $2 billion for the NBA's Los Angeles Clippers  fans might expect the former Microsoft chief executive to be hitting the reset button on a team that has been through a nasty public fight over racism.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: CORRECTED-BRIEF-Prodware application store CRM reaches $2 mln sales in H1
article: (Corrects second bullet point to say it refers to sales from Microsoft and Prodware  not a full year 2014 forecast)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft Xbox One set to launch in China on September 29
article: BEIJING Microsoft Corp has set Sept. 29 as the new launch date for its Xbox One game console in China  the U.S. software giant said on Tuesday  in the first launch since a 14-year ban on sales of foreign games consoles was lifted this year.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: INDIA PRESS-Microsoft to launch Xbox One in India through Amazon this week - Economic Times
article: Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy.   (Compiled by Aby Jose Koilparambil in Bangalore)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft delays launch of its Xbox One console in China
article: BEIJING Microsoft Corp  has delayed the launch of its Xbox One game console in China  which had been set for release on Tuesday  but the world's biggest software company said it would be released by the end of the year.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. information chief joins response to Ebola outbreak
article: WASHINGTON A U.S. government technology expert who helped Microsoft Corp co-founder Bill Gates launch the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation will join the Obama administration's battle against Ebola in West Africa  administration officials said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft calls on U.S. FCC to approve AT&T's bid for DirecTV
article: WASHINGTON Microsoft Corp urged the Federal Communications Commission to approve AT&T's Inc $48.5 billion bid for DirecTV  saying in a filing that the acquisition is crucial to expanding Americans' access to the internet.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft boosts dividend 11 percent  adds new directors
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  on Tuesday announced the smallest percentage increase in its quarterly dividend since 2009 and appointed new directors to replace two board members who decided not to seek re-election.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive : Microsoft co-founder Allen to give $9 million for Ebola fight
article: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp co-founder Paul Allen's charitable foundation on Thursday will announce it is donating $9 million to support U.S. efforts to fight the Ebola outbreak in West Africa  a source familiar with the matter said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT-Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest
article: Sept 10 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media:

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft nears deal to buy Minecraft maker Mojang -WSJ
article: Sept 9 Microsoft Corp is in serious discussions to buy Mojang AB  the Swedish company behind the popular "Minecraft" video game  The Wall Street Journal said  citing a person with knowledge of the matter.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  publishers try to stop 'catastrophic' Google EU deal
article: BRUSSELS Google's  antitrust deal with EU regulators was criticized by Microsoft  and other competitors in a last-ditch attempt to influence European Competition Commissioner Joaquin Almunia before he leaves office at the end of October.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. business lobby says concerned China antitrust probes unfair
article: BEIJING Foreign companies are increasingly concerned they are being targeted by Chinese regulators  a U.S. business lobby said on Tuesday  as a Chinese antitrust agency defended probes into firms such as U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc .

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China gives Microsoft 20 days to provide explanation in anti-trust probe
article: BEIJING A Chinese anti-trust regulator said on Monday it has given Microsoft Corp  20 days to reply to queries on the compatibility of its Windows operating system and Office software suite amid a probe into the world's largest software company.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft will not hand over overseas email  despite order
article: NEW YORK A judge on Friday lifted a suspension on her order directing Microsoft Corp  to turn over a customer's emails stored overseas to U.S. prosecutors  but the software company said it would not release any emails while it appeals the ruling.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. judge lifts suspension on Microsoft overseas email seizure
article: NEW YORK A judge on Friday lifted a suspension on her order directing Microsoft Corp  to turn over a customer's emails stored overseas to U.S. prosecutors.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft CEO Nadella to visit China amid antitrust probe - source
article: BEIJING/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella is set to visit China in late September  the company said on Thursday  as the Chinese government conducts an antitrust investigation into the world's largest software company.

article: (Corrects second paragraph to say Microsoft suspected of not being fully transparent about information)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China targets own operating system to take on likes of Microsoft  Google
article: SHANGHAI China could have a new homegrown operating system by October to take on imported rivals such as Microsoft Corp  Google Inc and Apple Inc  Xinhua news agency said on Sunday.

headline: BRIEF-NEXT Biometrics sensors certified by Microsoft
article: Aug 22 Next Biometrics Group ASA :  * Sensors certified by Microsoft  * Source text for Eikon  * Further company coverage

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-GameStop 2nd-quarter sales beat expectations; shares rise
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 21 GameStop Corp on Thursday reported its quarterly revenue surged by 25 percent over the prior year  topping expectations  buoyed by the success of new game releases as well as solid sales of gaming hardware from Microsoft and Sony Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ex-CEO Ballmer quits Microsoft board to focus on NBA's Clippers
article: SEATTLE Former Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Steve Ballmer has left the software company's board in order to spend more time on his newly acquired Los Angeles Clippers basketball team  but said he plans to hang on to his 4 percent stake in Microsoft.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft cloud service Azure restored after partial outage
article: Aug 18 Microsoft said it resolved an outage on its Azure cloud computing service  which occurred across multiple regions.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Los Angeles Clippers sale to Steve Ballmer finalized: NBA
article: LOS ANGELES Steve Ballmer  the former head of Microsoft  has completed his $2 billion purchase of the Los Angeles Clippers basketball team  ending a saga that began when former team owner Donald Sterling was heard making racist remarks to his girlfriend on a tape recording.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ex-Microsoft employee gets two years in prison for insider trades
article: SEATTLE A former Microsoft Corp  employee was sentenced to two years in prison on Friday for his part in an insider trading scheme that netted him and his partner more than $400 000.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China's latest anti-trust probes revive protectionism concerns
article: BEIJING China's recent probes into Microsoft Corp and car companies including Audi and Chrysler have rekindled concerns that Beijing may be using an anti-monopoly law to support domestic firms at the expense of foreign companies.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China anti-trust regulator conducts new raids on Microsoft  Accenture
article: BEIJING A Chinese anti-trust regulator conducted new raids on Microsoft Corp  and partner in China Accenture PLC   the agency said on its website on Wednesday  after saying last week Microsoft is under investigation for anti-trust violations.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China regulator says Microsoft should not obstruct anti-trust probe
article: BEIJING Microsoft Corp  should not obstruct an anti-trust investigation by Chinese regulators  the State Administration for Industry and Commerce (SAIC) said on Monday  the latest shot fired by China's government at the U.S. software giant.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sues Samsung in U.S. over patent royalties
article: Microsoft Corp  sued Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  on Friday  claiming the South Korean smartphone maker refused to make a royalty payment last fall on patent licenses after Microsoft announced its intention to acquire Nokia's  handset business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft board adds mobile savvy with Stanton
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp named wireless industry pioneer John Stanton to its board on Wednesday  adding a director with experience in the mobile sector it has struggled to crack.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft gives employees sneak peek at new 'selfie' phone
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's  hardware chief gave employees a sneak peek at a 'selfie' phone featuring a 5 megapixel forward-facing camera at an internal meeting this week  a source at the company said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Judge allows $2 billion sale of NBA's Los Angeles Clippers to proceed
article: LOS ANGELES The record $2 billion sale of pro basketball's Los Angeles Clippers to former Microsoft Corp chief executive Steve Ballmer can proceed over the objections of co-owner Donald Sterling  a judge tentatively ruled on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Europe debates how far to push 'right to be forgotten'
article: PARIS/BRUSSELS European regulators have not yet decided whether to try to force search engines such as Google and Microsoft's Bing to scrub results globally when people invoke their "right to be forgotten" in the region.

article: * Dow down 0.1 pct  S&P up 0.2 pct  Nasdaq up 0.4 pct   (Updates to afternoon trading)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sees end to Nokia losses  shares rise after hours
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said it aims to get its loss-making Nokia phone unit to break even within two years  helping its stock rise in after-hours trade.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Smartphone suit against Google plays into rivals' hands
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. consumer lawsuit accusing Google of monopolizing prime real estate on Android smartphones will help mobile rivals like Microsoft make their antitrust case with European regulators should damaging secrets emerge in court.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft ends flirtation with Hollywood and original shows: source
article: LOS ANGELES Microsoft Corp intends to wind down Xbox Entertainment Studios  a source familiar with its plans said  becoming the first major tech company to give up on making original shows in a battle for the living room couch.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft starts taking EU 'right to be forgotten' requests
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Wednesday started taking requests from individuals in Europe who want to be removed from its Bing search engine results following a court judgment in May guaranteeing the "right to be forgotten."

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft expected to announce job cuts this week: Bloomberg
article: Microsoft Corp is planning its biggest round of job cuts in five years as the software maker looks to integrate Nokia Oyj's handset unit  Bloomberg reported  citing people with knowledge of the company's plans.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says cybercrime bust frees 4.7 million infected PCs
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp said it has freed at least 4.7 million infected personal computers from control of cyber crooks in its most successful digital crime-busting operation  which interrupted service at an Internet-services firm last week.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft drops lawsuit against Vitalwerks after service cuts
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp has dropped a lawsuit against Vitalwerks Internet Solutions that alleged the privately held Web services firm failed to take proper steps to prevent its systems from being abused by cybercriminals.
