headline: RPT--Microsoft sides with Qualcomm in showdown over connected home
article: (Repeats article originally sent on July 1 with no changes to text.)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says disrupts cybercrime rings with roots in Kuwait  Algeria
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp  launched what it hopes will be the most successful private effort to date to crack down on cyber crime by moving to disrupt communications channels between hackers and infected PCs.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Couchbase raises $60 mln to compete against Oracle  Microsoft
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 26 Couchbase  a company that helps companies deal with the vast troves of data scattered around the Internet  said on Thursday it raised $60 million  further enabling it take on incumbents such as Oracle Corp  and Microsoft Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: InterDigital patents not violated by two phone makers: judge
article: WASHINGTON Handsets made by ZTE Corp and Nokia  now owned by Microsoft Corp  do not violate InterDigital Inc's patents for wireless phones  a U.S. International Trade Commission judge said in a preliminary ruling released on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to cooperate with Qihoo 360 amid security concerns in China: Xinhua
article: BEIJING Microsoft Corp  will work with Chinese Internet security specialist Qihoo 360 Technology Co  on mobile Internet and artificial intelligence technology  state media reported  as the U.S. software giant fights security concerns in the country.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Sterling suit against NBA holds up Clippers' sale  commissioner says
article: SAN ANTONIO Texas National Basketball Association Commissioner Adam Silver said on Sunday a single obstacle blocked completion of the $2-billion sale of the Los Angeles Clippers - a lawsuit brought by embattled owner Donald Sterling against the league.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Gates Foundation sells stake in Britain's G4S
article: LONDON Microsoft Corp  co-founder Bill Gates has sold his entire stake in G4S Plc   the British security firm trying to bounce back from a series of scandals that have hurt its reputation and profits.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: China state media calls for 'severe punishment' for Google  Apple  U.S. tech firms
article: BEIJING Chinese state media lashed out at Google Inc GOOGL.O  Apple Inc AAPL.O and other U.S. technology companies on Wednesday  calling on Beijing "to punish severely the pawns" of the U.S. government for monitoring China and stealing secrets. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: NBA's Clippers defy gravity with team's record sale price
article: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer's record $2 billion deal to buy the Los Angeles Clippers shows that star forward Blake Griffin and his monster slam dunks aren't the only things that defy gravity.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ex-Microsoft CEO Ballmer to buy NBA's LA Clippers for $2 billion: source
article: LOS ANGELES Former Microsoft Corp chief executive Steve Ballmer has won the bidding for the NBA's Los Angeles Clippers franchise with a $2 billion offer  a source with knowledge of the bidding said on Thursday. Ballmer outbid two groups  one led by media mogul David Geffen that offered $1.6 billion and another from Los Angeles investors who bid $1.2 billion. An official representing Ballmer had no immediate comment.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft shows off real-time Skype translator
article: RANCHO PALOS VERDES Calif. Microsoft Corp showed off a test version of a real-time  spoken-word translation service for Skype calls on Tuesday  the first time the world's largest software company has demonstrated the breakthrough technology publicly in the United States.

headline: Now the hard part: Microsoft CEO touts new Surface tablets

headline: Bill Gates on track to own no Microsoft stock in four years
article: SEATTLE Bill Gates  the former chief executive and chairman of Microsoft Corp  will have no direct ownership in the company he co-founded by mid-2018 if he keeps up his recent share sales.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft rescues XP users with emergency browser fix
article: BOSTON Microsoft is helping the estimated hundreds of millions of customers still running Windows XP  which it stopped supporting earlier this month  by providing an emergency update to fix a critical bug in its Internet Explorer browser.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft's Xbox One console to go on sale in China in September
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp will begin selling its Xbox One video game console in China in September through its partnership with Chinese Internet TV company BesTV New Media Co  the company said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft raises cloud pitch  targets Dropbox  Box
article: April 28 Microsoft Corp said it will increase its cloud storage offering for business users by 40-fold as the world's largest software company makes a case for businesses buying an all-in-one product from itself rather than buying technology "piecemeal" from multiple sellers.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S.  UK advise avoiding Internet Explorer until bug fixed
article: BOSTON The U.S. and UK governments on Monday advised computer users to consider using alternatives to Microsoft Corp's Internet Explorer browser until the company fixes a security flaw that hackers used to launch attacks.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp is rushing to fix a bug in its widely used Internet Explorer web browser after a computer security firm disclosed the flaw over the weekend  saying hackers have already exploited it in attacks on some U.S. companies.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Wall Street trips as Amazon tumbles; indexes slip for week
article: NEW YORK U.S. stocks dropped on Friday  pulled lower by a selloff in consumer discretionary stocks as bellwether names Amazon.com and Ford Motor fell in the wake of their quarterly earnings. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft beats Wall Street on new CEO debut
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's  new chief executive got off to a winning start with Wall Street on Thursday as the world's largest software company eased past analysts' profit estimates despite the pressure of falling computer sales. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: NEW YORK Hedge fund manager Jeffrey Ubben  whose firm ValueAct sits on the board of Valeant Pharmaceuticals  said on Tuesday that the hedge fund will not seek reelection on the board in order to devote its time on Microsoft Corp's board.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: SEATTLE The lead money manager for Microsoft Corp co-founder Paul Allen is leaving his post this week  marking the latest in a round of high-level departures at the Seattle billionaire's Vulcan Inc organization  which handles his $16 billion fortune.

article: (Refiles to remove extraneous word URGENT from the headline)

article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's board faces a lawsuit over the way it handled an error with its Internet Explorer browser that ended up costing the company a record-breaking $731 million fine by European antitrust regulators.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft ends Windows XP support  hackers may be lurking
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp released its final security updates for Windows XP and Office 2003 on Tuesday as security experts warned users that they could soon be prime targets for cyber attacks if they do not abandon the products.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Bill Gates wants China to encourage wealthy Chinese to be more giving
article: SINGAPORE China should do more to encourage wealthy Chinese to donate to charitable causes and to make philanthropy a common practice in the world's most populous country  Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates said on Sunday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to offer Windows for free on phones  tablets
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp is to give away its Windows operating system to makers of smartphones and small tablets for consumers as it seeks to make more of an impact on those fast-growing markets and counter the massive success of Google Inc's free Android platform.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft's Nadella reshuffles senior ranks
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp on Monday named three executives to its cloud  devices and Xbox gaming divisions in one of new Chief Executive Satya Nadella's first management shakeups.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft beefs up customer privacy policy
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  under fire for accessing an employee's private Hotmail account to prove he was leaking computer code to a blogger  has said it will now refer all suspicions of illegal activity on its email services to law enforcement.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft CEO signals new course with Office for iPad
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp's new Chief Executive Officer  Satya Nadella  finally unveiled Office for Apple Inc's iPad in a polished debut that set him apart from his energetic predecessor while signaling his plans to make mobile apps the top priority at the world's largest software company.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Dell seal Android  Chrome royalty pact
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp and Dell Inc have sealed a patent licensing deal under which Dell will pay the software giant royalties on sales of devices powered by Google Inc's Android or Chrome software.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Google slashes cloud computing prices in rivalry with Amazon
article: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc slashed its cloud computing service prices on Tuesday  seeking to wrest customers from Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp in the fast-growing market of renting computers and data storage to companies.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft deal delay may mean more Nokia patent concessions
article: HELSINKI Nokia does not expect to close the sale of its phone business to Microsoft until April as talks with Asian regulators drag on  it said on Monday  fuelling speculation it may have to make technology patent concessions to get the deal done.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Seagate chief Luczo leaves Microsoft board
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Thursday Steve Luczo stepped down from its board of directors so he can focus on his job as chief executive of digital storage company Seagate Technology Plc.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: GLOBAL MARKETS-Shares up on eased Crimea tensions; bond yields edge lower
article: NEW YORK  March 18 Major world equity markets rose on Tuesday after comments from Russian President Vladimir Putin soothed anxiety that tensions over Ukraine could escalate  while U.S. Treasuries yields edged lower ahead of the Federal Reserve's policy decision.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT-UPDATE 1-Microsoft's CEO may unveil Office for iPad on March 27 -source
article: March 17 Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Satya Nadella may unveil an iPad version of the company's Office software suite on March 27  a source familiar with the event told Reuters  and use his first big press appearance to launch the company's most profitable product in a version compatible with Apple Inc's popular tablet.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Indian court rejects Nokia appeal over asset transfer to Microsoft
article: NEW DELHI India's Supreme Court on Friday ordered Nokia to give a 35 billion rupee ($572.5 million) guarantee before it transfers one of its biggest handset plants to Microsoft Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: STXNEWS LATAM-Microsoft  Espírito Santo set up Brazil fund for start-ups
article: The venture capital units of Microsoft Corp and Portugal's Espírito Santo Investment Bank launched a fund to promote investments in Brazilian start-ups  according to a statement on Thursday. Other partners in the fund  named as Brasil Aceleradora de Start-ups FIP  include Qualcomm Inc's  venture capital investment unit  and AgeRio. The fund expects to raise up to 300 million reais ($127 million) from investors and focus on research and development in education  oil and gas  aerospace  sports  fa

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft appoints activist investor Mason Morfit to board
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it appointed Mason Morfit  president of activist investor ValueAct Capital  as a board member.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. engine maker backed by Bill Gates forms second China venture
article: DETROIT EcoMotors  a Michigan-based engine maker backed by Microsoft founder Bill Gates and venture capitalist Vinod Khosla  has formed a joint venture in China with a subsidiary of First Auto Works.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Fitch Maintains Nokia's 'BB-' Ratings on Rating Watch Positive
article: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON  March 04 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has maintained Nokia Corporation's  (Nokia) 'BB-' Issuer Default Rating (IDR) and senior unsecured ratings on Rating  Watch Positive (RWP)  pending the closing of the disposal of Nokia's Devices &  Services (D&S) activities to Microsoft Corporation (AA+/Stable). Fitch placed Nokia on RWP at the time of the disposal announcement in September  2013. Nokia continues to guide to a transaction close in

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft makes pollster Penn head of strategy  exact role unclear
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Monday put pugnacious pollster and political adviser Mark Penn in charge of strategy but left company watchers uncertain what exactly his new role will entail.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Two Microsoft executives to leave company -report
article: March 2 Two Microsoft Corp executives  Tony Bates and Tami Reller  are preparing to leave the company as Satya Nadella takes over as chief executive  according to a media report.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: France's Orange talks to Microsoft over Dailymotion tie-up
article: PARIS Orange said on Tuesday it was in talks with Microsoft over a possible tie-up with its video-sharing website Dailymotion  nearly a year after discussions with Yahoo collapsed following state opposition.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft resets Windows Phone to reach lower cost markets
article: BARCELONA  Feb 23 Microsoft Corp is pushing to reach a far wider audience for smartphones running its Windows Phone software by turning to cheaper chipsets and easing restrictions on how phone makers use its software to encourage them to drive down costs.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to cut manufacturer price for Windows by 70 percent: Bloomberg
article: CHICAGO Microsoft Corp is reducing the price of Windows 8.1 for manufacturers of low-cost computers and tablets by 70 percent to compete with cheaper products like Google Inc's Chromebooks  Bloomberg News reported on Saturday  citing sources familiar with the program.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft flaw used to attack French aerospace employees  veterans
article: SAN FRANCISCO A flaw in recent versions of Internet Explorer was used to attack visitors to a website for U.S. military veterans  and also appears to have been used earlier against French aerospace industry employees  researchers said Friday.

article: STOCKHOLM  Feb 14 Nokia Oyj :  * Comments on the tax dispute in India; has no effect on the timing or the

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft Windows 8 lags predecessor in first-year sales
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's Windows 8 system has racked up more than 200 million license sales since its launch 15 months ago  according to Tami Reller  its head of marketing  lagging Windows 7 which sold 240 million within its first year.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia renews legal battle in India to move assets to Microsoft
article: HELSINKI Nokia said on Wednesday it plans to challenge a Delhi High Court ruling that is blocking the transfer to Microsoft of assets related to its mobile phone business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia to unveil low-cost Android phone  report says
article: SEATTLE Nokia will unveil a low-cost smartphone running a version of Google Inc's Android operating system  despite the company's close partnership with Microsoft Corp and its competing Windows system  according to a report in the Wall Street Journal.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: COLUMN-The 20-year-old Microsoft memo that came true
article: Feb 7 About 20 years ago  Nathan Myhrvold  then Microsoft's chief technology officer  composed a 20 000-word piece of prophesy titled "Road Kill on the Information Highway" that reads as fresh today as it did then.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft hopes new  old leaders can rekindle magic
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is betting a mix of old and young blood will revive the aging technology pioneer  but new Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella may find it tough to push change with co-founder Bill Gates and former CEO Steve Ballmer breathing down his neck. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nadella outran better-known candidates for Microsoft CEO
article: NEW YORK/SEATTLE The race to determine the next head of Microsoft Corp looks to have ended where it began  with the software giant poised to take the route of least risk and tap rising internal star Satya Nadella for the job.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft board preparing to name Nadella as CEO: report
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's board is preparing to name internal executive Satya Nadella as the software company's next chief executive  Bloomberg reported on Thursday  citing unnamed sources it said were briefed on the CEO search process.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ericsson CEO Vestberg tells board he plans to stay: Bloomberg
article: STOCKHOLM Ericsson  CEO Hans Vestberg has told directors he has no plans to step down from the company following a report he is among candidates to take over from Microsoft Corp's  Steve Ballmer  Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St to open lower on emerging-market currency drop
article: NEW YORK  Jan 24 U.S. stocks were set for a lower open on Friday  in the wake of a selloff in emerging market assets  as expectations grew that the Federal Reserve will trim its market-friendly stimulus measures further next week.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft profit beats forecasts  no word on new CEO
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp posted a bigger-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday  boosted by strong sales of its Office software to businesses  a solid holiday season for its new Xbox game console and Surface tablets  and a slightly lower tax bill.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: What to Watch in The Day Ahead; Thursday  Jan. 23
article: Microsoft is expected to report higher second-quarter sales  but an 8 percent dip in profit as Windows 8  the Surface tablet and the new Xbox console had an unspectacular holiday shopping season. Investors will hope to hear more on the company's meandering search for a new chief executive  which most had expected to be completed by now  after Steve Ballmer's retirement plan was announced in August. The company will report results after market close.  The number of Americans filing new claims for

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Phone-free Nokia under pressure to boost network sales
article: HELSINKI Nokia is expected to show a steep fall in network equipment sales in its results this week  highlighting the challenge facing management after selling its once mighty handset division to Microsoft for 5.4 billion euros ($7.3 billion).

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nintendo heads for third consecutive annual loss as Wii U flops
article: TOKYO Nintendo Co Ltd said on Friday that sales of its Wii U consoles had flopped  pushing it to a third consecutive annual loss and raising a question mark over its future in a home console market increasingly dominated by Sony Corp and Microsoft Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft considers Ericsson CEO for top job: report
article: SAN FRANCISCO/STOCKHOLM Microsoft Corp is considering Ericsson Chief Executive Hans Vestberg as a possible successor to outgoing CEO Steve Ballmer  Bloomberg reported  citing sources briefed on the software giant's executive search.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Deezer in talks with Samsung  Dailymotion with Microsoft-paper
article: PARIS  Jan 12 French online music group Deezer is studying a commercial and industrial agreement with Korean electronics group Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  which might also take a stake in its capital  a French weekly said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft succession speculation focuses on internal candidates
article: SEATTLE/NEW YORK Speculation over Microsoft Corp's succession plans refocused on internal choices on Wednesday  a day after the leading outside candidate  Ford Motor Co CEO Alan Mulally  took himself off the list of potential CEOs at the world's largest software maker. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ford CEO not going to Microsoft  to stay at Ford through 2014
article: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  Chief Executive Alan Mulally will not take a job at software giant Microsoft Corp  and will remain at the U.S. automaker through at least this year  according to the Associated Press.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Xbox One sales top 3 million  no new Sony data
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Monday that sales of its new Xbox One game console topped three million at the end of last year after launching in November.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Billionaire Soros buys stake in Spanish builder FCC: source
article: MADRID Billionaire financier George Soros has bought a 3.1 percent stake in FCC   a source familiar with the matter said on Friday  in a further boost for the indebted Spanish builder already backed by Microsoft  founder Bill Gates.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia Solutions chairman to step down after Microsoft deal
article: HELSINKI Nokia said the chairman of its networking equipment unit  Nokia Solutions and Networks (NSN)  will step down following the sale of the Finnish company's mobile phone business to Microsoft.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen sells private island for $8 million
article: OLYMPIA  Washington Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen has sold a private island in northwestern Washington state to undisclosed buyers for $8 million  his real estate agent said on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ex-Microsoft manager and friend charged with insider trading
article: SEATTLE The U.S. Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission charged two Seattle men on Thursday with 35 counts of illegally trading on private Microsoft Corp  information  which prosecutors said netted the pair more than $390 000 in illicit profits over an 18-month period.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Former Microsoft executive named to oversee Obamacare website
article: WASHINGTON The Obama administration on Tuesday announced the appointment of a former Microsoft Corp executive to oversee its revamped HealthCare.gov website and expand on technology improvements achieved by the site's outgoing czar  Jeffrey Zients.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Qualcomm promotes Mollenkopf to CEO  ends Microsoft talk
article: SAN FRANCISCO Qualcomm Inc  the world's biggest maker of cellphone chips  unexpectedly named Chief Operating Officer Steve Mollenkopf as chief executive on Friday  heading off the possibility he might be poached to run Microsoft Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: TrueCar gets $30 million from Paul Allen's Vulcan Capital
article: TrueCar.com  a car pricing information website  said it received a $30 million investment from Microsoft Corp co-founder Paul Allen's Vulcan Capital.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Cisco loses court challenge to Microsoft's takeover of Skype
article: LUXEMBOURG Microsoft fended off a challenge to its $8.5 billion takeover of messaging service Skype as Europe's second-highest court ruled against claims by rival Cisco that the 2011 deal would harm competition.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: India court seeks value of Nokia factory seized in tax dispute
article: An Indian court extended a hearing over local tax authorities' seizure of a Nokia factory by seeking information on the plant value  adding to concerns whether the company can transfer the property to Microsoft as part of the sale of its mobile phone business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft leads disruption of largest infected global PC network
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 5 Microsoft Corp  said on Thursday it had disrupted the largest network of compromised personal computers  involving some 2 million machines around the world  since it stepped up its battle against organized online criminals three years ago.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft assures international business customers on spying
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp pledged late Wednesday to fight in court any attempt by U.S. intelligence agencies to seize its foreign business customers' data under American surveillance laws  one of a series of steps aimed at reassuring nervous users abroad.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: EU Commission approves Microsoft takeover of Nokia business
article: BRUSSELS European Union antitrust regulators have approved Microsoft's $7.3 billion acquisition of Nokia's mobile device business without conditions  the European Commission said on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Google takes on Amazon by cutting cloud service prices
article: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc will lower prices on cloud services as the search giant gears up to take on Amazon.com Inc  International Business Machines Corp and Microsoft Corp in the fast-growing market of Internet services for corporations.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. approves Microsoft purchase of Nokia's mobile business
article: WASHINGTON U.S. antitrust regulators have approved Microsoft Corp's deal to buy Nokia Corp's mobile phone business  the Federal Trade Commission said on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft blocks censorship of Skype in China: advocacy group
article: BEIJING Microsoft Corp. has made it harder to monitor calls and chats over its Skype phone service in China  a freedom of expression advocacy group said  as the Chinese government steps up censorship of the Internet.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sells over a million Xbox Ones in under 24 hours
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp sold over 1 million of its new Xbox One game consoles within 24 hours of their hitting store shelves on Friday  on par with Sony Corp's PlayStation 4 despite launching in far more countries. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to win EU okay for $7.3 billion Nokia deal: sources
article: BRUSSELS Microsoft is set to secure unconditional EU regulatory approval for its proposed 5.4-billion-euro ($7.30 billion) takeover of Nokia's mobile phone business  two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft sues Acacia over smartphone patents
article: Microsoft Corp filed a lawsuit against Acacia Research Corp on Wednesday  charging that Acacia broke a contract to license various smartphone and mobile computing technologies to Microsoft.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft's Gates highlights tough requirements for new CEO
article: BELLEVUE  Washington Chairman Bill Gates said on Tuesday he was pleased with Microsoft Corp's progress in finding a new chief executive but outlined the difficulties in picking the next leader of the world's largest software company as it seeks to reinvent itself as a mobile computing power.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Google  Microsoft tighten online searches to combat child porn
article: LONDON Web search giants Google and Microsoft said on Monday they will block online searches for child abuse images.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Bill Gates wants Norway's $800 billion fund to spend more in Africa  Asia
article: OSLO Philanthropist and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates called on Norway's $800 billion oil fund  one of the biggest investors in the world  to spend more in the poorest countries  gaining the prime minister's support with his proposal.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Spy scandal weighs on U.S. tech firms in China  Cisco takes hit
article: SINGAPORE U.S. technology companies including Cisco Systems Inc  International Business Machines Corp and Microsoft Corp may face new challenges selling their goods and services in China as fallout from the U.S. spying scandal starts to take a toll.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: FEATURE-Africa's great "white spaces": tech's new frontier
article: * Microsoft  Google running tests in three African countries

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: BlackBerry board rejected proposals to break up company - sources
article: NEW YORK/TORONTO BlackBerry Ltd's board does not believe a break-up of the Canadian smartphone maker is currently in its best interests  even though Microsoft Corp  Apple Inc and Lenovo Group Ltd  among others  have expressed interest in acquiring parts of the company  according to people familiar with the discussions.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: S&P 500 suffers worst day since late August; Twitters surges
article: NEW YORK Frenzied buying in Twitter shares grabbed Wall Street's attention on Thursday  as the social media stock surged well above expectations  while major indexes fell  with the S&P 500 suffering its worst daily decline since August. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: REFILE-US STOCKS-Wall St mixed on European data  IPOs
article: * Indexes: Dow up 0.7 pct  S&P up 0.3 pct  Nasdaq down 0.3 pct

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft rushes out fix to prevent attacks on Office PCs
article: Microsoft Corp released an emergency software fix on Tuesday after it learned that hackers had exploited a previously undiscovered security flaw in its widely used Office software to infect the PCs of its customers with tainted Word documents.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Infineon suits to proceed in Canada  not ADM
article: OTTAWA Consumers may join class action lawsuits against Microsoft Corp and Infineon Technologies AG over allegations of unfair pricing for computer products  the Supreme Court of Canada ruled on Thursday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Highfields' short bet against Digital Realty Trust pays off
article: BOSTON  Oct 30 Digital Realty Trust is paying off big for Highfields Capital less than six months after the investor warned that the real estate trust would face more competition Microsoft  and Google.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. passes up firms' offers to help healthcare website: committee
article: WASHINGTON The Obama administration appears to have passed up offers from Amazon and Microsoft to help fix the federal government's troubled healthcare enrollment website  according to documents released on Tuesday by a Republican-led congressional investigating committee.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft shareholders advised to vote against director Thompson
article: SEATTLE Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis has recommended that Microsoft Corp shareholders vote against the re-election of lead independent director John Thompson  who is in charge of the company's efforts to find a new chief executive.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Record high on Wall Street lifts Asian spirits
article: SYDNEY Asian stocks got off to an encouraging start on Monday after strong results from the likes of Microsoft drove Wall Street to another record closing high  while the safe-haven yen slipped in thin early trade.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500 ends at record high  boosted by tech results
article: NEW YORK  Oct 25 The S&P 500 ended at another record high on Friday  boosted by gains in technology shares after strong results from Microsoft and Amazon.com.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft beats profit forecasts  shares jump
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp cruised past Wall Street's quarterly profit and revenue forecasts on Thursday  helped by strong sales of its Office and server software to businesses  sending its shares up more than 5 percent after hours.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Key House Republican presses tech companies on Obamacare glitches
article: WASHINGTON The Republican chairman of a key congressional oversight committee has asked Google  Microsoft and three other U.S. companies to provide details on their possible involvement in a "tech surge" aimed at fixing a website implementing President Barack Obama's signature healthcare law.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Yahoo sought to 'pause' search rollout with Microsoft
article: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Monday refused to let Yahoo Inc YHOO.O delay using Microsoft Corp's Bing search capabilities in Taiwan and Hong Kong  affirming an arbitrator's decision in favor of Microsoft.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ford's Mulally won't dismiss Boeing  Microsoft speculation
article: WUHAN  China Ford Motor Co  Chief Executive Alan Mulally repeatedly declined to dismiss reports that he was approached to run Microsoft Corp  and speculation that he may be in line for a leadership role at Boeing.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ubisoft shares slump after warning over games delay
article: * Due to launch alongside new consoles from Sony  Microsoft

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft awards hacking expert  repairs browser bug
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it is paying a well-known hacking expert more than $100 000 for finding security holes in its software  one of the largest such bounties awarded to date by a high-tech company.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Gates  Ballmer seek re-election to Microsoft board
article: SEATTLE Chairman Bill Gates and retiring Chief Executive Steve Ballmer are standing for re-election to Microsoft Corp's board of directors  despite recent moves by some investors to reduce their influence  according to the software company's annual proxy filing made public on Thursday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia's cheap smartphones drive Windows in Europe -research
article: FRANKFURT  Sept 30 Microsoft's Windows platform has reached a 9.2 percent share in the smartphone operating system (OS) market in key European markets  driven by Nokia's low and mid-range models  market research firm Kantar said on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Sony's PS4 tops Xbox One as gamers' holiday choice -Reuters/Ipsos poll
article: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 29 More U.S. shoppers prefer Sony Corp's upcoming PlayStation 4 than Microsoft Corp's Xbox One  according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll  as the industry's two leading videogame console makers prepare to do battle this holiday season.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: CEO Mulally 'focused' on setting Ford's long-term vision -exec
article: DETROIT  Sept 27 Ford Motor Co Chief Executive Alan Mulally  a turnaround expert who is being mentioned as a candidate for Microsoft Corp's top job  remains "absolutely focused" on crafting the No. 2 U.S. automaker's long-term strategy  a top executive said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Nokia weighs Alcatel tie-up after Microsoft deal - sources
article: NEW YORK/HELSINKI Nokia is discussing internally whether to approach French rival Alcatel-Lucent about a tie-up  part of the Finnish company's review of how it can grow after the planned sale of its handset business to Microsoft Corp  several people close to the matter said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft prepares to pay more to keep top executives during CEO search
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's board has authorized special stock awards to hold onto top executives as the world's largest software company searches for a new chief executive officer  according to a regulatory filing made public on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft revamps Surface tablets to challenge Apple
article: NEW YORK/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp unveiled faster  more powerful versions of its Surface tablet computer on Monday in an effort to boost poor sales of its flagship hardware product and mount a stronger challenge to Apple Inc's iPad.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: MARKET PULSE-Prosensa  Verenium  Cyclacel  Apple  Microsoft
article: (For more market insights  including options activity  click on  ; for the Day Ahead newsletter http://link.reuters.com/mex49s;  for the Morning News Call newsletter  http://link.reuters.com/nex49s)

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia's Elop in line for $25 mln after Microsoft deal
article: HELSINKI  Sept 19 Former Nokia boss Stephen Elop stands to receive around 18.8 million euros ($25 million) in "termination payments" if the company's shareholders agree to sell its handset business to Microsoft  Nokia said on Thursday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to unveil more TV projects for Xbox One entertainment hub
article: TOKYO Microsoft Corp will follow its Steven Spielberg collaboration with more television projects aimed at positioning its new Xbox games console as a home entertainment hub.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft rushes out software fix to prevent browser attacks
article: Microsoft Corp released an emergency software fix for Internet Explorer on Tuesday after hackers exploited a security flaw in the popular Web browser to attack an unknown number of users.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia delays phablet launch after Microsoft deal -source
article: Sept 16 Nokia has delayed the launch of a large-screen "phablet" device  originally planned for late September  following a deal to sell its handset business and license patents to Microsoft  a source said on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft axes freelancers  contract writers at MSN
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is laying off dozens of contract and freelance writers from its MSN news and entertainment portal as the giant software company seeks to reshape itself as a devices and services company.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Pandora names former Microsoft executive Brian McAndrews as CEO
article: Sept 11 Pandora Media Inc on Wednesday named former Microsoft Corp executive and venture capitalist Brian McAndrews as president  chairman and CEO.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Gates Foundation CEO to retire  no successor named
article: SEATTLE Jeff Raikes  the chief executive of Bill Gates' $38 billion philanthropy organization announced his retirement on Tuesday  without a successor being named.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Sony pins hopes for profit on PlayStation 4  sets February launch in Japan
article: TOKYO Sony Corp announced the Japanese release of its PlayStation 4 on Monday as the electronics maker braces for a console war with Microsoft Corp that could make or break the Japanese firm's struggle to return to profit.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Asha to Ashes: Microsoft's emerging market conundrum
article: SINGAPORE/NEW DELHI Microsoft Corp's acquisition of Nokia's handset business gives the software behemoth control of its main Windows smartphone partner  but leaves a question mark over the bigger business it has bought: Nokia's cheap and basic phones that still dominate emerging markets like India.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BRIEF-Ericsson closes acquisition of Microsoft Mediaroom
article: STOCKHOLM  Sept 5 ERICSSON :  * Ericsson closes acquisition of Microsoft Mediaroom

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Savior or slayer? Either way  Nokia's Elop a contender for Microsoft chief
article: SEATTLE/HELSINKI When a British bookmaker installed Stephen Elop as favorite to take over the soon-to-be-vacant CEO slot at Microsoft Corp last week  most tech observers laughed it off as a publicity stunt. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: INSIGHT-As Finland reels  Microsoft doubles down with Nokia phone deal
article: HELSINKI/SEATTLE  Sept 3 In an era when shiny new tech start-ups can be worth tens of billions of dollars  Microsoft's deal to acquire Nokia's mobile handset business for 5.44 billion euros ($7.2 billion) is a modest one from a strictly financial point of view.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft offers ValueAct president seat on board
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Friday offered a seat on its board to the president of ValueAct Capital Management  the activist fund manager that pressed for the ouster of Microsoft Chief Executive Steve Ballmer and wanted a say on the software giant's strategy after taking a $2 billion stake earlier this year.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft in talks to buy stake in start-up Foursquare: Bloomberg
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp is in talks with social networking company Foursquare about a possible investment  Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft: The insiders who could be CEO
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp has a stable of senior executives who could be contenders to succeed Chief Executive Steve Ballmer  even though outsiders have sparked the most discussion so far.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: In digital age games makers still feel need to meet and greet
article: * Wards off growing trend of companies holding own events

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft  Motorola set for second round of trial over patents
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp takes on Google's Motorola Mobility unit this week in the second of two landmark trials between the companies that delve into hot disputes over the patents behind smartphone and Internet technology.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: CEO Ballmer retires as Microsoft struggles to modernize
article: SEATTLE/NEW YORK Steve Ballmer  a passionate salesman who has been a central figure at Microsoft Corp for more than three decades  unexpectedly announced his retirement as chief executive on Friday  ending a controversial 13-year reign in which the world's largest software company lost its position as the dominant force in computing. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: GameStop boosts profit forecast on console outlook; stock jumps
article: GameStop Corp raised its 2013 earnings forecast on Thursday  counting on new consoles from Microsoft Corp and Sony Corp to boost holiday season spending on video games and reverse the sector's decline. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft offers ad-free Bing for the classroom to battle Google
article: SAN FRANCISCO The long-running rivalry between Microsoft Corp and Google Inc is turning into a schoolyard brawl.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Judge dismisses suit against AOL in patent sale to Microsoft
article: NEW YORK A federal judge on Monday dismissed a lawsuit accusing AOL Inc and some of its executives of fraud for repurchasing 14.8 million shares in 2011 without disclosing that the company would sell a $1 billion portfolio of patents to Microsoft Corp months later.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: U.S. judge in airline mega-merger once ran Microsoft case
article: WASHINGTON  Aug 14 The federal judge assigned to hear a lawsuit to block the latest U.S. airline mega-merger began her career as a prosecutor  oversaw the resolution of the Microsoft Corp antitrust case and for years presided over a secret surveillance court.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: ATK wins Orbital Sciences order for space transport vehicle
article: WASHINGTON Alliant Techsystems Inc  on Tuesday said it had won an order from Orbital Sciences Corp  to provide solid rocket motors for a new air-launched space transport system that is part of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen's latest venture.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-Plane in Connecticut crash was upside down  official says
article: MILFORD  Conn.  Aug 10 A plane flown by a retired Microsoft Corp. executive that crashed into a Connecticut neighborhood was upside down when it hit two houses  killing the pilot  his son and two young girls on the ground  officials said on Saturday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-Young victims of Conn. plane crash to be identified Saturday
article: MILFORD  Conn.  Aug 9 The mayor of East Haven  Connecticut  where four people died on Friday when a small plane piloted by a retired Microsoft Corp executive crashed into two houses  said the two youngest victims will likely be identified later on Saturday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St rebounds to end 3-day drop as Microsoft gains
article: * JPMorgan shares fall on mortgage-backed securities probe

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft losing money on Surface tablets
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's Surface tablets have yet to make any profit as sputtering sales have been eclipsed by advertising costs and an accounting charge  according to the software company's annual report.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft in talks with ValueAct over board seat - sources
article: NEW YORK/SEATTLE Members of Microsoft Corp's board have held talks with ValueAct Capital Management LP in recent days over the activist shareholder's demands to secure a seat on the company's board  two sources close to the matter said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft profit misses as Surface tablets languish; shares drop
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Thursday reported lower-than-expected quarterly earnings as slow personal computer sales ate into its Windows business and the company took an unexpected $900 million charge for its inventory of unsold Surface tablets. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft asks U.S. to let it disclose security requests
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it has written to the U.S. Attorney General to ask for more freedom to disclose how it handles requests for customer data from national security organizations.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ex-Microsoft executive  ex-McDonald's CEO join HP board
article: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Hewlett-Packard Co on Monday appointed three big-name directors  including former Microsoft Corp software chief Raymond Ozzie and former McDonald's Corp Chief Executive James Skinner  as the struggling PC maker searches for a chairman and addresses top-level stumbles of past years.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft pushes U.S. Customs to enforce phone import ban
article: WASHINGTON Microsoft Corp  which won a ban last year on importing some phones made by a Google Inc subsidiary  filed a motion in a U.S. court on Friday asking the U.S. Bureau of Customs and Border Protection to enforce the measure.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft aims to power mobile effort in major overhaul
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp launched its biggest internal overhaul in five years to streamline the development of products from Windows to tablets  hoping to catch nimbler rivals in mobile and cloud computing.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft reports hackings linked to report by Google researcher
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp said hackers have attacked some computers by exploiting a bug in Windows first disclosed two months ago by a Google Inc researcher  who came under fire at the time for publicizing the flaw without going to the software company first.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Zynga's new CEO to get pay package worth some $50 million
article: SAN FRANCISCO  July 3 Don Mattrick  the head of Microsoft Corp's Xbox business who will replace Zynga Inc founder Mark Pincus as chief executive next week  will get a hefty  largely stock-based compensation package of about $50 million in coming years  the company said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Zynga  seeking salvation  names Microsoft Xbox head as CEO
article: SAN FRANCISCO Zynga Inc's decision to bring in the head of Microsoft Corp's Xbox business to replace founder Mark Pincus is a bold stroke that was hailed on Wall Street  but it still leaves questions as to who is ultimately in charge at the troubled game-maker. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 5-Microsoft Xbox head named Zynga CEO
article: SAN FRANCISCO  July 1 Games publisher Zynga Inc  has replaced chief executive Mark Pincus with Don Mattrick  the Microsoft Corp executive who headed the critical Xbox business  Zynga announced on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft releases 'refined' Windows  revs up developers
article: SAN FRANCISCO/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp released a test version of its Windows 8.1 software on Wednesday  bringing back the "start" button and adding a host of features it hopes will appeal to users  while spurring developers into writing more applications for it.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to bring 'Age of Empires' to Apple  Android phones
article: SAN FRANCISCO/TOKYO Microsoft Corp will offer its popular "Age of Empires" game for Apple Inc's iPhone and other smartphones through a tie-up with Japan's KLab Inc  seeking to capture growth in a booming mobile game market.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Rivals Microsoft and Oracle team up on push into cloud
article: SAN FRANCISCO/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Monday it would support Oracle Corp software on its cloud-based platforms  a tie-up aimed at improving the rivals' chances against nimbler Web-based computing companies chipping away at their traditional businesses.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Ouya's $99 videogame console challenges pricier Xbox  PlayStation
article: SAN FRANCISCO Ouya's $99 Android videogame console goes on sale on Tuesday  the latest attempt by a growing crop of niche hardware makers to chip away at a market dominated by Sony Corp  Microsoft Corp and Nintendo Co Ltd.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft reverses position on Xbox One Internet  game sharing
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Wednesday that users of its forthcoming Xbox One game console will be able to play games offline without establishing an Internet connection  and will be able to lend or sell used disc-based games.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says it freed millions of computers from criminal botnet
article: BOSTON  June 18 Microsoft Corp said that an assault it led earlier this month on one of the world's biggest cyber crime rings has freed at least 2 million PCs infected with a virus believed to have been used to steal more than $500 million from bank accounts worldwide.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT-UPDATE 2-Web companies begin releasing surveillance info after deal with U.S.
article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 14 Facebook and Microsoft have struck agreements with the U.S. government to release limited information about the number of surveillance requests they receive  a modest victory for the companies as they struggle with the fallout from disclosures about a secret government data-collection program.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to open Windows stores within Best Buy
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said it would open 500 special stores within existing Best Buy Co Inc stores in the United States selling exclusively Windows-based tablets and computers and other Microsoft products in an effort to revitalize sales of its flagship operating system. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Facebook urges U.S. government to allow disclosure of security requests
article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc on Tuesday urged the U.S. government to allow Internet companies to reveal the size and scope of the national security information requests they receive  echoing statements made by Google Inc and Microsoft Corp.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Microsoft prices Xbox at $499 for November launch
article: LOS ANGELES  June 10 Microsoft Corp  said on Monday its new Xbox One console would launch in November at $499 in the United States  higher than most gamers had expected.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says not part of broad government online monitoring
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it provides customer data to the U.S. government only when it receives a legally binding order and only on specific accounts  after the Washington Post reported U.S. security agencies had access to its central servers.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: European cyber cop declares Microsoft's Citadel bust a success
article: AMSTERDAM/BOSTON Europol said a global effort led by Microsoft Corp to stop one of the world's biggest cybercrime rings has succeeded in wiping out the malicious computer networks that the gang used  known as the Citadel Botnets.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft  FBI take aim at global cyber crime ring
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp and the FBI  aided by authorities in more than 80 countries  have launched a major assault on one of the world's biggest cyber crime rings  believed to have stolen more than $500 million from bank accounts over the past 18 months.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to settle Vringo lawsuit over search-related patents
article: * Lawsuit focused on patents involving search engine advertising

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Cisco says Microsoft strengthened a monopoly with Skype deal
article: * Cisco asks Europe's second-highest court to annul EU decision

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Cisco challenges Microsoft buy of Skype in EU court
article: BRUSSELS Cisco Systems Inc  the world's leading network equipment maker  will try to convince Europe's second highest court on Wednesday that it should overturn the EU's approval of Microsoft's purchase of Skype.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: ITC says Microsoft did not violate Google patent
article: WASHINGTON Microsoft Corp won a round in a complex patent war on Thursday when the International Trade Commission said the company's popular Xbox entertainment system did not violate a patent owned by Google subsidiary Motorola Mobility.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft unveils Xbox One with Spielberg  Activision tie-up
article: REDMOND  Washington Microsoft Corp unveiled the "Xbox One" on Tuesday  its first new gaming console in eight years  and its strongest push so far to dominate consumers' living rooms with an array of exclusive media content.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to build Australian cloud computing centers
article: SYDNEY Microsoft Corp is expanding its services for hosting and processing online data in Australia with the establishment of two new "cloud" computing data centers in the country.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: New Xbox more than a game console for Microsoft
article: SAN FRANCISCO/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is set to make a splash this week with the eagerly awaited unveiling of its new Xbox game console  eight years after the last version  as it seeks a larger share of the $65 billion a year global computer gaming industry.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft unveils free Windows 8.1 update
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's forthcoming update to its personal computer operating system will be called Windows 8.1 and will be available later this year free to existing Windows 8 customers  the marketing chief for the Windows unit said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Barnes & Noble shares soar on Microsoft report
article: Shares in Barnes & Noble Inc soared 22 percent on Thursday after a report that Microsoft Corp is considering an offer to acquire the tablet and e-book business of B&N's Nook Media unit.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Obama administration weighs options for expanding wiretap laws
article: * FBI has long sought new policies to eavesdrop on Internet

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft extends Yahoo's U.S. search revenue guarantee
article: SAN FRANCISCO  May 7 Microsoft Corp  extended the revenue guarantee it provides to Yahoo Inc  in the companies' underperforming search partnership  Yahoo said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: STXNEWS LATAM-Microsoft announces departure of Brazil CEO
article: Microsoft Brasil  the local branch of Microsoft Corp  said on Monday its CEO in Brazil  Michel Levy  would step down this year after the fiscal year ends on June 30.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft goes mainstream to win phone share
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's phone chief hates to call the new Nokia Lumia 521 cheap  but the lower-priced smartphone launching in the United States is the company's boldest move yet to win mass market share from leaders Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft gets upper hand in first Google patent trial
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp came out on top in the first of two patent trials versus Google Inc's Motorola Mobility unit on Thursday  as a federal judge in Seattle ruled largely in its favor.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: US STOCKS-Wall St ends mostly flat  Procter  AT&T tumble
article: NEW YORK  April 24 The S&P 500 and Nasdaq ended flat on Wednesday with Boeing's five-year high among the day's highlights  but weakness in Procter & Gamble and AT&T kept the Dow in negative territory.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: ValueAct takes $2 billion Microsoft stake
article: Activist investor ValueAct Capital has taken a $2 billion stake in Microsoft Corp   according to ValueAct's chief executive  helping Microsoft shares climb to a seven-month high.

Left-wing separatists became the second largest force in Catalonia's parliament for the first time  while the less radical incumbent party lost seats. Projected turn-out was the highest for a Catalan regional election in over 30 years.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: The brave new world of tomorrow's tablets
article: SAN FRANCISCO Tablets with paper-thin screens that can be folded and tucked into your back pocket  artificial intelligence and augmented reality -- the stuff of science fiction may be coming to a store near you.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to buy display maker Perceptive Pixel
article: TORONTO Microsoft Corp will buy Perceptive Pixel Inc  a six-year-old developer of large touchscreen displays whose customers include cable network CNN  chief executive Steve Ballmer said on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Analysis: Microsoft loss reflects Web display ad world's woes
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp shelled out a record $6.3 billion for aQuantive in 2007 at the height of a race with Google Inc and Yahoo Inc to clinch the top spot in Internet display advertising  betting on what many thought was a red-hot business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Vivendi tests appetite for Activision - sources
article: LONDON  July 6 Vivendi  the French media-to-telecoms conglomerate  has started testing the appetite of possible bidders for its video game business Activision Blizzard  five sources close the situation said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft stumbles into crucial financial year
article: SEATTLE An ugly first week for Microsoft Corp's new financial year  probably its most important to date  has done little to inspire confidence that the software giant can jumpstart a stubbornly stagnant share price.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Wall Street gains for third day as stimulus hopes rise
article: NEW YORK U.S. stocks extended a rally for a third day on Tuesday as sharp gains in oil prices lifted energy shares and traders factored in increased expectations for central bank stimulus. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft takes $6.2 billion charge  slows Internet hopes
article: Microsoft Corp admitted its largest acquisition in the Internet sector was effectively worthless and wiped out any profit for the last quarter  as it announced a $6.2 billion charge to write down the value of an online advertising agency it bought five years ago.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft names new industry hardware chief
article: SEATTLE The Microsoft Corp  executive in charge of relations with PC makers is moving to a new job just two weeks after the software company broke with tradition by announcing it would manufacture a tablet computer  ruffling feathers of some hardware partners.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Trade panel remands Motorola Mobility case
article: WASHINGTON A U.S. trade panel has decided to defer a final ruling on a complaint filed by Google  unit Motorola Mobility accusing Microsoft  of infringing its patents to make its popular Xbox.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Gunmen ram van into Microsoft's Greek headquarters
article: ATHENS Gunmen rammed a van packed with gas canisters into Microsoft's  Greek headquarters in Athens and then set the vehicle on fire  causing damage but no injuries  police said on Wednesday. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: NORDIC STOCKS - Factors to watch on June 26
article: COPENHAGEN  June 26 The following stocks may be affected by newspaper reports and other factors on Tuesday:

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to buy Yammer for $1.2 billion
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp agreed to buy online social network firm Yammer Inc for $1.2 billion in cash  which will allow the software company to offer a service like Facebook Inc's to corporate customers.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft may be making own phone: analyst
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is looking at making its own smartphone to kickstart sales of its Windows mobile software  according to a Wall Street analyst who has followed the company for many years.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft brings phone software closer to Windows
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's new phone software will be built on the same core as its new upcoming PC and tablet operating system  bringing the company one step closer to unifying its Windows franchise across a full range of screens that are revolutionizing computing. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft tackles iPad with Surface tablet
article: LOS ANGELES Microsoft Corp introduced its own line of tablet computers on Monday at a much-hyped press event in Los Angeles  marking a major strategic shift for the software giant as it struggles to compete with Apple Inc and re-invent its aging Windows franchise. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft announces Surface tablet
article: LOS ANGELES Microsoft Corp unveiled a tablet called Surface on Monday  in a move to rival Apple Inc's massively successful iPad.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft nears deal to buy Yammer: source
article: Microsoft Corp is close to buying business software company Yammer Inc for more than $1 billion  according to a source familiar with the details.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Talk of Microsoft tablet resurfaces
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  is gearing up to unveil its own tablet to boost its new Windows 8 operating system and counter Apple Inc's  hot-selling iPad  according to media reports on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Timeline: Nokia's rocky road under Stephen Elop
article: Finnish phone maker Nokia said on Thursday it would cut 10 000 more jobs and sell its luxury handset unit Vertu  its latest move to slash costs as it loses market share and burns through cash.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Aging Microsoft lures young tech idealists
article: SEATTLE The young interns  some of the nation's best and brightest in technology  business and design  had plenty of enthusiastic words to describe their summer employer.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Insight: Google goes softly-softly on European antitrust
article: BRUSSELS Google is searching for the answer to a four-billion-dollar question: can a new  gentler approach from a U.S. tech giant persuade the European Union to be more lenient in competition cases?

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Hybrid "ultrabooks" blur line between tablets  laptops
article: TAIPEI Slide it  flip it or snap it on and off. The way keyboards are connected to touch screens on the latest generation of computing devices is making it tough to differentiate a tablet from notebook or an ultrabook.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Facebook  Microsoft said shopping Manhattan space
article: NEW YORK Facebook Inc  and Microsoft Corp  are shopping for more office space in Manhattan  sources say  underscoring New York's stature as a must-have location for top tech companies who need to be "book-ended" on both the west and east coasts.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Flame virus prompts Microsoft to boost Windows security
article: BOSTON Discovery of the Flame virus that mainly affected computers in the Middle East  has prompted Microsoft Corp to strengthen the security of a Windows program that helps customers secure their PCs and update software.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Flame exploits Windows bug to attack PCs
article: BOSTON Microsoft Corp warned that a bug in Windows allowed PCs across the Middle East to become infected with the Flame virus and released a software fix to fight the espionage tool that surfaced last week.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to defer revenue from Windows upgrade offer
article: Microsoft Corp said it will defer the $450 million to $550 million of revenue it expects to generate this quarter from an offer to upgrade to its new Windows 8 operating system.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Google accuses Microsoft  Nokia of mobile collusion
article: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc on Thursday accused Microsoft Corp and Nokia of conspiring to use their patents against smartphone industry rivals  and said it has filed a formal complaint with the European Commission.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: NBC may buy Microsoft's MSNBC.com stake
article: NBCUniversal is in talks to buy out Microsoft Corp's 50 percent stake in joint venture MSNBC.com  media reports said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft wins ruling against Motorola over texting
article: FRANKFURT A German regional court ruled in a hearing on Thursday that Motorola Mobility infringed Microsoft patents by offering the option on its mobile phones to send a longer text in a batch of several messages.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RCS to name Microsoft's Jovane as new CEO on Friday-sources
article: MILAN  May 23 Italian publisher RCS MediaGroup  will appoint Pietro Scott Jovane  head of the Italian unit of Microsoft  as chief executive at a board meeting on Friday  sources close to the situation told Reuters.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-US says will bar some Motorola Mobility phones
article: WASHINGTON  May 18 Some Motorola Mobility  smartphones infringe on a Microsoft patent and will be barred from importation to the United States  a U.S. trade panel said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Italy Microsoft head in pole for CEO position at RCS: sources
article: MILAN Pietro Scott Jovane  CEO of the Italian unit of Microsoft  was in pole position to take over as chief executive of Italian media company RCS MediaGroup  two sources close to the matter said on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Einhorn cuts stake in Microsoft
article: BOSTON A year ago hedge fund investor David Einhorn very publicly urged Microsoft to get rid of its chief executive. Now he has dramatically gotten rid of more than half of his stake in the huge software company.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Tepper's Appaloosa back into big banks  tech in first quarter
article: Famed hedge fund manager David Tepper piled into leading technology  financial and airline stocks in the first quarter.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft redesigns Bing  plays up Facebook link
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp unveiled a new design on Thursday for its second-ranked Bing search engine  introducing elements from Facebook and other social networks  as it tries to claw market share from leader Google Inc.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Digital River extends distribution deal with Microsoft
article: Digital River Inc  said it extended an e-commerce deal with Microsoft Corp   its largest customer  by five months to March 1  2014  sending its shares up 7 percent in afternoon trade.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: DEALTALK-Nokia's woes might call for Microsoft aid
article: * Microsoft more likely to provide liquidity for Nokia than buy it

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Dolby signs pact with Microsoft; shares jump
article: Audio technology licensor Dolby Labs Inc signed an agreement with Microsoft for the use of its products in the Windows 8 operating system  and posted a second-quarter profit that topped analysts' estimates.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: MARKET PULSE-US stocks to watch: Microsoft  Chesapeake  SMSC
article: A court in Mannheim ruled on Wednesday that Microsoft infringed Motorola Mobility's patents and ordered Microsoft to remove its Xbox 360 gaming consoles and Windows 7 operating system software from the German market.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft buys Nook stake  Barnes & Noble shares soar
article: NEW YORK/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is jumping into the fast-growing e-books market by investing $605 million over five years in Barnes & Noble Inc's Nook e-reader and college business  as it looks to unlock Amazon.com and Apple Inc's grip on the exploding tablet computer market. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - May 1
article: Microsoft is challenging Amazon and Apple  in the fast-growing ebook market with a $300 million investment in a new Barnes & Noble subsidiary that will give the software group its own stake in a digital bookstore for tablets  smartphones and PCs.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft infringes Motorola Mobility patents: ITC judge
article: WASHINGTON Microsoft infringed Motorola Mobility's patents in making its popular Xbox gaming consoles  a judge for the U.S. International Trade Commission ruled on Monday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: MARKET PULSE-US stocks to watch: Novo Nordisk  Microsoft  Schlumberger
article: The Danish drugmaker rejected a consumer advocacy group's complaint about its big-selling diabetes drug Victoza as groundless and said it did not expect U.S. regulators to take any action.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft beats Street profit view  shares up
article: Microsoft Corp beat Wall Street's profit forecast as personal computer sales held up better than expected  lifting its shares 2.5 percent after hours.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Mali names Microsoft Africa chief as interim PM
article: BAMAKO Mali authorities have named Cheick Modibo Diarra  Microsoft Corp's chairman for Africa  as interim prime minister charged with helping to restore civilian rule to the West African country after last month's coup.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Astounding Seattle TRO ruling could remake smartphone wars
article: With a single ruling this week  U.S. District Judge James Robart of Seattle federal court may have fundamentally altered the balance of power between Motorola Mobility and the leading opponents of Motorola's soon-to-be-parent Google  Microsoft and Apple.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft wins its biggest cloud computing client
article: LONDON Microsoft announced its biggest-ever customer for cloud computing - software that it hosts on behalf of clients and delivers over the Internet - after winning a contract to provide free services to a major Indian education body.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia flagship smartphone's materials cost $209-IHS
article: April 11 Materials of Nokia's new flagship model smartphone  the Lumia 900  cost $209  some 46 percent of its retail price  with the Finnish firm saving on processor and memory cost  teardown analysis of research firm IHS iSuppli showed on Wednesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft to struggle vs. Apple  Google in tablets
article: Microsoft's push into the tablet industry will see only limited success  with the U.S. software maker remaining a distant No. 3 behind Apple and Google  research firm Gartner said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft trumps Amazon  others for AOL patents
article: Microsoft trumped Amazon  eBay and other tech giants with its more than $1 billion purchase of the majority of AOL Inc's patent trove. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: EU probes Motorola after Microsoft  Apple complaints
article: BRUSSELS EU regulators are investigating whether phone maker Motorola Mobility  breached antitrust rules by allegedly over-charging Microsoft  and Apple  for use of its patents in their products  the European Commission said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: MUNICH/AMSTERDAM Microsoft  is moving its European software distribution to the Netherlands from Germany after being caught up in patent disputes with mobile phone and tablet maker Motorola Mobility Inc .

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators may open an investigation into a patent dispute between Apple Inc   Microsoft Corp  and Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc  to ensure patent holders do not thwart rivals  the EU's antitrust chief said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 4-Nokia seeks to retake China market share
article: BEIJING/HELSINKI  March 28 Nokia will start to sell smartphones using Microsoft software in China from April  seeking to claw back market share gobbled up by Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft seizes servers in Zeus cyberfraud
article: Microsoft Corp claimed a victory in efforts to combat online banking fraud  saying it had confiscated several servers used to steal login names and passwords  disrupting some of the world's most sophisticated cybercrime rings.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Rovio working on Angry Birds Space for WP -CEO
article: HELSINKI  March 23 Finnish gaming firm Rovio is working on getting its new Angry Birds Space game to Microsoft's  Windows Phone 7 platform (WP7)  its chief executive said on Friday  dismissing earlier media reports which said the top gaming firm was dumping the platform.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Paul Allen gives $300 million to expand brain research

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: Sales of smartphones with Microsoft Windows software have surpassed those using Nokia's old Symbian system in Britain  research showed on Tuesday  a sign of progress in Nokia's switch to Microsoft software.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says hacking code could have leaked

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Former top Microsoft exec says world is over the PC
article: * Ray Ozzie succeeded Bill Gates as Microsoft's tech visionary

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Intel launches high-end server chip for the cloud
article: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp took the wraps off its newest "Xeon" server chip on Tuesday  seeking to capitalize on an explosion of Internet traffic sparked by Web-based cloud computing  social networking and growing smartphone and tablet computer use.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Activision Blizzard names Microsoft exec as CFO
article: March 5 Activision Blizzard Inc  named a former senior Microsoft Corp executive as chief financial officer on Monday  luring an industry veteran who was instrumental in making the Xbox 360 the market's best-selling game console.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-Businesses urge UK to re-think Heathrow runway plans
article: * Businesses send letter to gov't about Heathrow expansion

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-US trade panel to review Microsoft  Motorola decision
article: WASHINGTON  March 2 A U.S. trade panel  which hears patent infringement cases  said on Friday that it would undertake a wide-ranging review of its preliminary decision over whether Motorola Mobility violated Microsoft patents.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Trade panel to rethink Microsoft  Motorola decision
article: WASHINGTON A U.S. trade panel which hears patent infringement cases said on Friday that it would undertake a wide-ranging review of its preliminary decision over whether Motorola Mobility violated Microsoft patents.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: FEATURE-The battle's on for control of the video dial tone
article: NEW YORK  Feb 29 Cisco Systems Inc's  attempt to convince a European court to impose tougher conditions on Microsoft Corp's acquisition of Skype signals that technology companies are gearing up to battle for control of what some say is the next big thing: videoconferencing.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: BRUSSELS Microsoft and several other companies have complained to EU antitrust regulators about Google's social networking tool  two people familiar with the matter said  but they declined to provide the names of the other firms involved.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 2-Nokia unveils cheaper Windows smartphone
article: BARCELONA  Feb 27 Nokia  unveiled a new  cheaper smartphone using Microsoft's  Windows Phone software on Monday  in an attempt to reverse its declining market share.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft rally brings likely hedges against sharp reversal
article: Investors worried about a big drop in Microsoft shares over the next few weeks appear to be picking up insurance in the software giant.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft files EU complaint over Google  Motorola
article: BRUSSELS/NEW YORK Microsoft Corp has asked EU antitrust regulators to intervene in a patent dispute with Google Inc and Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc as it stepped up its battle against Google.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: LONDON Twitter and Russian search engine Yandex have agreed a partnership that will allow Yandex to show new tweets in its search results almost instantly  as Twitter becomes an increasingly important source of real-time information.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Intellectual Ventures sues three U.S. mobile telcos
article: Feb 16  Intellectual Ventures  a privately held patent holding company co-founded by a former Microsoft Corp  executive  sued three of the four top U.S. mobile providers for patent infringement.

name: Microsoft Corporation
