article: Cisco Systems Inc has challenged EU clearance of Microsoft Corp's acquisition of Internet voice and video service Skype at Europe's second highest court  saying the commission should have put tougher conditions on the deal.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Timeline: Nokia's rocky road under Elop
article: Struggling Finnish phone maker Nokia said on Wednesday it would cut 4 000 extra jobs and move more smartphone assembly work to Asia  its latest move to slash costs.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT-As Facebook grows up  it courts Madison Avenue
article: Feb 5 About a year ago  when it became clear that taking Facebook Inc public was a matter of when not if  Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg went out and poached Caroline Everson  then global advertising head at Microsoft Corp .

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: TiVo shares appear to be discounted-Barron's
article: Feb 5 TiVo Inc is trading at a compelling discount and could be a possible acquisition target by Microsoft or Google  Barron's financial newspaper reported on Sunday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Nokia profits dive as new phones slow to take off
article: HELSINKI Nokia Oyj reported a 73 percent fall in fourth-quarter earnings as sales of its new Windows Phones failed to dent the dominance of Apple Inc's iPhone or compensate for diving sales of its own old smartphones. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang resigns
article: SAN FRANCISCO Yahoo Inc co-founder Jerry Yang has quit the Internet company he started in 1995  potentially appeasing shareholders who had blasted the Internet pioneer for impeding efforts to revive the struggling Web company.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is starting the new year much as it did the one just ended - grappling with weak computer sales tearing a hole in its core Windows business  while it gropes its way slowly into the faster-growing mobile phone and tablet markets.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft Web TV subscription plan on hold

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: HELSINKI  Jan 3 Finnish IT-services supplier Ixonos aims to cut up to 150 jobs after demand from key client Nokia dropped following the handset maker's decision to shift to Microsoft  software  Ixonos said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: BUY OR SELL-New Nokia smartphone no game changer
article: HELSINKI  Dec 21 Nokia's long-awaited Windows phones may be too little  too late in the smartphone war and investment in the shares will increasingly be driven by takeover speculation.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says ITC judge finds against Motorola
article: WASHINGTON A trade panel judge ruled that Motorola Mobility infringed Microsoft's patented technology in making its Android cellphones  Microsoft said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Silver Lake  Microsoft working on new Yahoo stake offer: source
article: A consortium of private equity group Silver Lake  software giant Microsoft Corp and venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz are reworking their bid for a minority stake in Internet company Yahoo Inc  a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp co-founder Paul Allen is planning to build a spaceship that could replace the Space Shuttle and put paying passengers into orbit this decade.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft appoints new head of phone group
article: Microsoft Corp appointed a new head for its mobile phone software group on Monday  as the company continues to search for ways to extend its dominance in the PC market to the fast-growing and highly-competitive smartphone business.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft says opens new centre in India
article: Dec 8 Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it has opened a new global delivery centre in southern Indian city of Bangalore to support its clients in more than 65 countries.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: Dec 1 Google Inc's Chrome internet browser overtook Firefox for the first time globally in November and it continues to narrow the gap to market leader Microsoft Corp's Internet Explorer  web analytics firm StatCounter said on Thursday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: PE firm eyes buyout for Yahoo's U.S. business
article: NEW YORK Thomas H. Lee Partners is interested in buying the U.S. operations of Yahoo Inc  breaking away from other bidders that are for now eyeing either a minority stake or teaming up with the Internet giant's partners in Asia  sources familiar with the matter said.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft signs confidentiality pact with Yahoo
article: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp has signed a confidentiality agreement with Yahoo Inc  allowing the software giant to take a closer look at Yahoo's business  according to a source familiar with the matter.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Video game deals to steal Black Friday spotlight
article: Retailers are saving some of their deepest discounts on Black Friday for video game products  with large chains Wal-Mart and Best Buy putting some rock-bottom prices tags on hot games to lure shoppers into stores.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Shareholders reduce support for Microsoft CEO
article: SEATTLE  Nov 17 Microsoft Corp Chief Executive is slightly less popular with shareholders than he was last year  despite notching record profits in the past 12 months.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Newsmaker: "Italian Prussian" Monti sworn in as premier
article: ROME Mario Monti  the economist sworn in on Wednesday as Italy's prime minister  brings credentials from a decade as a European commissioner that his technocrat government will need as it faces a financial crisis threatening to spin out of control.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft shareholders grumble at brief annual meet
article: BELLEVUE  Washington Microsoft Corp shareholders filed out of the software giant's annual meeting grumbling that they did not get to ask more questions in their once-a-year opportunity to quiz Chairman Bill Gates and CEO Steve Ballmer.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Amazon  Microsoft catch on  BlackBerry falls-survey
article: Amazon.com's Kindle Fire tablet and Microsoft's efforts to get back into the mobile game have impressed developers  a survey released on Monday showed  while BlackBerry maker Research In Motion fell further behind.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Italian Prussian Monti enters political storm
article: ROME Mario Monti  the economist who will head an emergency Italian government following the departure of Silvio Berlusconi  brings credentials earned in a decade of battles as a European Commissioner from the 1990s.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: UPDATE 1-KKR  TPG mull minority stakes in Yahoo -- sources
article: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO  Nov 11 Private equity firms  including KKR and Co LP and TPG Capital LP  are looking to potentially buy minority stakes of up to 20 percent in Yahoo Inc with an eye to eventually taking over the whole company  people with knowledge of the situation said.

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: CANNES  France Billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates told G20 leaders Thursday to protect aid budgets  saying cuts would not only hurt the poor but also undermine innovations in areas such as health and farming.

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: Microsoft will double its share of the Western European smartphone market during 2012 to 12.3 percent  helped by its new partnership with Finland's Nokia  research firm Strategy Analytics said on Tuesday.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Feeble Windows holds back Microsoft profit
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp's flagship operating system made only slight gains last quarter  largely due to business and emerging market spending  holding back profit growth for the world's largest software company.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Bidders balk at Yahoo's "no cross talk" provision: sources
article: NEW YORK Some potential buyers of Yahoo Inc are balking at the Internet company's demands for confidentiality that would prevent them from discussing joint bids  according to several people close to the situation.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: PREVIEW-Cloud spending helps techs as PC sales stagger
article: Oct 14 Big U.S. Internet computing companies should outshine their plainer PC cousins when earnings season kicks off next week  as corporations and fast-growing Web players dramatically accelerate their pace of hardware spending.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: RPT-UPDATE 2-Romney sharpens attack on China's economic policies
article: SEATTLE  Oct 13 U.S. Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney on Thursday threatened trade sanctions against China if the world's No. 2 economy does not halt what he said was currency manipulation  unfair subsidies and rampant intellectual property theft.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft competitor Box lands $81 million funding
article: SAN FRANCISCO Business-software company Box has won $81 million in funding to expand its business  illustrating investors' continued appreciation for start-up companies that tap into the cloud.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: EU mergers and takeovers (Oct 10)
article: BRUSSELS  Oct 10 The following are mergers under review by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EU merger process:

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: EU clears Microsoft's Skype acquisition
article: BRUSSELS Microsoft secured EU approval on Friday to purchase internet voice and video service Skype for $8.5 billion  its biggest ever acquisition.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Jobs authorized biography so his kids can know him
article: CUPERTINO  Calif./SAN FRANCISCO Steve Jobs  in pain and too weak to climb stairs a few weeks before his death  wanted his children to understand why he wasn't always there for them  according to the author of his highly anticipated biography. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Exclusive: Microsoft considers bidding for Yahoo
article: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp is considering a bid for Yahoo Inc  resurfacing as a potential buyer after a bitter and unsuccessful fight to take over the Internet company in 2008  sources close to the situation said on Wednesday. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation

article: LONDON Few organizations have moved to cloud computing -- the delivery of computing as a service from remote centers -- and of those that have  many are disappointed with the results  a survey published on Tuesday found.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Microsoft CEO bonus lags on phone  tablet results
article: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Steve Ballmer failed to clinch his maximum bonus for the second year running due to the company's slow progress in mobile phones and adapting to the tablet computer revolution.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Netflix shares fall as competition heats up
article: LOS ANGELES Netflix Inc  shares slumped 11 percent on Thursday as competitors made moves to attract more customers with alternative options for movie and television content.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: Stocks drop  led by commodities on economic fear
article: NEW YORK Commodity-related stocks drove Wall Street lower on Wednesday as stiff declines in energy and metals prices underscored investor concerns about global economic weakness and Europe's raging debt crisis. | Video

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: PRESS DIGEST-Australian Business News - Sept 28
article: SYDNEY  Sept 28 Compiled for Reuters by Media Monitors. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: After Facebook event  a dot-com boom-scaled party
article: SAN FRANCISCO When somebody who has been played by Justin Timberlake in a Hollywood movie decides to throw a party  the expectations are pretty high.

name: Microsoft Corporation
headline: HP names Whitman CEO  Apotheker out
article: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard Co named former eBay Inc Chief Executive Meg Whitman its president and CEO  replacing the harshly criticized Leo Apotheker in a bid to restore investor confidence in the U.S. technology company.

name: Netflix Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Netflix cash-flow hole is becoming a moat
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Netflix is pouring money into what is fast becoming a formidable competitive moat. The $95 billion video-streaming service run by Reed Hastings ended 2017 with negative free cash flow of $2 billion  based on figures released on Monday. Even so  it probably has more subscribers than rivals Hulu and Amazon combined. A hefty content budget is a risk  but ensures only the most deep-pocketed media firms can take Netflix on.

name: Netflix Inc
headline: Breakingviews - Netflix valuation outstrips burgeoning opportunity
article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Netflix's valuation outstrips its burgeoning opportunity. The $87 billion video-streaming service hit another all-time high on Monday  benefiting in part from Comcast and AT&T recently warning of a fall in subscribers. Pay-TV customers cutting the cord should mean more viewers for Netflix. But even that and a fee hike last month don’t justify it trading at a sky-high multiple.

headline: Fitch Assigns 'F2' Short-Term Rating to NVIDIA
article: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  December 19 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'F2' Short-Term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) and commercial paper (CP) rating to NVIDIA Corporation following the company's authorization of a $575 million CP program. The facility will be fully back-stopped by NVIDIA'S $575 million revolving credit facility (RCF) expiring 2021. Fitch upgraded NVIDIA's Long-Term ratings to 'A-' from 'BBB+' on Dec. 15  2017. The Rating Outlook is

article: Shares of Nvidia Corp  hit a record on Friday  after it posted stellar quarterly results powered by higher demand for graphics chips used in gaming and data centers  and the rapid adoption of its new Volta chips for AI and driverless cars.
